loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a maize farmer from Kusa village in Kaduna state.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saira would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saira can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Saira, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Aliyu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mohammed, Murtala and Dauda.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Aliyu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zina

texts.ru: Зина, 45 лет, замужем, 3 детей, они взрослые, только младший живет с родителями. У Зины среднее образование, с 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Она очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве Зины на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 20 овец. На участке мерою 2,22 Га она выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход Зины составляет 10,800 сом (KGS). Зина решила развивать ее бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зина хочет вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи и построить дом для сына.
texts.en:
Zina is 45, married, and has three children who are all adults; only the youngest of them still lives with Zina and her husband.  Zina has the equivalent of a high school education, and has been a crop and livestock farmer since 1994.  She's a very responsible, hardworking woman, and currently has three cows and twenty sheep on her farm, as well as a 2.22-hectare plot of land for growing beans, potatoes, and perennial grasses.  Her monthly income is nearly 10,800 som.  

Zina has decided to expand her business and is seeking a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy three cows to increase her livestock headcount.  She plans on using her extra income due to the loan to add even more animals to her farm, which will allow her to improve her family's well-being and build a home for her son.

loans.use: buy three cows to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADENYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Belena, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration et le commerce de condiments.
Les femmes du groupe BADENYA sont à leur septième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente DJENEBOU, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. 
Elle compte acheter des sacs de sel, du grain de néré, des boites de pâte de tomate et des cartons de Cube Maggi chez les grossistes à Massigui.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
BADENYA is a group of married women who average 28 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in Belena, a village in the prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. They run restaurant activities and sell condiments.  

To meet their massive customer demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and this is their 7th group loan cycle.  

DJENEBOU is a reseller of condiments, and she is illiterate. She is the member standing second from the left in the group photo. She plans to buy bags of salt, some néré seeds, cans of tomato paste, and cartons of Maggi bouillon cubes from wholesalers in Massigui. She retails her merchandise for cash, at the market, to a diverse clientele.   

Djenebou expects to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino tiene 61 años y vive en la comunidad de Chojasivi, el cliente se dedica a la produccion de leche, trabaja desde muy temprano para cuidar su ganado y brindar el sustento a su familia Sabino quiere un credito para comprar una motobomba de dos pulgadas para poder hidratar mejor sus tierras y por ende alimentar mejor a su ganado, la esposa de Sabino es agricultora y la pareja tiene 3 hijos por los cuales haran toda clase de sacrificios
texts.en:
Sabino, 61, lives in the community of Chojasivi.  He earns a living in milk production, working from a very early hour to take care of his cattle and support his family.

Sabino wants a loan to buy a two-inch electric pump so he can better hydrate his land and, as a result, better nourish his cattle.

Sabino's wife is a farmer and the couple has three children for whom they would make any number of sacrifices.

loans.use: to buy a two-inch electric pump

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru: 45-летняя Майрам живет в столице, в городе Душанбе. Она замужняя женщина и имеет троих детей. Ее муж зарабатывает на жизнь путем перевозки пассажиров. Майрам сама занимается выпечкой тортов на заказ. В деятельности ей помогает старшая дочь. Сын Майрам является студентом. Он учится очно в Медицинском колледже. Его годовое обучение в колледже стоит около 750 долларов. Его семья сейчас накопила малую часть денег и больше не имеет финансовой возможности, чтобы накопить всю необходимую сумму для оплаты годового контракта. Чтобы решить эту проблему Майрам обратилась за кредитом. Она будет очень благодарна за поддержку, в котором ее семья сейчас остро нуждается.
texts.en:
Mayram is 45 and lives in the capital city of Dushanbe. She is married and has three children. Her husband earns a living as a driver. She works as a baker, taking orders for cakes. Her daughter helps her with this business. 

Mayram's son is a medical student. His yearly tuition is about $750 USD. His family has saved a small portion of this but is not able to come up with the entire sum to pay his tuition. In order to solve this problem, Mayram is requesting a loan. She is very thankful for the support that her family very much needs.

loans.use: to pay her son's medical school tuition

loans.name: Ximena Guadalupe

texts.es: A sus 36 años de edad Ximena es madre soltera, tiene  4 hijos de 8, 10, 13 y 16 años de edad,  de ellos todos  se encuentran estudiando, Ximena trabaja de empleada domestica  en una fabrica de leche, y también se dedica a la crianza de vacas lecheras, el crédito lo va a invertir en  la compra de una vaca mas para ordeñarla y vender este producto ya que comenta que esta es su fuente de ingresos y asi se ayuda para darles los mas indispensable a sus hijos y ella aspira que gracias a su esfuerzo sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
At 36 years old, Ximena is a single mother with four children who are 8, 10, 13 and 16 years old, and all of them are studying. Ximena works as a domestic worker in a milk factory, and she also raises milk cows.

With the loan, she will invest in purchasing a cow to milk, and to sell the milk, because she comments that this is her source of income which allows her to support her children. She hopes that thanks to her efforts, her children may finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is 24 years old, and he lives in Vanadzor City in the Lori region. Sasun is the only son in his family. He is not married, and he lives with his mother. His father is in the Russian Federation, and is engaged in seasonal construction work. Sasun is a student at Yerevan State University, studying in his second year of magistrates. He studies at the faculty of Geology, and he simultaneously works in his specialty. He works at the mine as geologist. He is a  clever young man, and says he is greatly interested in his work, which is very interesting and prosperous for him. 
Sasun is asking for a loan of 400.000 Armenian drams, in order to buy a computer and professional literature, since he is getting ready for his graduating exams. He will also write diploma work. Good professional literature and a computer are very important to Sasun.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature, in order to get ready for his graduating exams. He will also write diploma work.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза, 50 лет, вдова, мать 7 детей. У Розы среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством, около 10 лет. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Розы, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 1,32 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает хлопчатник. Также у Розы в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы. Ежемесячный доход от реализации сельскохозяйственной экологически чистой продукции составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Розы и ее детей, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Роза намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению доходов семьи и позволит взять в аренду дополнительный участок земли.
texts.en:
Roza is 50 and a widow with seven children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry for about 10 years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work and purposefulness, she currently has 1.32 hectares of her own land where she grows cotton, as well as four cows. Her monthly income from sales of organic farm products is up to 25,000 KGS.

Unfortunately, this income doesn't come close to covering living costs for Roza and her children. Therefore she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase cows and sheep to increase her head count of livestock. She intends to expand her business, which will lead toward an increase in family income and will allow her to rent additional farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows and sheep in order to increase her headcount of livestock and boost her income

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en: Bitrus is a maize farmer from Tamoga village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Bitrus, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Susana Carolina

texts.es: Susana de 21 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 2 años inicio su pequeño negocio de sala de belleza comprando algunas herramientas para iniciar, además al observar la buena cantidad de clientes con la que cuenta decidió instalar una pequeña venta de ropa para dama logrando obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 1 mes de edad. Susana desea invertir en su negocio ya que sus herramientas de trabajo se encuentran deterioradas y desea también brindar una mayor comodidad a su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tenazas, pinzas, plancha y secadoras para cabello, espejos, vitrina de vidrio y sillas.
texts.en: Susana is a 21 years old woman entrepreneur.  For the last 2 years she has had her own small beauty salon business initially buying a few tools to get started.  Also, as she noticed the large quantity of clients she had, she decided to set up a small ladies clothing sale section to be able to increase her income. She lives in her own home with her life partner and 1 month old daughter.  Susana wants to invest in her business as the tools she has to work with are starting to deteriorate and she wishes to provide greater convenience to her customers.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to be able to invest in curling irons, hair clips, flat irons, hair dryers, mirrors, glass cases and chairs.

loans.use: to invest in curling irons, hair clips, flat irons, hair dryers, mirrors, glass cases and chairs

loans.name: Jimena Mabel

texts.es: Jimena de 23 años de edad es madre soltera y una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su tienda de productos varios desde hace 4 años por lo que cuenta con una sólida clientela que siempre busca de sus productos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad que es su mayor alegría. Jimena desea seguir mejorando su tienda, pero sobre todo desea invertir en productos de la época navideña para obtener mejores ingresos y poder ofrecer a sus clientes los productos que buscan, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: luces de colores, bebidas frías, galletas, adornos navideños, etc. Para cumplir con las expectativas que sus clientes tienen de su negocio el cual se caracteriza por contar con una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en: Jimena, 23, is a single mother.  She has operated a business selling general merchandise for 4 years and has many loyal customers now.  She lives with her 3-year old daughter who is the joy of her life.  Jimena wants to make improvements to her store but, most of all, she wants to make sure she has a good range of products for her customers to buy over the holidays.  She will use this FUSAI loan to pay for Christmas ornaments, colored lights, cold drinks, snacks, etc.  The investment will help her meet local demand for a wider range of merchandise and grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Lagunaita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Lagunaita está formado por 17 integrantes, está en  el 4° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en su mayoría está con pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felipa, quien en la encuesta que se le practicó mostró un nivel de pobreza extrema. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio del ejercicio de la docencia y también de la venta de productos de limpieza, esta abriéndose camino, como un medio de ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para la elaboración de productos de limpieza, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group, called Lagunaita, is made up of 17 members and they are in their 4th cycle of the program by the committee of women.  They find themselves beneath the poverty line; most of them are even in extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Mrs. Felipa, who in a survey they were given showed a level of extreme poverty. Through her efforts and continued work earning a living teaching and through the sales of cleaning products, she is opening herself up a path to be able to overcome her situation of poverty.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her cleaning products so that she can continue fighting to better the conditions of her life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make cleaning products

loans.name: Alaxpacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALAXPACHA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de animales vacunos y porcinos, venta de mantas, venta de zapatos, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que aprendió a realizar este negocio con su tía a quien desde niña apoyaba en su negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera de Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ALAXPACHA” communal bank started their 6th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II branch. It is made up of 8 members and lead by a board of directors with Ana as the secretary. The businesses of the members are varied. Amongst them are vegetable sales, selling cattle and pigs, the sale of blankets, selling shoes and a neighborhood store.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneur of which Ana is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a store where she sells shoes. She started it a few years ago. She learned about the business with an aunt who she helped with the business since she was young.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying shoes wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesalers on the Peru Bolivia border. She will then sell them in her sales space. This method of work allows her to generate the resources she needs to support her family as she is single. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the medical services that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Raksmey is a 21-year-old student who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree in English literature in his second year at a university. He lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. Currently, he also teaches English, earning USD 8.50 per day.

Because Raksmey lacks finances to pay his university fee for a semester, he would like to request a loan. With the loan, he will be able to go through the second semester of the second year successfully and have more knowledge for his present job.

loans.use: to pay his university fee.

loans.name: Panglan Indah Group

texts.en:
The Panglan Indah Group repaid its loan backwards from the due date. This is because the price of pork is not stable. During the period of the loan, they maintain the pigs well because they always give good food and vitamins. The pigs' growth can be maximized, but because in this period many farmers  sell their pigs, prices can become unstable. It can affect their profits. Although they earn little profit, they keep the spirit to pursue this venture and still expect progress for their efforts.

The Panglan Indah Group is receiving its third loan and continue their business. This time they plan to fatten their pigs, which makes sales easy and more stable in price.

Ni Nyoman will use her loan to purchase four superior piglets. She also feeds the piglets with traditional food. She plans to sell them after five months and buy new piglets again. She hopes her plan can run smoothly and she can have more profits.

loans.use: to buy four piglets.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es: Edwin de 31 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que con mucho esfuerzo sale adelante apoyado en su negocio de venta de panes con jamón y quesadillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años y que le permite sostener la economía de su familia. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Edwin desea dar una mayor publicidad a su negocio ya que siente puede atraer una mejor cantidad de clientes por medio de un equipo de perifoneo para que más personas sepan de su negocio por medio del altavoz de este y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: un equipo de perifoneo que le permita dar una mayor publicidad a su negocio.
texts.en: Edwin, 31, is a born entrepreneur and has worked hard to build his sandwich and quesadilla business.  He started the business 2 years ago and says that it is his means of supporting his family.  He lives with his wife and 3-year old daughter.  Edwin wants to advertise his business more widely and is applying to FUSAI for a loan that he will use to buy a megaphone.  The investment will help him reach potential customers who wouldn't otherwise know about his business.

loans.use: to buy a megaphone for advertising his business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like thread and needles.

Marilyn has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like thread and needles

loans.name: Rabo

texts.en:
Rabo is a maize farmer from Nasarawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rabo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Rabo, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 65 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with helping her to obtain capital for supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Leonarda wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: In the year 2010, Fely learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it provides. As a farmer in Sindangan, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan for her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Fely feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she obtained a loan to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Fely wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie earns a living by engaging in a dried fish vending business. She hails from Mayorga, Leyte. She is married and has a seven-year-old son. To augment her income, she also sells rice to the locals in her community. She has been engaged in that business for three years.

She has requested a loan to buy more stocks of dried fish and to have additional capital for her rice retail business. These stocks will definitely help Lanie and her family, as she steadily earns a higher income. Because of the loan, she could now manage her finances and able to provide her family with nutritious diets. 

In the future, Lanie is determined to manage her business properly for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish and to have additional capital for her rice retail business.

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 50 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos, dos  mayores de edad y uno de 17 años el cual estudia en colegio. El marido no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Nancy además de ser una gran madre y esposa para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un deposito en su casa donde vende gas de uso doméstico, agua en bidón y en botellas, también se dedica a la cría de chanchos con lo cual cada vez que vende sus animalitos le quedan muy buenas ganancias, el agua y gas ella vende en su local y también su marido le ayuda en sus entregas a domicilio, el tiene un carro en el cual realiza esta actividad aunque la mayoría la vende en su depósito, lleva más de 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien. 
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar gas de uso doméstico, agua y alimento para los chanchos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les da la institución. Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The "El Nuevo Amanecer" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Manta. It is known for it's beautiful beaches that are well visited all year round and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Nancy lives here. She is 50 years old. married and from this relationship has 3 children. Two of them are adults and the other is 17 and studying in Secondary school. Her husband doesn't work because of his health.

Nancy besides being a great mother and wife works in commerce to make some money for herself. She has a store in her house where she sells gas for domestic use and bottled water and she also raises pigs. Every time she sells her animals she make good profits. She sells the water and gas at her store and her husband helps her delivering to homes. He has a car with he uses to do this, although the majority of sales are at the store. She has done this business for 6 years and things are going well.

She will use this loan to buy gas for domestic use, water and feed for the pigs. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it for the help that the institute provides. Her dream is for her son to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy gas for domestic use, water and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene makes a good living with every quarter of his coconut farm in Bintana, Tangub in the Philippines. This is his means of supporting his family. Out of the money he has saved, Rene purchased two hectares of cacao land. Now, he wishes to start his cacao farm, growing a good variety so he can boost his farming income. However, Rene is in need of working capital. He presented his project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 168,000 PHP in order to pay for seedlings, compost, fertilizers, herbicides and the labor on clearing, sticking, holing and planting seedlings. Rene has high hopes that his cacao plantation will have a good, high-quality yield and earn a promising return.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings, compost, fertilizers, herbicides and the labor on clearing, sticking, holing and planting seedlings.

location.town: Tangub - Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 71, a married woman in Sindangan Zambo. del Norte, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. Every day she never gets tired tending her store. Gloria is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without record of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Sork's Group

texts.en: Sork’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sork makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a married woman and has been running her beauty salon for the past ten years. She does her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair design. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Yasmin is a responsible mother of three children and is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business. 

Now Yasmin has requested a loan to buy more beauty products, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products to offer makeover services in her own beauty salon

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, 38, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a food stall, selling meals in front of her house. 

Hue started this business five years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food for her food stall and by buying some more products, such as confectionery and beverages to sell during traditional holidays.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food, confectionery, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es: Estanislao es un experimentado dentista (10 años trabajando en el rubro) y esta felizmente casado con una peluquera talentosa (7 años de experiencia), la pareja tiene dos hijos, son una familia estable y feliz  pero Estanislao quiere un credito para construir una pared colindante con un cerro  que esta cerca de la vivienda, este muro es importante puesto que sirve de contención en caso de un deslizamiento o de lluvias excesivas que dejen el terreno inestable Estanislao agradece que su caso haya sido considerado para publicarse en Kiva En la foto aparece Estanislao con su esposa y detras de ellos el lugar donde quieren que exista el muro
texts.en: Estanislao is an experienced dentist (ten years working in the sector) and happily married to a talented hair stylist (seven years' experience).  The couple has two children and they are a stable, happy family.  But Estanislado wants a loan to build a wall next to a hill close to his house in order to retain mudslides or excessive rainfall.  Estanislado is grateful that his case was considered for publication by Kiva.  He is pictured with his wife, and behind them is where they want to build the wall.

loans.use: To build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 35 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Она по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес в 2004 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Чынара в хозяйстве имеет: 5 коров, 8 лошадей, 50 овец. А также есть земельный надел мерою 3,5 ГА, на котором она выращивает ячмень и клевер. Дополнительно сдают в аренду часть земли и торговый павильон. Ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для последующей его реализации. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и обучение ее детей.
texts.en: Chynara is 35 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She is calm, level-headed and hardworking. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2004. Thanks to Chynara's hard work, today her farm contains 5 cows, 8 horses and 50 sheep. She also has 3.5 hectares of land, where she grows barley and clover. Additionally, she leases out part of the land and a retail outlet. Her business yields about 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Chynara requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock for subsequent resale. Chynara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy livestock for subsequent resale in order to grow her business and pay for her children's education

loans.name: Johana Nathaly

texts.es: Nathaly es madre soltera, tiene 21 años de edad y su hija tiene 3 años, Nathaly vive con su hija, una hermana y su madre, ella comenta que junto a su madre se dedica a la crianza de animales y al jornal de trabajo de agricultura, ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de terneras para criarlas y al memento de venderlas obtener algo de ganancia y esto le permite sacar adelante a su hija y apoya a su madre y hermana que asiste a la escuela.
texts.en: Nathaly, 21, is a single mother and has a 3-year old daughter.  She lives with her daughter, her sister and her mother.  She tells us that she and her mother have a business raising and selling animals.  She also works as a farm laborer.  Nathaly is applying for a loan that she will use to buy calves for her animals sales business.  The investment will ultimately provide an income that she needs to support her daughter and help her mother and sister (who is still in school).

loans.use: to buy calves for her livestock business.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Markus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Markus expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been selling timber for the last six years, and it has been profitable. He is 47 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with six children.

He will use this loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of timber to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his eighth loan term, and he has paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to expand his business, make more income, and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber to sell.

loans.name: Cindy Yamileth

texts.es: Cindy de 25 años de edad es una mujer que muestra su tenacidad para los negocios, vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogo actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años y que cada día le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 8 y 3 años de edad. Cindy desea invertir en su negocio ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y ella desea contar con una buena cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes sobre todo porque en esta temporada la demanda crece ya que buscan sus productos para darlos como regalos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lociones, desodorantes, cremas, maquillaje, etc.
texts.en: Cindy, 25, is a tenacious businesswoman.  She has operated a business selling beauty products for 3 years, buying merchandise from catalogs and reselling what she buys to her customers.  She lives with her husband and 2 children, 8- and 3-years old, and says that the business is her means of contributing to the family income.  Cindy is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to buy the products that her customers most want this time of year: lotions, deodorants, creams, make-up, etc.

loans.use: to stock her beauty products business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 25, is an agribusiness entrepreneur from Elburgon, in the Molo region of Kenya. This father of one has been actively doing this work for six good years. James makes a decent income selling milk, eggs, maize and other crops that he produces, at the local market. He is also engaged in other personal businesses to make additional income. 

Poultry farming has worked out particularly well for James, mainly because of the growing demand for chicken products and by-products. He also attributes his success to the passion and vision he has for the business. He also enjoys feeding his dairy cow and harvesting his crops. The biggest risks his business faces are outbreaks of disease and market uncertainties. 

James is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. With this money, he will expand his business by buying a brood of hens, which will lay more eggs to sell. James has nurtured a saving culture. He will use the money from this investment to build his savings account and provide his family with a balanced diet and better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 49-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children, from Isabel, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Marilyn has been in the business for more than three years now.  Her husband works as a welder operator.  

Marilyn would like to avail herself of a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, rice, cooking oil, condiments, and other items. This loan will enable Marilyn to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers to her store.  

Marilyn hopes of improving the family's livelihood in the future and saving money to support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, rice, cooking oil, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Alexander Mauricio

texts.es: A su corta edad Mauricio ya se desempeña como un joven responsable, el tiene 19 años y comenta que junto a su familia creció en el campo y que son sus padres quien le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y en la ganadería, Mauricio  necesita el crédito para comprar  toretes y asi ir formando un capital para seguir trabajando, la aspiración de este joven es de que le vaya bien en su negocio de ganadería  y  también dedicarse a sembrar huertas de los productos que se dan en la provincia donde reside.
texts.en: At his young age, Mauricio is a responsible worker.  He is 19 and says he grew up on a farm and was taught by his parents about agriculture and livestock farming.  He is in need of a loan to buy calves (bulls) and have enough capital to continue working.  This young man's goal is to succeed in his livestock business and also plant and grow crops that are consumed in the province where he lives.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of Kapomboi, Kitale. He has been practicing agribusiness for the past 10 years and has never looked back. For a living, Dominic sells milk and food products from his farm to the local market. He enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of his products and he really feels satisfied. Although Dominic has been making profits through farming, he has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge he has encountered is a lack of funds to get his business off the ground. Dominic is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kitale and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Dominic does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good; chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint. With this loan, Dominic is confident that his income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in his life. He plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. He also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on his farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Dominic will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for his farm. Through this loan, he will assure his siblings and large family of a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Orlando Ivan

texts.es: Orlando tiene 26 años de edad, es un joven  de carácter tranquilo, el vive con su madre y unas hermana que asiste al colegio, Orlando reside en el campo en un lugar muy lejano a la ciudad, por este motivo Orlando comenta que su visión es de trabajar en la agricultura y la ganadería y mas no estudiar ya que sobre todo por motivo que su no cuenta con los recursos económicos para darle el estudio a su hijo, Orlando necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de toretes para obtener sus ingresos y seguir ayudando a su madre en los gastos del hogar y apoyar a su hermana para que termine sus estudios.
texts.en: Orlando, 26, is a young man with a quiet disposition.  He lives with his mother and sisters who attend school.  Orlando lives in the country very far from the city and says this is why he has the vision to work in agriculture and livestock farming instead of continuing his education since he cannot afford to pay for it.  Orlando is in need of a loan to buy calves (bulls) to earn an income and continue helping his mother with the household expenses and to support his sister so she can finish her education.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma is a tuba (coconut wine) vendor. She produces and sells tuba to the people in her community. She is married with a 14-year-old son. She lives with her family in Mayorga, Leyte. Aside from tuba vending, she also has a food-vending business. She cooks home meals like adobo (a dish made of pork or chicken or fish with marinated vegetables), paksiw (a Filipino dish consisting of fish or meat cooked in vinegar, garlic and salt) and stewed vegetables. 

She is asking for a loan to buy tungog which gives tuba its maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation. The loan also would provide additional capital for her food-vending business so she can buy ingredients to cook a variety of meals to cater to her customers. She will then earn higher income and settle her obligations. 

Ledesma dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable to support he schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy tungog for making tuba (cocanut wine) and to provider additional capital for her food-vending business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a 51-year-old married man from Isabel, Leyte. He has five dependents. Ricardo runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people of his community. Ricardo is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and other stock for his store.  This loan will enable him to improve his stock, thus allowing him to sell more to his customers. In the future, Ricardo hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and other stock for his store.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, posee una tienda de consumo en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, en su localidad es muy reconocida por ser una persona emprendedora y responsable, el negocio lo fundo por la necesidad de ingresos en su hogar, su horario de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, sus hijos le ayudan a atender los clientes y funciona desde hace 4 años. Ana está acompañada, es madre de 3 hijos de 23, 18 y 15 años de edad.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, boquitas, dulces, especias, etc., incrementara el inventario de la tienda, tendrá todo lo necesario para competir y atraer nuevos clientes, así sus ventas aumentaran y tendrá ingresos con los que cumplirá con sus obligaciones. Los riesgos son los precios variables de la mercadería y la competencia.
Sus objetivos son ampliar su negocio, tener estabilidad económica y sobre todo brindar mejor alimentación, educación y vestuario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana has a food store where she sells basic necessities. In her community she is known as an enterprising and responsible person. She started the business to have income for her household. Her hours of work are from 6 in the morning until 7 at night. Her children help her take care of the clients. She has had the store for 4 years.

Ana is in a relationship and is the mother of three children aged 23, 18 and 15 years old. She will invest the loan that she is requesting in basic grains, juice, soft drinks, snacks, sweets, spices etc. increasing the store's inventory. She will have everything needed to compete and attract new customers. So her sales will increase and she will have income to cover her obligations.

Her risks are that the prices of the merchandise can vary and her competition. Her objective is to expand her business, have economic stability and most importantly provide better food, education and clothing for her children.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, juices, soft drinks, snacks, sweets, spices, etc. to increase the stock in her store.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en: Izolda is 63 years old, married and lives in the village of Shuamta with her pensioner husband. The family earns a living from a small agribusiness. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Izolda was unable to study a profession. During the growing season, she and her husband harvest nuts for sale at the local market. Izolda also cultivates a plot of land where she grows cereals. Because the family has only a seasonal income, Izolda has decided to start dairy farming by securing credit from local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. This startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people and inexperienced workers to get a loan to start or re-start a businesses. Her application was approved by this program for a loan of 2,000 GEL to buy a milk cow. After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products, such as cheese and yogurt, to sell. They will also use the milk products to feed the family. This Start Up credit will be a great support to the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a cow and start dairy farming

loans.name: Veronica Lizeth

texts.es: Verónica de 27 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos básicos, ropa interior y cosméticos en su hogar, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años y que le permite sostener a su familia. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos uno de 4 años y otro de 3 meses de edad. Verónica desea invertir en su negocio ya que en esta temporada navideña y de fin de año las ventas mejoran mucho y ella desea ofrecer una buena cantidad de productos a su clientela sobre todo los que tiene mayor demanda en estas fiestas,  por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas, frías, ropa interior, cosméticos, pan, pollo, especias, etc.
texts.en: Verónica, 27, has a business selling general merchandise from a space in her house.  She has operated the business for 2 years and says that it is her means of generating an income for her family.  She is a single mother and lives with her 2 children, 4-years and 3-months old, respectively.  Verónica is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to buy the products that her customers most want this time of year.  She wants to ensure that she has a good range of products to meet the demand that she expects and says that, among other merchandise, she will buy drinks, snacks, underwear, cosmetics and grocery products.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Saba's Group

texts.en:
Saba, age 30, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market that is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, and fabric. This is very important for him in order to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife, Saba, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan. Saba is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan. (Saba is wearing black shawl in the picture.)

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and tailoring materials for her husband's tailoring work.

loans.name: Señor De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEÑOR DE LAGUNAS” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de internet, venta de pollo, venta de mantas, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de chinelas, venta de herramientas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chuño y papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace veinte años, después de haber apoyado a su familia, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SEÑOR DE LAGUNAS" is beginning its fourth Pro Mujer loan cycle through the social center, Los Andes.  It is comprised of eight members and its board of directors is chaired by Máxima, the president.  The businesses the members are involved in vary and include: internet services, chicken sales, blanket sales, freeze-dried potato sales, sandals sales, tool sales, food sales.

The loan will benefit small business owners, including Máxima.  She says this is her second year in Pro Mujer and she joined by invitation through a representative of the institution who visited her at home.  The business she currently runs is sale of freeze-dried potato and potatoes, which she started 20 years ago.  After having worked with her family she decided to establish herself independently.

The current loan will be used to increase her work capital to buy wholesale potatoes and dehydrated potatoes from wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz.  She will then sell them at her sales stall.  This work method allows her to generate an income to support her family economically.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says it is the health area and training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and "chuño" (freeze-dried potato), wholesale.

loans.name: Sonia Piedad

texts.es: Sonia es una señora de 62 años de edad, ella se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda general, ella comenta que no tiene hijos ni nunca se caso debido a que es muy cariñosa con su madre y que al verla que se estaba quedando sola y se estaba  haciendo viejita decidió quedarse acompañándola y asistiéndola en lo que necesite, Sonia va a invertir el crédito en la compra de productos de tienda y de este negocio aspira mejorarlo y por ende  aumentar sus ingresos y a la vez cuidar a su madre que ya tiene 85 años.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 62 year old woman, and she works in her business which is a general store.

Sonia comments that she does not have children, and she never got married because she has always cared for her mother. When Sonia saw that her mother was by herself and was getting older, Sonia decided to stay to accompany her mother and to help her with what she needs.

Sonia will use the loan to purchase store products and she hopes to improve her business in order to increase her income and to take care of her mother, because her mother is 85 years old.

loans.use: to purchase store products.

loans.name: Fausto Miguel

texts.es: Fausto es un joven de 21 años de edad que vive en el campo y que comenta que sus padres le enseñan que la vida se la gana con el trabajo honrado y que debe ser un joven responsable, Fausto se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, el crédito lo necesita para comprar abono que les pone  a sus cultivos para que estén sanos y obtener buenas cosechas, lo que Fausto aspira es seguir trabajando y salir adelante con su trabajo arduo.
texts.en:
Fausto is a young man who is 21 years old. He lives in the fields, and he says that his parents taught him that one makes a living with honest work, and that he must be a responsible young man.

Fausto works raising cattle and in agriculture. He needs the loan to purchase fertilizer to apply it to his crops so that they can be healthy and so that he can have a good harvest.

Fausto aspires to continue working and to get ahead with his hard work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Yaser Group

texts.en:
Yaser 22 Mayo is a group of four women who live in the city of Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Amlak is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in a humble house in the middle of Taiz. Selling different kinds of accessories and clothes door to door is her only business. Her income is a small and not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the family. 

Amlak works hard to expand her business but she needs financial support to get ahead. In order to receive that, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to buy various kinds of accessories, perfumes, and clothes to resell, hoping to attract a lot of customers.

Amlak hopes to enlarge her business through opening a store for selling all kinds of new clothes and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of accessories, perfumes, and clothes to sell in hopes of attracting a lot of customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase paint, varnish, oils and other tools.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es el mayor de dos hermanos, empezó a trabajar desde adolescente hasta llegar a alcanzar su meta de trabajar en un banco, su objetivo es seguir creciendo en el ámbito financiero, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad.
Su sueño es culminar la carrera con éxito. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera para poder culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marcos is the older of two brothers. As a teenager, he began working to reach his goal of working in a bank. His objective is to continue growing in the financial field, so he is studying toward an accounting degree.

His dream is to successfully complete his degree. He is requesting this loan in order to pay tuition for his degree program so that he can finish his education.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a married woman with five children from Mayorga, Leyte. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 8. She raises and sells pigs to earn a living. Her husband earns income as a machine shop technician.
  
Lenie is asking for a loan to buy piglets and materials for pig pen renovation like wood, cement, nails and steel rods. The renovation would create a suitable place for the pigs to live. She will be providing the pigs with nutritious food and a better shelter.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable

loans.use: to buy piglets and  materials for pig pen renovation like wood, cement, nails and steel rods

loans.name: Mario Efigenio

texts.es:
Mario, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por que está en la etapa de recolección de granos básicos y necesita pagar mano de obra para los trabajos tapisca y el transporte de la misma hacia su casa, tendrá alimento para su familia y abastecerá a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ha ayudado a mejorar la productividad de granos básicos, su familia se mantiene, la diferencia es que en la actualidad tienen mejor alimentación, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Mario decided to apply for another loan because he is in a stage where he is collecting basic grains, and he needs to pay the labor for the corn harvest jobs and to pay to transport the corn to his home so that he can have food for his family and supply his clients with corn.

His previous loan helped him to improve the productivity of the basic grains and to support his family. The difference is that now his family is better fed, and they have better health and education.

loans.use: to pay for labor for the corn harvest jobs and to transport the corn to his home so that he may have food for his family.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with three children. She is a farmer, and her business has been profitable for the four years that she has engaged in it. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and educate her children. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona is a 46-year-old married woman from Isabel, Leyte. She has been engaged in hog raising for more than 11 years now. This is her source of income. Rona is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and also to buy animal feed. This loan will enable Rona to improve the productivity of her hog-raising business, thus allowing her to sell her animals to the market after several weeks. In the future, Rona hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Rosenita

texts.en: Rosenita is a 58-year-old married mother of four grown-up children from Isabel, Leyte. She runs and operates a small sari-sari or variety store business selling goods like rice, noodles, condiments, beverages, detergents and toiletries.  Rosenita has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Rosenita earns additional income through a hog-raising business. Rosenita is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, condiments, bread, biscuits, toiletries, soap, detergents, soda, beverages and animal feed. This loan will allow her to improve her store’s inventory which will attract more buyers to her store.  In the future, Rosenita hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, condiments, bread, biscuits, toiletries, soap, detergents, soda, beverages and animal feed

loans.name: Mbayuwayu Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his early 40s, is married with five children who are still at school.  He has been running a general store since 2006.  He works from 6 a.m.to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Charles' sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the general store stock and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, rented a farm to grow crops and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to  buy more stock for the general store.  He dreams of leading a better life.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group "Mbayuwayu" which consists of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the general store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is an ambitious man and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of milk in his area. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. Charles lives with his wife and says that they only want to have more children when they are sure that they can raise them without worry of where their next meal will come from, or forcing them to leave school because they can't provide for them. Charles owns a small plot of inherited land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for more than 10 years. He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses. He needs to improve his income level, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Charles passionately loves dairy farming and, as he likes to put it, “dairy farming is close to my heart.” He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will produce between 10-20 liters of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and also go towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from cow manure which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, all attending school. She lives in own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Gladys Eulogia

texts.es: Gladys es madre soltera, ella tiene 25 años de edad, y 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años, de los cuales el mayor ya a asiste a la escuela, además Gladys esta esperando la llegada de su tercer hijo que le faltan 3 meses para nacer, Gladys vive en la casa de sus padres con ella sus hermanos y sus hijos, Gladys se dedica a trabajar al jornal  y a la crianza de animales, el crédito lo necesita para comprar vaconas que al pasar el tiempo se hagan vacas den cria y se las pueda ordeñar y con la venta de la leche aumentar sus ingresos para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Gladys, 25, is a single mother and has two children, ages 3 and 5.  The eldest attends school, and gladys is expecting a third child in three months.  She lives with her parents, siblings and children.  Gladys is a day laborer and also raises livestock.  She is in need of a loan to buy dairy calves so when they grow into cows she can sell the milk and increase her income for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Yusuf Jimmy

texts.en:
Yusuf Jimmy is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf Jimmy would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf Jimmy can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yusuf Jimmy expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide family with food and clothing, and in the long run to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ali would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ali can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Ali expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing, and in the long run to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Tabitha, Ruth, and Esua.  

In the past, in order to pay her pressing expenses, Saratu would typically have sold her maize soon after harvest, but at a low price. However, she is now a member, and with help from Babban Gona and this loan, Saratu can store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more. 

When asked, Saratu spoke of not only her hope to make more money for herself and her family but also her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak is a 29-year-old student who is studying engineering. He is in the second semester of the second year of the program. He is from the Banteay Meanchey province of Cambodia. In addition to his studies, he has also worked for a phone company since 2014 making USD 12 a day. 

Since he is short of finances to pay his tuition fees, he would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, Vannak will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully to achieve his goals. His dreams for the future include being a good engineer and saving money to build his own house. He also wants to pursue a master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 57 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Denia runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar.

Denia has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Denia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a saw and a router to build beds, closets, bedside tables, consoles and mirror frames.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una persona con muchas metas previstas, está casada y tiene dos hijos, actualmente está enseñando, aspira a capacitarse más, con este nuevo título que va a recibir de licenciada en ciencias de la educación aspira ser una mejor  profesional y obtener más lugares de trabajo. Es una mujer que quiere seguir creciendo y capacitándose, es por ello que sigue estudiando y luchando cada vez mas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Ana is a person with many planned goals. She is married with two children, and she is currently teaching. She aspires to train herself further, and with this new title that she is going to receive to be licensed in education in the sciences she aspires to be a better professional and obtain work in more places. She is a woman that wants to continue growing and training herself, and for this reason she continues to study and struggle more. 
She requests this loan to be able to invest it to pay for the university fees for her degree, so that she is able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es: Ezequiel tiene 67 años de edad, vive con su hijo menor pero tiene casa propia, el cliente se gana la vida como chofer de transporte publico, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde que salió del colegio y quiere un credito para reparar su movilidad que es su unica fuente de ingresos, aunque Ezequiel percibe una renta de jubilacion el monto no alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades Debido a su edad, Ezequiel tiene miedo de que le roben el auto pero espera que puedan ayudarle y agradece que su caso haya sido publicado en kiva
texts.en:
Ezequiel is 67 years old and he lives with his youngest son, but he has his own home. He makes a living as a public transportation driver, and he has worked there since he left school.

Ezequiel wants a loan to repair his vehicle, which is his only source of income. Although Ezequiel receives a retirement pension, the amount is not enough to cover his needs. Because of his age, Ezequiel is afraid that his auto may be stolen. He hopes that he may be helped, and is grateful that his case has been published through Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, trabaja como empleado de una empresa privada, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando la madera del techa ya que se encuentra picada, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de madera, laminas y pago de mano de obra para que el y sus hijos puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Carlos is 45 years old and he lives in a home of his own with his two children. He works at a private company.

Carlos wants to improve his home by replacing the wood on the roof because it has many holes in it. However, his income is not enough to be able to replace the roof.

This is why he is requesting a loan to purchase wood, metal sheets and to pay for the labor so that he and his children can live more safely.

loans.use: to purchase wood, metal sheets, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is married, has five children and is a cattle farmer. As a housewife, she needed something by which to generate income. Since they had cows at home, she decided to pay closer attention to them so that they could generate milk enough for home consumption and for sale. 

Jolly will use the loan to buy two dairy cows from which she will get milk to sell, since she has a ready market. The income will help to repay the loan and also meet household needs. She is an innovative and resilient woman who is committed to maintaining the Kiva partnership.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is 21-year-old student living with his family of three members. He is a university student majoring in anthropology and going for a bachelor's degree. 

He hopes to get the loan so he can pay his semester fees and help his parents with expenses as he dreams to continue his studies and go for a master’s degree.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 54-year-old widow and a mother of five grown-up children from Isabel, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. For more than five years now, Teresita has been earning an income through this business. Now she is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, rice, noodles, bread, biscuits, soap, toiletries, detergents and other stock. This loan will allow Teresita to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice, noodles, bread, biscuits, soap, toiletries, detergents and other stock.

loans.name: Al- Ez 22 Mayo Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Ez 22 Mayo and consists of four women from Taiz city, Yemen. They have asked for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Siham is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, living with her family in miserable conditions. She is an employee with a private university, with a small salary which is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. Her husband works for a daily wage. The house where  Siham and her family live lacks of a lot of home appliances and furniture. Siham has asked for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances and furniture for her house.

Siham hopes to complete the furnishing of her house.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances and furniture for their house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cover the cost of labor for weeding, pay for security of the field, and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Marlene Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Manuela Cañizares se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Marlene, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 16, 15, 12, 7, 6 y 3 años de edad, tres estudian en colegio y dos en escuela. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña Marlene es una muy buena esposa y madre que hace lo posible por darles lo mejor a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de materiales de pesca como por ejemplo redes, anzuelos, piolas, plomos, arpones,  entre  otras muchas cosas que se requieren para realizar una buena pesca en alta mar, ella también le vende estos materiales a su marido el cual se dedica a la pesca para lo cual también utilizan parte del crédito, lleva ella 3 años con su negocio con el cual ayuda a su marido a  sacar adelante su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar anzuelos, redes y otros materiales de pesca. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con el crédito financia su  negocio. Sus sueños son comprar una lancha para la pesca.
texts.en:
The "Manuela Cañizares" communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of its inhabitants are very hardworking and earn their livings working at sea.

In this place lives Marlene. She is 34 years old and married. From that relationship, they have six children who are 16, 15, 12, 7, 6, and 3 years old. Three of them are in secondary school and two are in primary school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Doña Marlene is a very good wife and mother who does all that she can to give her children the best. She earns her living selling fishing supplies such as, for example, nets, hooks, lines, weights, harpoons, and many other things that are necessary for good fishing on the high seas. She also sells these supplies to her husband, who earns his living fishing; they will use part of the loan for that as well. She has had her business for three years, and it enables her to help her husband provide for their family.

This loan is for buying hooks, nets, and other fishing supplies. She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because with the loan, she can finance her business. Her dream is to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy hooks, nets, and other fishing supplies to sell

loans.name: Jimna

texts.en:
Jimna wants to fulfill her dream of completing a degree. 

Every semester, Jimna has religiously paid attention to earning good marks. However, she has begun another school year, and Jimna requires additional funds to pay for her school fees. 

Jimna also makes and sells snacks in her neighbourhood, helping her cover some of her expenses. 

Jimna has big dreams of helping both her family and siblings, which is why she works hard for her education.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Carmita Magdalena

texts.es: Carmita es una señora que formo su hogar con un señor que se dedica a la agricultura y con el que tiene 2 hijas, esta familia vive en el campo y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, el crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca, ya que comenta que este es un buen negocio por que se ordeña las vacas y ya tiene leche para venderla y asi obtiene sus ingresos, Carmita vive con su esposo, su  hija y una nieta, la aspiración de Carmita es comprar mas vacas y mejorar su negocio y tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida de de su familia.
texts.en:
Camita is a woman who has made her home with a man who works in agriculture, and with whom she has two children. This family lives in the countryside, and they work in agriculture and raising cattle. 

She needs the loan to purchase a cow, because she says that milking cows to sell the milk and to earn an income is a good business. Carmita lives with her husband, her daughter and a granddaughter. 

Carmita hopes to purchase more cows and to improve her business, and to try to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
