Anecita works hard to support her family. Anecita is married and has a business farming coconuts in the Philippines.

Anecita has been in this business for 15 years now. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she is requesting another loan to further build her business.

Anecita would like to take a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase fertilizers and other varieties of coconuts.

In the future, Anecita would like to save money to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, all attending school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years selling goats and goat meat. She faces a major challenge of diseases and transportation in her business.

With the loan of 15,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase seven goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats for resale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Monica has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat. She faces major challenges of disease and transportation in her business. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 that she is requesting, Monica wants to purchase 20 goats to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 goats to sell.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed is a 55-year-old married mother of six sons. Her husband is a government employee. She started a clothing sales business to help support her family. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profit from her home. 
She needs to purchase some clothes to sell but lacks funds. So, she has requested a loan from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Naheed is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell from her home

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim is a 19-year-old university student who is studying banking and finance in the first year. She is from Kampot province in Cambodia. Her parents are rice farmers and they also make bamboo baskets and other big containers to sell. Because she doesn’t have enough money to pay her university fees for four years, Sim would like to secure a loan. This loan will help her graduate successfully and have skills for her future job. For Sim’s future dream, she wants to work in a bank with a reasonable salary so she will be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Vichara

texts.en: Vichara is a 19-year-old university student who is studying business administration in the first year at university in a province. He lives in Svay Reang province in Cambodia. His father is a rice farmer and his mother is a grocer. Due to a shortage of finances, Vichara has decided to request a loan to pay his tuition fees for four years. With this loan, he will earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For his future job after graduation, he wants to work in a bank.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es: Marilyn tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 6 años y trabaja en un hotel,es una persona muy trabajadora vive en un su casa en alquiler en la zona de Nor Yungas (Pacallo) ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente al servicio de camarera. El comienza sus actividades desde las 8 de la Mañana y termina a las 15:00 en la localidad de Nor yungas de la ciudad, Marilyn necesita un credito para adquirir  poleras y blusas que piensa vender en su tiempo libre, Marilyn quiere tener una vida mejor y espera que ustedes puedan ayudarla
texts.en:
Marilyn, 23, is the single mother of a six-year-old child.  She works in a hotel and is a very hardworking person.  She earns a living mainly as a waitress in Nor Yungas, starting work at 8 a.m. and finishing at 3 p.m.  She rents her home in the Nor Yungas (Pacallo) area of the city of La Paz.

Marilyn needs a loan to buy t-shirts and blouses, which she plans to sell in her spare time.

Marilyn wants to have a better life and she hopes you all can help her.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell in her spare time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the latrine, which is in bad condition, and provide his family with better hygiene and security.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 26 years old and has run a retail shop for the past two years. Her spouse provides additional income to support the family and together they have been blessed with two children. 

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more household goods, such as cups, plates, spoons and cooking stoves, to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business and educate her children. 

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. She hopes to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy household goods to sell.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is thankful that she was granted a PHP 35,000 loan which she used to buy farm inputs and supplies (seed and fertilizer) needed in her business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply now for a PHP 40,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Julita dreams of being able to give her children the best education possible, in order for them to have a bright future. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and married. Virginia has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Virginia has been trading in livestock for seven years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Salome works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Salome is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pig-fattening business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Salome has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Darna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Darna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Darna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Maritza Beatriz

texts.es:
Maritza, vive con sus padres y un hermano que está estudiando bachillerato a distancia (modalidad de estudio de fin de semana),  tiene un puesto en el que vende sandalias, chancletas y otros productos, trabajo en un supermercado por dos años, pero fue despedida, por recorte de personal y con las prestaciones pagadas inicio su propio negocio, el cual está funcionando desde hade un año, ya tiene mucha experiencia y eso le evita tener problemas en su administración.
Comprará sandalias y chancletas para ambos sexos, abastecerá su negocio con mercadería que sus clientes necesitan en la época navideña, considera que las ventas aumentaran y las ganancias serán mejores, así pagara su deuda y continuara contribuyendo en los gastos familiares.
Sus sueños son agregar nuevos productos a su negocio, tener un puesto en el mercado de la localidad y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maritza lives with her parents and a brother who is studying for a high school degree in the "distance Baccalaureate" program (weekend study). She has a sales post where she sells sandals, flip flops, and other products.  She worked in a supermarket for 2 years, but she was let go when the company downsized, and with the benefits paid she started her own business.  She's had the business for a year, and so she already has a lot of experience, which helps her to avoid problems with the business.

Maritza will use this loan to buy sandals and flip flops for men and women, stocking up her business with the merchandise that her customers need for the Christmas season.  She thinks that her sales and earnings will increase, and so she will be able to pay off her debt and continue contributing to the family's expenses.  

Maritza's dreams are to add new products to her business, obtain a sales stall in the market in her town, and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Husam

texts.en: Husam is 21-year-old student living with his family of three members. He is a university student with a major in marketing and is going for his bachelor's degree. Husam chose this major based on the labor market. He hopes to get the loan so he can pay for his semester fees and help her parents with their  expenses as he dreams to continue his studies and go for a master’s degree.

loans.use: To pay semester fees

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos, cultiva maíz, frijol y hortalizas, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijas, todos dependen de él, la siembra de granos básicos  la práctica desde hace 30 años, lo trabaja de manera personal en horarios de siete de la mañana  a tres de la tarde y lo aprendió de sus padres.
Utilizará el financiamiento para comprar fertilizantes, abono y semilla mejorada de granos básicos y hortalizas, se limitara a comprar lo más importante;  así llevará acabo su sueño de ampliar la parcela de cultivo de hortalizas, lo cual será de beneficio para tener una cosecha abundante.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio, cancelar sus deudas y dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos grows corn, beans and vegetables. He lives with his life partner and their daughters, and they all depend on him. He has worked growing basic grains for 30 years, and he works from seven in the morning to three in the afternoon, a practice that he learned from his parents.

Carlos will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, manure and improved basic grain and vegetable seeds, and he will only purchase the most important ones. This year, he will accomplish his dream of extending his vegetable crop land, which will be helpful with an abundant harvest.

His dreams are to maintain his business, pay off his debt and to give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure and improved basic grain and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Maria Rocio

texts.es: Rocio es una señora de 35 años de edad, ella esta casada con un señor que trabaja de chofer, sus 3 hijos tiene 8, 10 y 13 años de edad y asisten a estudiar, Rocio trabaja de empleada domestica y además se dedica a la crianza de animales, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar terneras para obtener un ingreso mas, de este negocio  espera mejorarlo y seguir trabajando para  todo lo que necesiten sus hijos sobre todo le gustaría en algún memento comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Rocio is a 35 year old woman. She is married to a man who works as a driver, and her 3 children are 8, 10 and 13 years old, and they go to school. Rocio works as a domestic worker, and she also raises animals.

With the loan money, she will purchase calves to earn more income. She hopes to improve her business, and to continue working for everything that her children need. Above all, some day she would like to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es madre soltera, ella vive con su hijo  en una casa por la que para arriendo, Carolina se dedica a la crianza de animales desde dos años atrás, su hijo tiene 4 años y ya esta estudiando, el crédito lo necesita para compra pollos y tenerlos en un pequeño corral, la aspiración que ella tiene es de seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en: Carolina is a single mother who lives with her child in a house that she rents.  She's had a business raising animals for 2 years.  Her son is 4 years old and is already in school.  She will use this loan to buy chickens which she will put in a small corral.  Carolina aspires to continue working and improving her business for the welfare of her child.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Angola Group

texts.en:
Velentina is a 42-year-old widow who has 4 children and cares for 5 orphans. She sells different products such as tomatoes, cassava, and onions. 

Valentina started her business in order to financially support her family by both providing them with the basic needs and paying their school fees. She will use her loan portion to boost her business. 

Valentina hopes to build a house, which she will rent out, and dreams of improving her family's living standards. She has experienced a positive change since she started obtaining her microloans. To date, she been able to build 2 houses for her family members.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her food stock.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon is a 29-year-old married factory worker with two children from the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has been a worker for nearly two years. Both of her children attend school and her husband is a 31-year-old rice farmer. Together, they can earn USD $10 a day to support the family. Thon has to travel to work every day so she has decided to take out a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. With the motorcycle from the loan, she will be able to reduce traveling expenses and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she is going to help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Samnang is a 19-year-old freshman who is studying management and leadership at a university in the province. He is from Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. His parents earn their main income from their rubber tree plantation. Because he is short of finances to pay his university fees for four years, he has decided to secure a loan. This loan will help him earn a Bachelor’s degree and have skills to find a job. After graduation, he wants a job earning a decent salary to save money to have his own business.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and married. She was blessed with two children and they are happily living in a rural community. She has been assigned to manage the school canteen for almost eight years now. She offers grocery items, school supplies, and cooks meals and snacks that she sells in the school canteen. 

She aspires to acquire more goods to sell, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail an additional loan of PHP40,000 to buy the said grocery items, school supplies, and ingredients she needs to cook and sell. 

Being a patient and industrious mother, Elizabeth believes that she will be able to make her business more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, school supplies, and ingredients needed

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Melita is a 43-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte.  She engages in a food vending business.  She makes and sells bread and donuts - a type of fried dough confectionery or dessert food.  Donuts are usually deep-fried from a flour dough, and typically either ring-shaped or without a hole and often filled. 

She has five children. Three of them are still attending school. She has been engaged in a bakery for five years now. Her husband is an electrician.

She has requested  a loan to buy more supplies like flour, sugar, leavening agent, and other ingredients.These ingredients will be used in making donuts, and she will sell them in her local community. 

She will be able to  manage her finances and other obligations. She can provide her family with good food and better living conditions.

In the future, Merlita  dreams to expand her business to make it successful for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like flour, sugar, leavening agent, and other ingredients

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 58 years old and married. She was blessed with three children, and they are currently living in a rural community. She has owned and managed a small retail store for almost seven years now. She aims to further improve her store and offer more kinds of grocery items, but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance amounting to PHP15,000 to buy more stock of canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, noodles, seasonings, snack foods, eggs, and soft drinks to sell. 

Through patience and hard work, Norma believes that she will be able to make more improvements in her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, noodles, seasonings, snack foods, eggs, and soft drinks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has a computer services shop in Tala town and has been running this business for two years. She does photocopying, scanning and emailing services as well as photo processing and it has been profitable. She is 34 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. 

She will use this loan to expand her business by buying another computer for use. This will enable her to serve more customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy another computer for use in her business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda runs a small retail store to help her husband in gaining income. She is 48 years old and has five children. Her youngest is still attending school while the others are married. Glenda aims to improve her store to gain a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy soft drinks, sugar, beverages, canned goods, noodles, seasonings and snack foods to resell. With this financial assistance, she believes that someday, she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, sugar, beverages, canned goods, noodles, seasonings and snack foods to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods including cooking oil, noodles, sugar, eggs, coffee, shampoo, and bath soap.  She is a 35-year-old married mother of nine children. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 1. Her husband earns a living through fishing. It has been more than 10 years now that she has been engaged in business. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries like canned goods, noodles and beverages. This stock will be used to attract more buyers to come to her store and purchase and her earnings will slowly improve. Maria could then provide for the needs of her growing children, especially nutritious diets and better shelter.

She dreams of improving her business productively and supporting the schooling of all her children so they have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries like canned goods, noodles and beverages

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell fish. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to  buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
51-year-old Nilda is a vegetable vendor. She sells vegetables like squash, cabbage, tomatoes, and spices like onions and garlic. She is married woman with two grown children living in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She has  selling vegetables for more than 10 years already.

Nilda is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables like squash, cabbage, tomatoes, and onions. This variety of vegetables will caused to augment her income. Nilda could sell a huge volume of vegetables and spices to her perspective customers. In this way, she will be able to gain a higher profit and start to settle her obligations.

Nilda hopes that she will manage her current business properly for the improvement of the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like squash, cabbage, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is from the municipality of Estancia in Iloilo. She is 58 years old with one adult daughter. Grace is an owner of a sari-sari (variety) store which is attached to her home. This has been her business for 16 years now. 

She is asking a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, seasoning, toiletries, beer, candies, chips and biscuits. Grace plans to expand and improve her store someday to increase the customer base and increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beer, seasoning, toiletries, candies, chips and biscuits

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 53 years old, and from the town of Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with five children who are already grown. With her husband, Marissa started on a buy and sell business of religious statues and relics 25 years ago. 

She is asking a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy more religious relics and statues to sell. 

It is her dream to be become successful in this business, and to earn better so she can live in comfort when she is old. 

Her profit will be utilized to buy healthy food for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy religious statues and relics

loans.name: Irma Maribel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Manuela Cañizares se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Irma, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad.
Doña Irma es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  ella también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres días por semana pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas es más fresco y se le hace más fácil salir a vender sus prendas, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva más de 34 años dedicada al comercio con  el cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Manuela Cañizares meets every 15 days in the region called Jaramijo. This location is known for its beautiful beaches. Here the majority of inhabitants are very hardworking and make a living from sea jobs. 
Irma lives in this area. She is 52 years old, married and from this marriage has one adult child who is independent. Her husband works in a factory in the city. 
Irma is a very good wife, who in order to help her husband with home expenses works selling clothing of all types. Her means of selling is going door to door. She also sells in her home, where her most regular customers come. She works three days per week but especially in the mornings since during these hours it is cooler, which makes it easier for her to go out and sell her clothes. She gives credit to her customers and collects each weekend. She has spent 34 years dedicated to the business, with which she earns her own living to help her family. 
This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing. She has worked with the Credit Group since its founding and she likes it because the loans have helped her greatly. Her dreams are moving forward.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buy-and-sell fish. Susan is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to  purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fsihing net.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Aisha operates a grocery vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of a high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools for masonry work.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow with five children, all attending school. Her family lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for past year, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Mulwa

texts.en:
Mulwa is married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase two sacks of maize and beans to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of maize and beans

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of seven children, all attending school. Her family lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over two years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase motorcycle to work as a driver

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Tatu has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables, like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, Tatu wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and sweaters for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is a 28-year-old married man and a father of two children, ages 2 and 5. Hamed lives with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. He has a university education and works as a teacher at a private school earning a small salary. To supplement his income, Hamed bought a taxi to transport people to different places around Sana'a, hoping to improve the living conditions of his family. Over time, his taxi broke down and needs repairs. His salary doesn't allow him to do that. Therefore, he applied for a Youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase spare parts to make the necessary repairs on his taxi.
Hamed hopes to send his children to a school and open a saving account for them in a bank.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to make the necessary repairs on his taxi.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old, single man. He lives with his six-member family in Marka. 

Ahmad’s father used to pay for Ahmad's university fees, but recently he has been facing some financial trouble, which led Ahmad to request a loan. The loan will help him to cover the next semester's fees, so he can continue with his studies in banking and finance.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 47 years old. She is widowed and supports 4 members of her family. She has 4 children who are now all adults.

Florence sells chickens, a business she has been doing for the last 26 years. She is able to earn a monthly income of 26,700 KES.

Florence has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous loan. She wishes to now borrow 20,000 KES which she will use to purchase more stock of chickens. With her anticipated profits, Florence will be able to not only repay this loan but also buy even more stock.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a wholesale supplier of chickens to her town and surrounding area.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salon products and meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lornh has been selling fish for the last 20 years and the business is doing well. She earns a monthly income of KES 48,000 to support her family.

She has applied for her fourth loan of KES 32,400 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more fish to sell. Lorna will use the anticipated profit to build a house for her family.

In the future, she dreams of growing her business and being financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 42 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with seven children. She has a tailoring shop and has been running the business for 20 years and it has been profitable. She is also a poultry farmer.

She will use this loan to buy textile materials for making dresses, blouses, shirts and trousers. She will also buy more poultry to raise. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business by buying more textile materials. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to open another tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy textile materials for making clothes and poultry to raise.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert has a dairy shop in Tala, Kenya and has been running this business for 2 years now. He is 32 years old, and he and his spouse have been blessed with 2 children. 

Robert will use this loan to buy milk containers to package the milk he supplies to his customers. He will use his anticipated profits to expand his dairy business. 

This is Robert's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In future he hopes to not only have a prosperous business but also be able to educate his children to the tertiary (ie. college) level.

loans.use: to buy milk containers.

loans.name: Krezza

texts.en:
Krezza 25 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Krezza is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to  buy bamboo, plastic rope, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Krezza has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, plastic rope, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, rope, etc for her fishing business.

Mila has been in this business for five years. Mila earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, rope, etc

loans.name: Temirlan

texts.ru: Темирлан, 40 лет, женат, отец 3 дочерей. Образование высшее, Темирлан работает милиционером. Также занимается животноводством и полеводством, он добился очень хороших результатов, есть 6 дойных коров, 2 бычка. На участке мерою 3,50 Га он выращивает клевер. В Банк «Бай - Тушум» Темирлан обратился за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока и корма для скота. На прибыль от кредита Темирлан планирует увеличить своё хозяйство. Он поделился, что в будущем планирует приобрести автомобиль для своей семьи.
texts.en: Temirlan is 40 years old, married and a father of 3 daughters. He has a college education. Temirlan works as a policeman. He is also involved in animal husbandry and farming and achieved very good results in this business - he has 6 dairy cows and 2 bulls. He also grows clover on 3.50 hectares of land. Temirlan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk sales volume, and also to buy livestock feed. Temirlan plans to use the profit from the loan to grow his business. He shared with us that he plans to buy a car for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows and feed for livestock

loans.name: Agali Awamu Kiyinda Group

texts.en: Wilberforce lives in a rural area where the major economic activity is farming of both food and cash crops. There has been a challenge in his village where people moved miles to take their corn and millet to a milling machine. Having identified the need, Wilberforce, using his meargre savings bought an old milling machine from a friend, which has since served the area and also brought him income. However, because the machine is old, it keeps breaking down, slowing his business and at times it jams. Wilberforce has therefore decided to acquire a loan to buy a new milling machine that will serve the community efficiently and will certainly raise Wilberforce's income. He is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a milling machine

loans.name: Juan  De Jesus

texts.es: Juan de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado lechero y adicional a eso se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Juan esta solicitando un credito para la compra de terneros para engorde y asi seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is 57 years old and he lives in a house of his own with his wife. 

He has worked for many years raising milk cows and also growing corn and sorghum. He sells his products around the area where he lives. 

Juan is requesting a loan to purchase calves for fattening to be able to continue with his work, which earns him a good income.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening.

loans.name: Fernando Javier

texts.es: Fernando es un joven que a su corta edad que son 18 años se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de animales, el comenta que vive solo, ya que sus padres se separaron y no pudo seguir sus estudios, el crédito lo necesita para comprar pollos, la aspiración de Fernando es de mejorara su negocio y salir adelante solo.
texts.en:
Fernando is a young man who, at his young age of 18, works as a day laborer and raising animals. He says that he lives alone because his parents separated and he was unable to continue studying.

He needs the loan to purchase chickens. Fernando hopes to improve his business and to get ahead on his own.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married to Robert and together they have been blessed with four children between 18 and 7 years old. Her spouse provides additional income for the family.

Irene trades plastic products and containers for used clothing and shoes, which she sells. This is a business she has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs 15,500.

Irene has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 20,000, which she will use to buy stock of plastic products and containers.

With the anticipated profits, Irene will be able to repay her loan as well as her children's school fees.

Her hope and dream for the future is to be financially stable

loans.use: to buy stock of plastic products and containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stock items (sugar, salt, soda, corn flour, rice, and soap, among others).

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 20, and the youngest is 15. She engages in a hog-raising business. She sells hogs to earn a living. She also engages in an rtw (ready-to-wear) business and sells pants, shorts, t-shirts, whole dresses, and many others. In addition to that, Rebecca also does farming. She grows and sells rice.

She has requested a loan to buy a pig and pig feed, and for additional capital to purchase a variety of rtw. These tools are very essential in improving her livelihood. She will be able to purchase more rtw to resell to her respective customers.

In this way, she could now slowly manage her finances and continue sending her children to school. Rebecca is hoping that she will be able to handle it properly to be successful and would change their status of living.

loans.use: to buy a pig and pig feed, and to purchase a variety of ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma and her family are currently living in a rural community. She is 43 years old and has two children attending school. Together with her husband, she aspires to improve their status of living to give their children a better living.

She owns and manages a small retail store, while her husband works on their farm. She wants to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of grocery items and some fruits and vegetables to resell.

Through this financial assistance, Vilma believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items and some fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mrie

texts.en:
This is Mrie and her husband, Zef. They are an elderly couple who are seeking your financial help to repair the leaking roof of their house. They both receive a retirement pension, each of them receive $144/month. In addition to these amounts, Zef works as a security man in a nearby company from which he receives some money. Their only son, who has been living in Italy for more than 15 years, sends them a flat amount of $300/month.

Their house is over 40 years old and has never been repaired. Lately, it has started leaking from the ceiling and the windows are old and made of wood and, because they have never been changed, they let the cold inside.

Kindly note, that Mrie, the borrower, has been a longtime client of VisionFund Albania (VFA) and, of course, has kept very good standards.

loans.use: to repair a leaking roof.

loans.name: Gladis Beneranda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Manuela Cañizares se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladis tiene 57 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen nueve hijos,  7 mayores de edad y dos de 14 y 12  años que estudian en colegio y viven con ellos. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca y gia turístico.
Doña Gladis es una gran esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene una lancha en la cual se dedica a pasear a los turistas que llegan hasta las playas locales a divertirse, el los recoge en el muelle de la localidad y los lleva mar a dentro a conocer los más bellos lugares  de la costa local la cual ofrece mucho hermosos paisajes que son  el deleite de sus clientes, en ocasiones el también se dedica a la pesca, ya son más de  30 años que él lleva en esta labor con lo cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas  y combustibles. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven de mucha ayuda.  Sus sueños son tener una lancha más grande y nueva.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Manuela Cañizares meets every 15 days in the region called Jaramigo. This location is known for its beautiful beaches, and the majority of the inhabitants here are very hardworking and make a living from sea jobs.
Gladis lives in this area. She is 57 years old and maintains a common-law marriage from which she has nine children, 7 of whom are adults and two who are 14 and 12 years old, who are students and live with her. Her husband works as a fisherman and tour guide. 
Gladis is a good wife who is applying for the loan so that her husband can use it in his job. He has a ferry boat in which he carries tourists that come to the local beaches for vacation. He picks them up at the town's dock and leads them out into the deep to find the most beautiful places on the local coastline which offer many beautiful landscapes that are the delight of his customers. Occasionally he also engages in fishing. He has already spent more than 30 years in this line of work, with which he earns a living to support his family. 
This loan is to buy nets, string and fuel. This is Gladis's third loan cycle with the Credit Group and she likes it because the loans help her greatly. Her dream is to have a bigger and newer boat.

loans.use: to buy nets, string and fuel

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase computer parts and accessories needed in her internet café. She is glad that, through her earnings, she has been able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Rowena successfully repaid her previous loan and would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for the repair and maintenance of her computers. She is positive that she will have good returns on her investment since it is school time once again. She thanks both God and you in advance for the financial help that will be extended to her. 

Rowena aims to have more branches of her internet café. She hopes that her children will finish their studies and earn college degrees. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Carmen Alba

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Manuela Cañizares se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres  de  15, 14 y 12 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia en colegio y dos en escuela. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña Carmen es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para los gastos que representan los estudios de sus hijos, ella en su casa tiene un deposito  de venta de agua en  bidones y galones, colas, cervezas, entre otras bebidas, vende en su casa y también entregan a domicilio para esto le ayudan sus hijos y su marido cuando están desocupados de sus labores. Lleva 4 años con este negocio el cual le deja muy buenos beneficios.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua en bidones y en todas las variedades. Lleva 4 ciclos en este Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Manuela Cañizares" communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of its inhabitants are very hardworking and earn their livings at sea.

In this place lives Señora Carmen. She is 41 years old and married. From this relationship, they have five children. Two are adults and three are 15, 14, and 12 years old. One of them is in secondary school, and two are in primary school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Doña Carmen is a woman who has always liked working for the expenses related to her children's educations. At home, she has a shop selling water (in gallons or large jugs), soft drinks, beer, and other drinks. She sells from her house and also provides home delivery; her children and her husband help her with that when they are not busy with their own work. She has had this business for four years and it provides her with very good profits. 

She is going to use this loan to buy all varieties of large containers of water. She has been in this communal bank for four lending cycles and she likes it because of the help that the loans provide. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy all varieties of large containers of water

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 30 years old and has four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her brother is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. He is unable to generate any amount of income and wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. Due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. 

Shazia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her brother cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This loan will help him continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her brother

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгуль, 28 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей школьников. У Бактыгуль среднее образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, на ежедневной основе она продает экологически чистое, домашнее молоко, также занимается полеводством. На участке мерою 6,30 Га Бактыгуль выращивает фасоль и эспарцет для реализации. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 10 овец с целью разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгуль будет использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на образование своих детей.
texts.en: Baktygul is 28, married, and has two school-aged children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and farms for a living.  She has two dairy cows, two calves, and sells organic, homestyle milk on a daily basis in addition to growing crops.  On a 6.30-hectare plot of land, she grows beans and sainfoin as cash crops.  To further develop her farm, Baktygul has requested a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy two cows and ten sheep for breeding purposes and to increase her headcount of livestock.  Baktygul will use her extra income due to the loan to develop her farm, and also wants to set aside money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy two cows and ten sheep to invest in her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, 25, is a striking, young Nandi man from Kitale, a remote location in Kenya. This ambitious father of two has one goal in life and that is to succeed. Daniel started farming five years ago and his primary income source has been milk and maize farming. He is thankful to God that his business has been profitable so far. Daniel is seeking a loan to jump-start horticulture farming. Land in Kitale is very fertile, so the major challenge facing farmers like Daniel is usually weed management. In a country characterized by food insecurity, Daniel sees a big opportunity to start a business growing vegetables and other food crops. He is currently unable to put up the money to get the horticulture farm going because of the high cost of farm-inputs such as equipment, seed, and fertilizer. For that reason, he is counting on your consideration to make his dream come true. With your loan, Daniel will realize his dream and contribute in a small way towards the fight for food security in Kenya.

loans.use: To start a horticulture farm.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 55 years old and has seven children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a rickshaw driver, which he has been doing for six years. His rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost. 

Suriya requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her son cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This loan will help him to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Al- Wesal Group

texts.en:
Al- Wesal is a group consisting of 4 women living in the city of Hodeidah, Yemen. They have applied for an 80,000 YER loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

The group's leader, Samira, is a 31-year-old married woman who lives with her family in their small house. Even though their living conditions are miserable, she does not surrender to her situation. Instead, she has decided to help her husband with some of the family's necessary expenses by making a traditional incense which she sells in her area to the local residents. However, she requires funds to start this business.

For this reason, Samira has applied for her 20,000 YER loan portion from AMB to purchase the necessary materials to make and sell this traditional incense.

Samira's dream is to have her own store selling all kinds of women's accessories, cosmetics, and incense.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials to make and sell traditional incense.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Chet is 50 years old and a married rice farmer with three children who lives in Takeo province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 1980. Two of the children work in a factory and her husband is a 63-year-old rice farmer. For the income, they can make $15 a day. Now Chet would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for the two children to commute to work. This loan will provide them with better traveling conditions. For her future plans, she is going to pave under her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for the two children to commute to work

loans.name: Lugano Group

texts.en:
Mayasa, who is in her early 30s, is married, with two children. One child is still in school and the other one is still small. 

Mayasa has been running a beauty salon for ten years now. She works from 7:00am to 9.30pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mayasa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to extend the salon shop and to buy salon products. She dreams of building her own house.

Mayasa will share this loan with her loan group, Lugano Group, which consists of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to extend her salon shop and to buy salon products.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 33 years old. She is widowed and supports her 3 children, aged 13, 11, and 9 years. 

Lilian has a business selling sausages and smokies, which she has been running for the last 11 years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Lilian has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the requested 30,000 KES to buy additional supplies of smokies, sausages, paper wrappings, as well as peanuts to sell to her potential customers.

With her anticipated profits, Lilian will be able to not only repay this loan but also pay her children's school fees.

Lilian's hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of sausages, smokies, paper wrappings, and peanuts.

loans.name: Mariama Cherif's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 01 décembre 2009, le banc villageois est composé de femmes qui ont su au fil des cycles tissé des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. De même accroître leurs expériences  dans le programme et dans leurs activités respectives malgré des conditions assez difficiles  très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices de revenues. Tous les membres du groupement vivent dans le même  village et ont comme activité le petit commerce accompagné de l’élevage et de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Mariama  (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère 07 enfants dont quartes filles et trois garçons, elle est âgée  de 38 ans. Elle fait de l’embouche bovine et caprine, pour se faire elle les bêtes dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone pour la revente plus tard à un prix plus intéressant dans son village et les hameaux environnants.

Son nouveau prêt, désire acheter un veau de 70 000 et 02 chèvres de 10 000 à 12 500 Fr CFA.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte mieux participer dans la gestion des besoins  de sa famille par la prise en charge des dépenses liées à la santé, la nourriture, et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created on December 1, 2009. It consists of women who have built strong ties of solidarity and support over time. They have also managed to expand their experience within the program and in their respective activities, and despite challenging circumstances they remain deeply committed to developing income-generating activities. All members of this group live in the same village; they practice small trade, animal breeding and rain-fed farming.

Mrs. Mariama (standing at the far right and raising her hand) is the featured borrower from the group. She is married with seven children, four girls and three boys. She is 38 years old. 

Mariama practices cattle and goat fattening; to that end she buys the animals at the local weekly markets and sells them for a good price at a later date, in her own village and neighboring hamlets. She will use this new loan to buy a calf for 70,000 FCFA and two goats for 10,000 to 12,500 FCFA.

She will use her profits to better contribute to the management of her family's needs by covering expenses pertaining to healthcare, food, and the children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy a calf for 70,000 FCFA and two goats for 10,000 to 12,500 FCFA.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has a retail shop in Tala town and has been running this business for eight years. She is 63 years old, widowed and she has four children. 

She will use this loan to expand her business by buying liquid chemicals for making soap detergent. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy liquid chemicals for making soap detergents.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
For the last 11 years Lucas has been selling scrap metals and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).He is married to Dorcas and blessed with four school-going children.

He has applied for his fourth loan of 81,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more scrap metals for sale.


Lucas will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metals for sale

loans.name: Leamor

texts.en:
Her name is Leamor, 39, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Angelo, a hotel housekeeper, and she has two children who are both in the elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school. 

Leamor operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 800 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She expects a higher demand for her grocery items this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and for a good return on her investment. This will surely help her support her family's daily needs. 

Leamor hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Nidia Del Pilar

texts.es: Nidia es una señora de 32 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 12 y otro de 15 años de edad  y ellos asisten al colegio,  su esposo trabaja al jornal de trabajo del campo, Nidia y su esposo  tienen  nacionalidad  colombiana y dice que en Ecuador es mas bueno vivir ya que hay mas fuentes de trabajo y no existen enfrentamiento, Nidia va  a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de una vaca para mejorar su negocio y asi sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nidia is a 32-year-old woman who is married and has two children that attend school, ages twelve and fifteen. Her husband works as a day laborer doing fieldwork. 

Nidia and her husband are from Colombia and they say that it is better living in Ecuador, because there are more sources of work and there is no conflict. 

Nidia is going to use the money from the loan to buy a cow to improve her business, so she can support her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more Lycra clothing, blouses, shirts, dresses for girls, etc in bulk.

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is 35 years old. She is married to Peter and together they have been blessed with two children who are 15 and 7 years old, respectively. Peter is a businessman, and hence provides additional income for his family.

Annastasia sells groceries, a business she has done for the last two years, earning a monthly income of Kshs 10,000.

Annastasia has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 15,000, which she will use to add to her stock of groceries.

With the anticipated profits, Annastasia will be able to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to grow her business to the extent of meeting her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
For the last 18 years Clementina has been in the retail business where she sells a variety of goods and earns a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is married to Martin and blessed with four school going children.

She has applied for her fourth loan of 27,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of assorted goods to sell.

Clementina will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Tedy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis septembre 2013,il regroupe en son sein des femmes qui ont un point commun c'est à dire la solidarité pour le remboursement de leur prêt.

Tedy en position assise et levant le bras,sur le flanc gauche est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 49 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 06 enfants dont 04 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes et de poissons.Elle pratique ce type d'activité  depuis plusieurs années.Elle s'approvisionne au marché de kaolack pour venir revendre dans son village.

Elle compte acheter 02 paniers de poissons à 25000f le panier et des légumes pour une valeur de 80000f.

Son objectif est de développer son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group, created in September 2013, brings together women who share a common goal: solidarity in repaying their loan. 

Tedy, the woman sat to the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's star borrower. She is a 49-year-old married mother to six children; two sons and four daughters.

She earns a living from selling vegetables and fish. She has carried out this activity for several years. She gets her supplies from the market in Kaolack, which she then resells back in her village.

She plans on purchasing two baskets of fish at 25,000F per basket and 80,000F's worth of vegetables.

Her goal is to further develop her business and to be able to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fish

loans.name: Shehab

texts.en:
Shehab is a secondary school student who is a 28-year-old, single man, living with his parents in a small house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He reads hard for his classes and hopes to get a high degree in the secondary school, to help him enter a good major in the University. In truth, he is very dynamic and responsible young man who needs a lot of promotion, but his parents couldn't cover his study fees in the school because their income is very limited and not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the house. 

Shehab has a great determination to get good living conditions. He decided to start his own business by opening a store to sell phone accessories, cell phones, compact discs, music players, and all computer accessories. Unfortunately, he faces a financial problem that prevents him from achieving his humble business, but he didn't surrender to this problem and he applied to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank, asking for a loan of YER 1,500,000 to purchase an amount of phones and computer accessories for his store, in order to sell them to the customers. 

Shehab looks forward to opening a saving account in a bank that will help him to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an amount of phones and computer accessories for his store.

loans.name: Santa Ines

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Manuela Cañizares se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, 5 mayores de edad y la menor de 16 años la cual estudia en colegio, todos sus hijos viven con ellos. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña Santa es una mujer muy luchadora que hace lo posible para ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella tienen un local en su casa allí vende yogurt,  aguas en botella, galones, colas, cervezas y muchas otras bebidas, vende en su local y también entrega a  domicilio más que todo el yogurt y el agua ya que cuanta con muchos clientes que siempre le compran, ella lleva 4 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual se dedica a la pesca.
Este crédito es para comprar yogurt, agua, colas y materiales de pesca. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio,  Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Manuela Cañizares meets every 15 days in the region called Jaramijo. This location is known for its beautiful beaches. Here the majority of inhabitants are very hardworking and make a living from sea jobs. 
Santa lives in this area. She is 41 years old, married and from this marriage has six children, 5 adults and one minor who is 16 years old and is a student. All of her children live with her. Her husband is a fisherman. 
Santa is a tenacious woman who does whatever possible to help with expenses in the home and education of her children. She has a store in her home where she sells yogurt, bottled water, gallons of milk, soda, beer, and many other beverages. She sells in her store and also does home delivery, mostly with yogurt and water since many customers regularly buy these. She has carried out this business for 4 years and it has allowed her to succeed. She will also give part of the loan to her husband who works as a fisherman. 
This loan is to buy yogurt, water, soda and fishing materials. Santa has worked with this Credit Group for 4 years and likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy yogurt, water, soda and fishing materials

loans.name: Efulayimu

texts.en:
Efulayimu is a cattle farmer as well trader. He has been in this kind of business for many years - giving him skill and experience. Income from this business has helped him to pay tuition for his children and also meet his other family needs.

He has requested a loan to buy cattle that he will sell and earn profit to pay for his children's tuition since they will be starting school next month. He is hard working and thanks Kiva lenders for the job well done.

In the photograph is Efulayimu with the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to buy cows to trade.

loans.name: Efrance

texts.en:
Efrance is a hard working lady from Kakoba Cell in the Mbarara district.  She is married and has two children under her care besides three more children she supports in their education.  Personally she never studied but has been struggling in small businesses to earn a living, given that she is almost the sole bread winner.

She is also a trader in first hand clothes for both men and women. She has been meeting a number of challenges which include changes in fashion and design and high competition in the market.

She came to Ugafode Mbarara branch for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX which is intended for buying more stock that is of latest fashion such that she can attract more customers.  She is really shrewd at the business and she only hopes for the best. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the vision of alleviating poverty.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Hernan Antonio

texts.es: Él es Hernán un veterano de 72 años amante del campo, por motivos que no quiere nombrar para no despertar lastima si no admiración por su capacidad de levantarse de grandes inconvenientes, le toco mudarse a la ciudad, donde fiel a sus raíces inicio un negocio de venta y cría de aves, Hernán es un hombre soltero que solo se refugia en su negocio de aves para seguir teniendo un plato de comida en su comedor, necesita tu apoyo para construir un corral de pollos y abastecerlo con aves.
texts.en: This is Hernán. He is a 72-year-old veteran and a lover of the countryside. For reasons he does not want to name in order to not evoke sympathy, rather admiration for his ability to rise above significant challenges, he decided to move to the city where loyal to his roots he started a business selling and raising birds. Hernán is a single man who only finds refuge in his bird business. In order to continue having a plate of food on the table, he needs your help to construct a chicken pen and stock it with birds.

loans.use: to construct a pen for his chickens and stock it with birds in order to improve his profits.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with three adult children. Mildred finds joy in attending to her sari-sari (variety) store business, which has been in existence for twelve years now. She also ensures that her husband’s tricycle is properly maintained and functioning well for additional income.

Mildred is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy another motorcycle for another unit of tricycle, and also stock for her store such as canned goods, candies, biscuits, chips, shoe polish, insect repellent, bleaching agent, cuticle remover, and matches.

In the future, she hopes to keep a store with a high inventory level to keep her customers coming.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle, and also stock for her store such as canned goods, candies, chips, shoe polish, insect repellent, bleaching agent, cuticle remover, and matches.

loans.name: Ulzhon

texts.ru:
Улжон 55 летняя жительница района Шахритус. Шахритус находится на юго-западной части Таджикистана. Шахритус самая теплая точка Республики. Улжон проживает здесь давно. Она мать героиня, у нее шестеро детей. Улжон пережила сметь мужа, для каждого человека потеря любимого человека нелегко принять. Но она нашла в себе силы жить дальше ради своих детей, ради семьи.
    Улжон в  родном районе занимается земледелием. Этой деятельностью она занята уже 6 лет. В этой работе ей нравится, то что она может заработать своим честно нажитым трудом.
   На данный момент все сельские жители уже закончили посев урожая, и Улжон не стала исключением. Она закончила посев и сейчас ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по той причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Ulzhon is a 55-year-old resident of the Shahrituz district. Shahrituz is located in the south-western part of Tajikistan. Shahrituz is the warmest part of the Republic. Ulzhon has been living here for a long time. She is a mother heroine and has six children. Ulzhon lived through her husband's death. It is difficult for every person to deal with a loss of a loved one, but she found strength in herself to live for her children and her family. Ulzhon is involved in farming in her native district. She has been in this business for 6 years. What she likes about this work is the fact that she can earn a living with honest labor. At the present time, all of the rural residents finished their crop sowing, and Ulzhon is no exception. She completed her sowing and now needs to treat the soil with mineral fertilizers in order to obtain a rich and quality harvest. She is short a small amount to money to buy the necessary quantity of mineral fertilizers, and this is why she requested this loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat the soil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour for his small bakery

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
le bv nguerane a été crée depuis septembre 2013.Il est composé de femmes issues de la même localité et ont comme objectif de combattre la pauvreté.Leur activité principale est le commerce.
Fatou,qui se trouve à l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle set âgée de 53 ans, veuve et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons.
Fatou pratique le commerce.Elle a de l’expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.Elle mène ses activités au sein de sa localité.Elle fréquente aussi le marché hebdomadaire de Missirah.
Elle compte acheter 10 sacs d'arachide a 7500f le sac,20kg de tomate 200f le kg et 01 sac de choux a 6000f le sac.
Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d’épargne et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en: The Bv Nguerane was created in December, 2013. It is made up of women from the same area and has the goal of combatting poverty. Their principal business is commerce. Fatou, on the far right in the photo with her hand raised, is our star borrower. She is 53 years old, a widow, and mother of seven, four of whom are boys. Fatou is in commerce. She has been in this domain for a long time. She runs her business at the heart of her area. She also frequents the weekly market in Missirah. She plans to buy 10 sacks of peanuts for 7,500 XOF/sack, 20 kg of tomatoes at 200 XOF/kg, and one sack of cabbage at 6,000 XOF/sack. The profit will allow her to increase her level of savings and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, tomatoes, and cabbage

loans.name: Yama's Group

texts.fr:
Le bv Nguerane a été crée depuis septembre 2013.Il est composé de femmes issues de la même localité .Elles sont liées par la caution solidaire et ont comme activité principale le commerce.
Coura se situant a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras, est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est âgée de 34 ans ,marié et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons.
Coura pratique le commerce depuis plusieurs années.Elle s'active dans la vente d'arachide.Elle achète auprès des producteurs pour ensuite revendre au sein de sa localité et des villages environnants.
Elle compte acheter 437.5 kg d'arachide à 160f le kg.
Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra non seulement de consolider son activité mais aussi de réfectionner sa case et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: The Bv Nguerane was created in December, 2013. It is made up of women from the same area and has the goal of combatting poverty. Their principal business is commerce. Coura, on the far right in the photo with her hand raised, is our star borrower. She is 34 years old, married, and mother of five, three of whom are boys. Coura has been in commerce for several years. She sells peanuts. She buys from farmers in order to sell at the heart of her area and surrounding villages. She plans to buy 437.5 kg of peanuts at 160 XOF/kg. The profit will allow her not only to consolidate her business but also to restore her space and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de arroz desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi continuar con el cultivo par tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man, whose face is pixelated because he is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, has made a living cultivating rice for the past 10 years. He sells his products in the surrounding areas. He lives in his own house with his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, pesticide, etc. in order to continue cultivating so that he can earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
C e groupe est créé depuis novembre 2013,il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.Les membres sont solidairement liés pour la responsabilité du crédit.

Fatou qui se trouve à l'extrême gauche de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 34 ans et mére de 03 enfants dont 02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes,elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années.
