Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter des légumes pour une valeur de 50000f.

Son objectif est de constituer un fonds pour acheter des moutons.
texts.en:
This group was created in November, 2013, and is composed of members who live in the same village. They run small businesses. The members are all connected by the responsibility of the loan.

Fatou, who is on the far left in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is married, 34 years old, and a mother of three, two of whom are girls. 

Her business is selling vegetables. She has been doing this for several years.

Her goal is to establish a fund to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new bicycle. She will replace her work equipment so that she can expand and carry out her routes.

loans.name: Mame Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis novembre 2013,il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et sont solidairement responsables.Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Fatou qui se trouve à droite de la  photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 45 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons.

Son activité est la transformation de l'arachide en pâte,elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter 02 sacs de 50kg  d'arachide à 80000f le sac .

Avec le bénéfice réalisé,elle compte assurer l'éducation de ses enfants,augmenter son épargne et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group was created in November, 2013, and is composed of members who live in the same village and are all responsible. They run small businesses.

Fatou, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 45 years old, married, and a mother of four, three of whom are boys. 

Her business is making peanuts into peanut butter. She has been doing this for several years.

With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg sacks of peanuts at 80,000 XOF/sack.

With her profit, she plans to pay for her children’s schooling, increase her savings, and help with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanuts to make into peanut butter

loans.name: Maty's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis janvier 2011,il regroupe les membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Penda qui se trouve à l'extrême droite et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 52 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Son activité est le commerce de sucre et d'arachide,elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type de vente.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 10 sacs d'arachide à 15000f le sac et 02 sacs de 50 kg de sucre à 20000f le sac et supporter des frais de transport pour 7500f.

Son objectif est d'assister ses enfants en supportant leurs frais scolaires et aider son mari dans le ravitaillement de la nourriture.
texts.en:
The members of this group, created in January 2011, live in the same village. They earn a living through small-scale retail businesses.

Penda, the woman standing to the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's star borrower. She is a 52-year-old married mother to five children; two sons and three daughters.

She earns a living through selling sugar and peanuts. She has a lot of experience in selling these products.

With this loan, she is planning on purchasing 10 sacks of peanuts at 15,000F per sack and two 50-kg sacks of sugar at 20,000F per sack. There are also additional transportation fees amounting to 7500F.

Her goal is to support her children through paying for their school fees and to assist her husband in paying for food for their family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and sugar

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.es:
María es una trabajadora, preocupada y responsable mujer de 41 años de edad, lo único que tiene para mantener a sus dos hijos menores de edad es esa miscelánea que con tanto esfuerzo ha constituido, como se aprecia en la foto es un local, construido en madera muy modesto pero dicho negocio les permite solventar sus necesidades básicas.
Ante la separación de su esposo esta maravillosa mujer asumió los gastos del hogar y trabaja largas horas para generar los ingresos suficientes para su familia. 
Pensar en una universidad en el momento es algo que parece tan lejano, pero en medio de su preocupación que esporádicamente se convierte en llanto, le surgió la idea de acudir a una entidad que confiara en ella, y es así como llego a Interactuar, donde solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido como lo es, productos de aseo personal, cosméticos y accesorios.
Apoya a esta mujer, que quiere hacer posible mejorar sus condiciones de vida de ella y sus hijos, y porque no a su hijo de 17 años de edad permitirle soñar con estudios universitarios.-
texts.en:
María is a hard-working, concerned and responsible woman who is 41 years old. All she has to take care of her two under-aged children is this corner shop, which she has set-up with so much effort. The store appears in the picture, built very modestly with wood. The business allows them to afford their basic needs.

Faced with the separation from her husband, this wonderful woman took over the household expenses and she works long hours to generate enough income for her family.

To think about university right now is something that seems so far off, but amidst her worrying that sporadically turns into sobbing, the idea came to her of turning to an organization that would have confidence in her. This is how she arrived at Interactuar, where she is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of personal hygiene products, cosmetics and accessories. 

Support this woman, who wants to improve her and her children's living conditions. Why not let her seventeen-year-old son dream of studying in university?

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kitavi

texts.en:
Kitavi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase some goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children. Her son owns a small business where he sells ready-made garments at a shop. He purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them at a profitable price to his customers.

The ladies of their town like his garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because during the current winter weather, people are demanding warm clothes. Her son pays for all of his expenses from his earnings.

Parveen requested a loan so that her son can buy a greater variety of garments to fulfill the demand. She wishes for a bright future for her children, and her dream is to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ready-made garments for her son's business

loans.name: Segundo David

texts.es: Segundo  es un joven  activo,  el se dedica  al jornal de trabajo del campo desde 5 años atrás, y además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, Segundo va a invertir el crédito en la compra chanchos, la aspiración de Segundo es mejorar su negocio seguir trabajando y formar un buen futuro ya que piensa comprase una casa.
texts.en:
Segundo is an industrious young man. He has been making a living working as a day labourer in the fields for the last five years. In addition, he raises small farm animals. 

Segundo will use the loan to buy pigs. 

Segundo's aspiration is to improve his business, keep on working, and build a good future since he is thinking about buying a house.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Edilmar

texts.es:
Edilmar tiene 31 años, es padre soltero, vive con sus padres e hijo en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Edilmar se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cuyes, patos, gallos, pavos, etc. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para su negocio, esto le servirá para que el tenga mayor variedad y productividad, con un gran impacto en su negocio. Con esto Edilmar espera mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edilmar is a 31-year-old single father. He lives with his parents and his son in the District of Zaña in Chiclayo Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Edilmar lives in a community that is known for trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding.

He raises and sells animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, turkeys, and other livestock. This loan will be used to buy a large quantity of animals for his business, which will lead to greater variety and productivity. This will have a great impact on his business. Edilmar hopes the loan will increase his earnings, improve his income, and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap and clothing.

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Ratana is a 24-year-old student who is studying as a management major in his second year at university in a city. He is from Takeo province in Cambodia. His father is a construction worker, and his mother is a farmer cultivating rice and fattening cows.

Because Ratana is short of finances to pay his university fees for three years, he has decided to apply for a loan. With the loan, he will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree and find a job to help his parents.

For his dreams after graduation, he wants to work in microfinance or a bank.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Adama Hawa

texts.fr:
Ce membre a adhéré au programme depuis juillet 2011,elle vit dans un village,elle est mariée,est âgée de 32 ans et mére de 07 enfants.

Son activité est la vente de légumes,elle la pratique depuis plus de dix ans.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter 02 fois dans le mois des légumes pour une valeur de 300000f.

Elle a pour objectif d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This member became a member of the program in July 2011. She lives in a village. She is married, 32 years old, and a mother of seven.

Her business is selling vegetables, which she has been doing for more than ten years.

With her loan, she plans to buy vegetables twice this month for a sum of 300,000 XOF. 

She has the goal of helping her husband with the family’s expenses and to reinforce her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase quintales of corn and lime.

loans.name: Tujikomboe Kitopeni Group

texts.en:
Kassim, who is in his mid 30s, is married with one kid who is still small. He has been running a genge (grocery stall) business for five years now. He works from 6:30 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kassim's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables for his genge. He dreams of building his own house.

Kassim will share this loan with his loan group "Tujikomboe Kitopeni" which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables for his genge (grocery stall).

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is age 34 and still single. 

She has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost two years and she earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. 

Due to insufficient funds of her business, Rosemarie would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 20,000, to purchase beverages, canned goods, cooking oil, and bread to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, cooking oil, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Dessire

texts.es: Dessire es una joven de 21 años de edad, dedicada a su almacén misceláneo en el que comercializa artículos para el cuidado personal, detalles, fragancias, cremas corporales y accesorios, alterno a esta actividad también se encuentra vinculada a las ventas por catálogo.  Estas actividades las inició en el año 2012,  fue inspirada por su mamá quien también se dedica a esta misma labor, en pro de generar ingresos adicionales para el hogar.  Dessire dedica doce horas diarias a su negocio, ella está muy comprometida con su trabajo porque desea cumplir con la meta a largo plazo de independizar el negocio del hogar, ella necesita hacer un local comercial para mejorar la imagen de su negocio.  Sus compras las realiza a sus proveedores quienes le han ofrecido facilidad de pago por tener capital insuficiente para surtir su negocio, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará colonias y perfumes, cremas corporales y cosméticos.  Esta inversión favorecerá las ventas y con ello las utilidades.  Dessire es madre de una niña de un año de edad a quien desea brindarle un excelente porvenir.
texts.en:
Dessire is a 21-year-old young woman. She is dedicated to her miscellaneous market in which she sells personal care items, details, fragrances, body creams, and accessories. Alternating with this activity, she also finds herself connected to catalog sales. She began these activities in the year 2012. She was inspired by her mother who also makes a living from this same work, with the benefit of generating an additional income for the home.

Dessire spends twelve hours a day with her business. She is very committed to her work because she wishes to meet her long-term goal of separating her business from her home. She needs to open a store to improve the image of her business. She makes her purchases from her suppliers who have offered her an ease of payment because of having insufficient capital to supply her business. 

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by means of which she will purchase colognes and perfumes, body creams, and cosmetics. This investment will promote sales and thus profits. 

Dessire is the mother of one girl who is 1 year old, to whom she wishes to provide an excellent future.

loans.use: to purchase colognes and perfumes, body creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un joven hombree de 23 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y se dedica al servicio técnico a celulares.
Él es independiente, fuerte, motivador, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural que se mantiene como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo. Las construcciones del lugar son mayormente antiguas y no cuentan con servicios básicos.
Javier es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Vive sólo, su mamá radica en el exterior, su casa está construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con electricidad, no tiene agua potable y compra agua de camión cisterna que pasa una vez a la semana. “el camión cisterna pasa 1 vez a la semana por el lugar a veces, no lo encontramos y nos quedamos sin agua…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, él desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para cumplir su sueño. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que está construyendo su casa. 
Es por esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable, en su baño, cocina y lavandería para cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Javier is a young man of 23 years. He is single and has no children. He works as a mobile phone technician.

Javier is independent, strong, tenacious, responsible and hard-working. He works in the rural area of Sacaba. The community economy is based on producing grains for the city - here cereals, vegetables, fruits, corn, wheat, barley, plantains, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches and other crops are grown. The buildings here are generally old and do not have access to utilities.

Javier has dark skin, is short, and has short dark hair and brown eyes. His mother tongue is Quechua, which he speaks with his family. He also speaks Spanish in daily life and at his work. Javier lives alone. His mother lives abroad. Javier’s house is made of bricks and has metal sheeting for a roof. The house has electricity but no running water. He buys water from a lorry that comes by once a week. “The lorry passes by here once a week but sometimes it doesn’t come and we are left without water,” Javier says.

Javier’s dream is to finish building his house. He wants to have running water in his kitchen, bathroom and laundry to achieve this dream. This is Javier’s first loan with Emprender in four years of building his house.

For these reasons Javier is applying for a loan to have running water in his bathroom, kitchen and laundry and thereby achieve his dream.

loans.use: to have running water in his bathroom, kitchen and laundry and thereby achieve his dream.

loans.name: Ulpiano Sr

texts.en:
Ulpiano Sr owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic household commodities like noodles, eggs, chips, seasonings, salt, biscuits, cooking oil, powdered milk and bath soap. In addition to that, he also engages in the fish vending business. He sells fresh fish to the people in his community. He is a married man with a 21-year-old son. He lives in Mayorga, Leyte.

He is asking for a loan to buy a variety of fresh fish, a weighing scale and foam for fish storage. Ulpiano Sr will be able to sell a larger variety of fish to his customers. In this way, he will start to gain higher earnings and be able to settle his obligations.

In the future, he is determined to do his best by expanding both his sources of income successfully in order for him to continue to send his child to college for an education and become sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fish, a weighing scale and foam for fish storage.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 45 years old and chose to be single. She manages a small eatery within the town proper to generate income. She dreams of improving her business and making it viable and profitable in the future. She wants to cook and offers more recipes to her customers but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP 7,000 to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell. Through this financial assistance, Lilia believes that someday she will be able to improve the business and satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and other ingredients needed

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maria Sarbelia

texts.es:
María, utilizo el préstamo anterior para comprar materia prima para la tienda y la venta de pupusas, con ello mantiene el negocio en el mercado, tiene ingresos para pagar su deuda y está construyendo una casa nueva para tener un hogar más seguro.
Requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en granos básicos, aceite, gas propano, especias, azúcar, etc., tanto para la tienda como para la venta de pupusas, así aprovechara la temporada de fin de año para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María used her previous loan to purchase primary materials for her store and for her pupusa shop. This allowed her to maintain her business in the market, earn income to pay off her debt, and begin building a new home in order to have a more secure living space.

She needs another loan to invest in staple grains, oil, propane gas, spices, sugar, etc. for her store and for her pupusa shop. She would like to take advantage of the end of the year in order to earn more money.

loans.use: to invest in staple grains, oil, propane gas, spices, sugar, etc. for her store and for her pupusa shop.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a 55-year-old married man and the father of three grown up children from Palompon, Leyte. He is engaged in the retail sales of medicines and food supplements. Felix has been in the business for more than 20 years now. He also earns an additional income through his vulcanizing shop business. Felix is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like medicines and food supplements and materials for his shop like screwdrivers, nuts and bolts, lubricating oil and fuel. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like medicines and food supplements and materials for his shop like screwdrivers, nuts and bolts, lubricating oil and fuel.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 56 years old. He is married with 6 children aged between 5 and 25 years old, and all of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been for two years. After getting his loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from his maize harvest will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with four children; three of them attend school, while the fourth one is too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay her for goods taken on credit. 

Rukia decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of 25,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to replenish her stock of groceries to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a polishing machine, pliers, framing squares among other tools for construction.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with one child. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuff of maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Masika dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil to sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kizito

texts.en:
Kizito is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited who applied for a loan of UGX 3,500,000. He runs a small shop dealing in bags, in a trading center on the Mbarara outskirts and he has been doing this for more than three years. 

The purpose of the loan is to re-stock his business, so that he can increase his earnings to meet his family's needs, pay tuition for his siblings, and develop himself. 

Kizito is an honest and very hard-working man, but he is always limited by capital. He intends to shift from a smaller room to a bigger room in Mbarara town, where he says turnover and profit margins are higher than where he is currently operating.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items to sell.

loans.name: Faton

texts.en:
Faton wants to thank all of the lenders for the first loan he was given, which he used to purchase a cow. He is still involved in agriculture and has been pleased with his success from the loan and the process.

Now, he is requesting a loan for the second time in order to renovate the stable and purchase a calf. He is optimistic that this loan will help his economic situation greatly since he will be able to sell milk and dairy products in his area, the southern part of Kosovo.

His goal is to further expand his farm and have more cows. He appreciates the lenders' continued support of Kosovo.

loans.use: to renovate his stable and purchase a calf

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica desde hace 15 años al cultivo de maiz y frijol el terreno esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, bonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder empezar a realizar la siembra y asi poder tener mejores ganancias con las ventas que va a realizar.
texts.en:
Juan, 42, lives in his own home with his wife and their daughter. For the last 15 years, he has been making a living growing corn and beans in a plot of land located where he lives.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, inorganic and organic fertilizers, pest control products, and the like, so he can begin sowing and, in this way, be able to generate better profits from his sales.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inorganic and organic fertilizers, pest control products, and the like.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie, 39, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Erwin, a caretaker/ hog farmer, and has two children, both in school at the elementary level. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their children's schooling. 

Richie operates a tricycle transport business and has a small general store. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Cavite, the tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes  to market, church, to their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. Richie earns a minimum of PHP 500 a day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Richie is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan for maintenance of her tricycle and also to add some items to her small general store. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation is really a need in their location.

Richie dreams to be successful in her business so she can give her children the best education possible so they will have a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of tricycle and buy items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, es una señora soltera, sus hijos ya sean independizado, vive con su madre, ella solo atiende la tortillería y la pequeña tienda que posee, la fundó hace 7 años, su madre le enseñó el oficio, el inventario de la mercadería que ofrece con el paso del tiempo ha mejorado, atiende a sus clientes de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Comprará bebidas, aceite, especias, boquitas, cereales, maíz, cal, etc., ofrecerá a sus clientes todo lo necesario en esta temporada, espera mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes y mantener estabilidad económica, su dificultad es la competencia en la zona.
Su proyecto es seguir ampliando su negocio, tener ingresos para cambiar su estilo de vida y cuidar de su madre.
texts.en:
Maria is a single woman. Her children are already independent. She lives with her mother. She alone attends to the tortilla production and the small store that she possesses. She began it 7 years ago. Her mother taught her the trade. The inventory of the merchandise she offers has improved as time has passed. She attends to her customers from eight in the morning until five in the evening.

She will purchase drinks, oil, spices, snacks, cereals, corn, lime, etc. She will offer everything necessary for this season to her customers. She hopes to maintain the loyalty of her customers and maintain her economic stability. Her difficulty is the competition in the area.

Her plan is to continue growing her business, and to have an income to change her lifestyle and to care for her mother.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, oil, spices, snacks, cereals, corn, lime, etc., to offer everything necessary for this season to her customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert es un hombre de 45 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 12 años, y se dedica al transporte.
Él es independiente, constante, motivador, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural que se mantiene como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo. Las construcciones del lugar son mayormente antiguas y no cuentan con servicios básicos.
Robert es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la cocina, y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. “mi propósito es darle a mi familia un lugar seguro donde puedan vivir…” comenta.  Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, él desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para cumplir su sueño. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a la misma labor. 
Es por esos motivos que Robert solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable, en su baño, cocina y lavandería para que su familia tenga un lugar seguro donde vivir.
texts.en:
Robert is 45 years old, married and has two children, ages 17 and 12 years old. Robert works in transport services.

Robert is independent, tenacious, motivated, responsible and hard-working. He works in the rural area of Sacaba, where the economy is based on producing grains for the city - here cereals, vegetables, fruits, corn, wheat, barley, plantains, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches and other crops are grown. The buildings here are generally old and do not have access to utilities.

Robert has dark skin, is short, and has short dark hair and brown eyes. His mother tongue is Quechua, which he speaks with his family. He also speaks Spanish in daily life and at his work. Robert shares his life with his wife, a cook, and their children, who are in school. The family lives in a house built with adobe bricks and has metal sheeting for a roof. The house has electricity, and water from a well.

Robert says, “My aim is to give my family a secure place to live.”

Robert’s dream is to finish building his house. He wants to have running water in his bathroom, kitchen and laundry and thereby achieve this dream. This is Robert’s first loan with Emprender in four years of building his house.

For these reasons Robert is applying for a loan in order to have running water in his bathroom, kitchen and laundry and thereby give his family and safe place to live.

loans.use: to have running water in his bathroom, kitchen and laundry and thereby give his family and safe place to live.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en: Girlie is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three children from Palompon, Leyte. She has been engaged in the food vending business for more than six years now. She cooks snack foods like rice cake, steamed cheesecake and others. This is the source of her income. Girlie is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, coconut milk, sugar, flour, cheese and flavorings. This loan will allow Girlie to cook more and sell more snack foods to her customers.  In the future, Girlie hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, coconut milk, sugar, flour, cheese and flavorings

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is a 35-year-old married woman living in the province of Leyte, Philippines. For more than five years now, Janeth has operated her small sari-sari or variety store business selling foods and other goods to the people in her place. Her store has given her the income that she needs to support the family. As of now, she wants to expand her business but she lacks capital to do it. With this, she decided to borrow a loan from CEVI to finance her store. The loan will be used to buy groceries such as rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, coffee, eggs and sugar among others. Janeth believes that the loan will definitely help her in realizing her dreams of improving her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, coffee, eggs and sugar among others.

loans.name: Josiema

texts.en: Josiema is a sari-sari store owner from the province of Leyte, Philippines. She is 47 years old, married and has six children. Josiema has operated her business for more than three years now.  She wants to expand her store. As of now, she is asking to avail herself of a loan to buy stock for her store like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents, cooking ingredients, bread and snack food, and others. With a loan, she will be able to improve her inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, she dreams of a sustainable business with a good profit. Furthermore, she wants to save money to support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents, cooking ingredients, bread and snack food, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Рано 53 летняя жительница района Гиссар. Она замужем и имеет детей. Рано 30 лет своей жизни посвятила торговой деятельности. Она на рынке районе Гиссар занимается торговлей женской одежды и обуви. Она любит свою работу и планирует остаться в этом бизнесе еще на долго. Ей нравится встречаться с новыми людьми и помогать им с выбором. 
   На данный момент у Рано возникли финансовые затруднения по которым она вынуждена обратиться за кредитом. Рано за счет кредита привезет зимнюю одежду на продажу и привлечет больше клиентов. С такими планами Рано смело обратилась за кредитом. Она верит, что Вы ей поможете, и доходность от продажи не упадет. Рано заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Rano is a 53-year-old resident of the Gissar district. She is married and has children. Rano devoted 30 years of her life to a retail business. She is involved in selling women's clothing and shoes at a market in the Gissar district. She loves her work and plans to remain in this business for a long time. She likes meeting new people and helping them with purchase selections. At the present time, Rano ran into financial difficulties, due to which she had to request a loan. Rano will use this loan to bring in winter clothing for sale in order to attract more clients. Rano bravely requested this loan to accomplish her plans. She believes that You will help her, and that her profitability from sales will not decrease. Rano expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Claver is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 6 years old, of whom 2 go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 12 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from the harvest will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 51 years old. He is married and he and his wife are blessed with children whose ages range from 21 to 5 years respectively.

Martin sells bicycle spare parts, a business he has done for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000. He has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 30,000, which he will use to add to his stock of bicycle repair spare parts.

With the anticipated profits, Martin will be able to repay his loan as well as plough some money back into the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to add to his stock of bicycle repair spare parts

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en:
Ezechiel is 37 years old. He is married with one child who is 12 years old and attends school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from his maze harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Phides

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Phides has been selling fast-moving foods and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She is married to Andrew and blessed with three school-age children.

She has applied for her second loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more potatoes and cooking oil.

Phides will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and attend school for dressmaking. .

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Felipa Cecilia

texts.es: Felipa de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad desde hace 2 años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de quesadillas el cual realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 6 años. Felipa desea construir una galera frente a su vivienda, la cual utilizara como cocina para preparar sus alimentos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, cemento, grava, polines y pines para construir una galera frente a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Felipa is 34 years old. For the past two years she has lived in her own homo with her children who are 11 and 15. She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns her living through her business selling quesadillas, which she does by foot and has been doing for six years.

Felipa wants to build a porch on the front of her home which she will use as a kitchen to prepare her food. For this reason she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheets, cement, gravel, poles and beams to construct a porch in the front of her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheets of metal, cement, gravel, poles and beams to construct a porch in front of her home.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 24 years old. She is married. She is a farmer and has been farming for 5 years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize.  She will then sell her harvest at a local market. The profits will be used to increase her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her maize plantation

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Steve has been running a primary school and earns a monthly income of 45,000 KES. He is married to Susan and blessed with three children, ages 15 to 24 years old. 

He has applied for his fifth loan of 60,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to repair classrooms and purchase more desks.

Steve will use the anticipated profits to open another branch. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable and, in the future, he desires to build  rental houses.

loans.use: to repair classrooms and purchase more desks

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 25 years old. He is married with one child who is two years old and does not yet go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for his maize crops. The profits from the harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his maize plantation

loans.name: Melchiades

texts.en:
Melchiades is 48 years old. He is married with four children between 5 and 20 years old, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from the harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his maize crops

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is 58 years old. He is married. He is a farmer and has been farming for 21 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from the maize harvest will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 42 years old. He is married with two children aged 10 and 14, both of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 12 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for his maize crops. The profits from the harvest will be used to pay school fees for his children.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his maize crops

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Trabajador, honesto, curioso ese es Julián un hombre de 50 años de edad que vive junto con su esposa y que no tiene hijos, gracias a sus negocios de venta de agua y cría y venta de pollos, puede mantener su hogar, y con el pasar de tiempo ha sabido desempeñar bien su trabaja convirtiéndose en el proveedor de algunas tiendas.
Julián buscando mejorar sus ventas, competir con los precios de otros distribuidores, mejorar sus ingresos quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de agua, construir un galpón que son los estaderos de los pollos y pollos para mejorar y consolidar su negocio. 
Su sueño es tener continuidad, sostenibilidad y mejor inventario.
texts.en:
Julian is a hardworking, honest, and skillful man. He is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and they don't have any children.

He can support his home thanks to his occupation. He sells water and raises and sells chickens. After a while, he has been able to carry out his job very well, and he has become the supplier of some stores. 


Julian is looking to improve the sales, compete with the other distributor's prices, and improve his income. He'll request the loan to buy water, to build a shed for the chickens, and to buy chickens to improve and consolidate his business.

His dream is to have continuity, viability, and a better inventory.

loans.use: to build a shed to fill it out with chickens to improve and consolidate his business.

loans.name: Nzembi

texts.en:
Nzembi is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has no electricity and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Nzembi operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Nzembi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her farming business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her farming business.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a young, hardworking man of age 30 years, hailing from the village of Kakiika in Mbarara district. He grew up with one parent after his mother died when he was very young. He was brought up by his grandmother, who also died when he was 15 years old.

He was working on people’s farms, where he was looking after the goats. Because of his trustworthiness, he was given five goats as gifts, which laid a foundation for his success. He has looked after these goats, which multiplied to become over 30 goats. He used these to marry and acquire land for his banana plantation.

Last year, he decided to start a business of selling green plantain. He is requesting a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy more plantain this season, when customers are in holidays, to increase his sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy green plantain to sell.

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.ru: Кобилчон молодой мужчина в возрасте 36 лет. Кобилчон женат и имеет 3 детей на иждивении. Кобилчон живет в сельской местности и занимается животноводством. Дополнительно Кобилчон подрабатывает строителем на частных стройках. Жена Кобилчона домохозяйка и помогает мужу ухаживать за животными. Сам Кобилчон хочет сделать ремонт в доме, так как дом в плохом состоянии и требует обновления но тех денег которые он зарабатывает не хватает на ремонт. На данный момент у Кобилчона трудности с финансами, так как скот упал в цене и продавать их ему не выгодно. Кобилчон решил взять кредит, чтоб сделать ремонт и с этой проблемой он обратился в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой. Так как мы предоставляем кредиты для строительства Кобилчон очень обрадовался и выразил огромную благодарность организации за поддержку сельских жителей.
texts.en: Kobiljon is a young, 36-year-old man. Kobiljon is married and raising 3 children. He lives in a rural area and is involved in animal husbandry. Additionally, Kobiljon works as a construction worker at private construction sites. Kobiljon's wife is a homemaker and helps him take care of livestock. Kobiljon wants to make repairs at home because his house is in a bad condition and needs to be renovated, but the money that he earns is not enough to cover the repairs. At the present time, Kobiljon is experiencing financial difficulties because livestock prices dropped, making it disadvantageous to sell livestock. Kobiljon decided to obtain a loan to make repairs and came to "Arvand" for support. Kobiljon was very happy to learn that we provide construction loans and expressed his enormous gratitude to the organization for supporting rural residents.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to renovate his house

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 37 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 9 years old, 2 of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the harvest will be used to buy food for home consumptions.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a hard-working gentleman from Kakoba central in the Mbarara district.  He is 39 years old and is happily married with four children. He is not educated and struggles to support his family. 
Last year, he got a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to start a business for his wife. Johnson operates a grocery store and also works on the banana plantation at his home.
He has come back for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to buy more groceries. He is a good client with indisputable integrity.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es:
Ana, de 24 años de edad, estudió bachillerato opción secretariado,está casada y su esposo trabaja de albañil y tienen un hijo de tres años.

Ana, es empleada de una empresa de telecomucaciones desde hace dos años, ella decidió buscar trabajo debido a la situación económica y para obtener ingresos mensuales.-El lugar donde trabaja está a diez minutos de su casa.
 
El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar medicinas para su padre, el cual sufre de una enfermedad terminal, de esa forma ella logrará cubrir su necesidad.

El sueño de Ana es, seguir trabajando para darle todo lo necesario a su hijo y ayudarle a su padre para que tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, has a secondary school education specializing in secretarial work. She is married and her husband works in construction. They have a three-year-old son. 

Ana is an employee of a telecommunications company where she has worked for two years. She decided to find work because of her economic situation and to earn a monthly income. The place where she works is ten minutes from her home.

The loan will be used to buy medicines for her father who suffers from a terminal illness. She will use the loan to meet the need to cover this necessity. 

Ana’s dream is to continue working to give her child everything he needs and for her father to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her father

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro, de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación basica; esta acompañada, su pareja trabaja de jardinero, tiene un hijo que vive en casa y está estudiando.

Milagro, trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por dos años y lo aprendió de su familia y decidió dedicarse a este trabajo para no depender unicamente de su esposo.- También recibe remesas de USA.

La distancia que camina para llegar a su trabajo es de 1 km. uno de sus cuñado y su suegra, le ayudan con el trabajo; su horario no es fijo.

Milagro, ocupa el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto; con esta compra ella, mejorará su condición de vida, ya que tendrá más ganado y le generará mejores ganancias.

Sus sueños seguir trabajando con ganado y buscar otras fuentes de ingreso, para poder darle a su hijo lo necesario para que estudie y tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Milagro is 25 years old, attended school until 9th grade, and is married. Her partner works as a gardener and they have a son who lives at home and attends school. 

Milagro works with grazing cattle, which she has done for the past 2 years. She learned the business from her family and decided to work so that she wouldn't have to depend fully on her husband. She also receives remittances from the United States.

She walks 1 km to work. Her brother-in-law and mother-in-law help her with the work. She does not have a set work schedule.

Milagro would like the loan in order to purchase grazing cattle. This purchase will improve her quality of life because she will have more cattle and earn more money.

Her dreams include continuing to work and searching for other sources of income in order to provide her son with what he needs to study so that he will have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase grazing cattle.

loans.name: Robai's Group

texts.en:
Robai is a 41-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of eight farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Robai has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Robai described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Robai’s Group will be able to plant a total of four acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jose Naun

texts.es: jose de 40 años de edad se dedica desde hace 6 años a la crianza de ganado, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo  que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, Jose vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganado y asi seguir con la crianza para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old. For the past 6 years, ha has made a living by raising cattle. He sells his products in different markets. The money that he earns allows him to continue to move forward. 

Jose lives in his own home with his wife and their daughter. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle so that he can continue raising the cattle and earning more money.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is 50 years old, widowed and a mother of five children. She has managed a vegetable production business in her village for almost one year and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 weekly. Due to lack of capital for her business, she requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizer for her vegetable production. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable production.

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is a permanent resident of Kakoba central, in Mbarara district. He is married, with eight children and four dependents of his brother who died years ago. He grew up with only his mother since his father died when he was still a young boy, which made his life difficult. 

Being pushed by the need to survive and to support his mother, Asuman started banana farming on a small-scale, on the land he got from his grandfather. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and income for their survival. 

Asuman is a hard-working man who has managed to start other businesses, like poultry. These businesses have grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependents and also manage to construct a house for his family. 

Asuman is requesting a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to complete the construction his house, so that his family can have modest accommodations. 

Asuman is hard-working and very resilient. He pledges to pay the loan well to get future funding.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his house.

loans.name: Yoselin Yanina

texts.es:
Yoselin, es una joven estudiante que vive junto a su madre y a sus 3 hermanos. Lamentablemente su padre falleció en Julio del 2013. Su madre para sacar adelante a sus hijos trabaja como vendedora ambulante.
Ella actualmente está realizando sus prácticas profesionales en una empresa textil, ya que ella está cursando el Tercer Ciclo de la Carrera de Confección de Prendas de Vestir, pero el estudiar y trabajar al mismo tiempo le dificulta continuar con su ciclo, por lo que tiene que dejar de hacer sus prácticas para continuar con sus estudios, es por ello que está solicitando el apoyo de KIVA para culminar sus estudios tranquilamente y así poder lograrse como una excelente profesional.
Siempre le ha gustado el mundo de las confecciones textiles, por lo que se siente muy contenta con la carrera que está estudiando, cuando termine su carrera ella está pensando tener su negocio de confecciones, para poder así ayudar a su madre con la educación de sus hermanos menores.
Ella está muy feliz con el apoyo que le brindaría KIVA a través de los Créditos Educativos de IPFE ya que es una oportunidad que no piensa dejar pasar porque la beneficiará en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Yoselin is a young student who lives with her mother and three siblings. Sadly, her father passed away in July of 2013. In order to move her children forward, Yoselin's mother has been working as a walking saleswoman. Yoselin was working at a textile business because she is in her third year of study in a garment-making program. However, it was too difficult to work and study at the same time, so she had to leave her job in order to continue with her studies.

She requests a loan from Kiva in order to finish her studies successfully so that she can become a great professional. She has always enjoyed making textiles, which is why she is very happy with the career that she has chosen. When she finishes her studies, she is thinking of opening her own sewing business so that she can help her mother with her younger siblings' education expenses.

She is very happy with the support that Kiva has provided through the IPFE's educational credits. This is an opportunity that she cannot let pass because it will benefit her in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: to continue studying garment making so that she can open her own business.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дильбар, 48 лет, замужем. У нее средне-специальное образование, уже 11 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Дильбар на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 7 овец. На участке мерою 1,40 Га она выращивает кукурузу и клевер. В целях увеличения своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Дильбар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Dilbar is 48 years old, married. She has a specialized secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to her hard work, today Dilbar's farm contains 2 cows and 7 sheep. She grows corn and clover on 1.40 hectares of land. In order to grow her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep. Dilbar plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is in his late thirties and is married. He has two sons who are both in school. For eighteen years now, Joseph has been managing a shop that sells second-hand clothing and shoes. He works from 6:30 am to 8:00 pm every work day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Joseph used the previous loan, which he paid back successfully, to buy more stock for his business; he needs to restock his shop with in-demand products to maximize his profit.

Joseph received extra income due to his previous loan which he used to cover school fees and food expenses. He will use this loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. He dreams of increasing his business stock and having special pairs of shoes. 

Joseph will make sure that he pays his loan at the scheduled period.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
For the last ten years, Joshua has been in poultry-keeping and he earns a monthly income of KES 40,000 (Kenyan shillings).

He is married to Asenath and blessed with two children, aged 15 years and six years. 

Joshua has applied for his second loan of KES 45,000 from VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use the loan to buy an incubator for hatching the chicks.  

Joshua will use the anticipated profits to repair and expand his house. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy an incubator for hatching chicks.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is a merchant from Palompon, Leyte, in the Phillipines. She is 48 years old and married with five children. 

Lelia is engaged in retail sales of clothes, fashion accessories, sandals, slippers, perfumes and cosmetics. She has been in this business for more than three years now. 

Lelia is asking to take a loan to buy more stock such as pants, dresses, undergarments, fashion accessories, slippers, sandals, perfumes and cosmetics. With this loan, Lelia will be able to augment her stock, thus allowing her to sell more items to her customers. 

In the future, Lelia hopes of making her business more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as pants, dresses, undergarments, fashion accessories, slippers, sandals, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 29 years old.  He is married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children aged 18 and 5. His wife provides additional income for her family.

He has been a mechanic for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 60,000. He repairs cars and motorcycles.
 
He has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya for KES 25,000 to build a garage shade so he can serve his customers well. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to repay his loan and buy some tools to make his garage more attractive for clients. Fred hopes to have a stable income in the future.

loans.use: To build a garage shade

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a mother of two sons, who are at school. She is married and is in her early 40s. She supports her family with tailoring, a business she learned after getting into her own life. Tatu is able to tailor dresses, trousers and shirts of different kinds. She can make up to five styles of clothes. She has been in this enterprise for 8 years now, working from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. per working day. She is able to make a good profit each month. 

Tatu will make sure that she pays back the loan according to the loan schedule. She will invest her credit to buy tailoring materials to start making clothes to sell. Previously, she used to wait till a customer presented an order with materials, this was due to low capital, which does not allow Tatu to buy her own materials. It has been a hindrance to her business, since it was difficult to capture other customers for ready-made clothes to buy. 

She believes that with your support her business will have enough materials and finally her business income will rise. She desires to grow her business more.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials to start making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a grocery business that she has been running for three years. She is 44 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with seven children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of beans and maize to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her seventh loan from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, be successful and see her children get a good education.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to the market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old. She is married, and together with her spouse they have 3 children. Her spouse does supports the family with additional income. 

Mary runs a retail shop, a business she has done for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has requested her second loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to add stock of retail goods for resale. These include powdered soap, bar soap, rice, milk, and bread. With the anticipated profits, Mary will be able to start another business in order to increase her source of income.

Her hope and dream for the future is to be successful and live a good life with her family.

loans.use: To purchase soap, rice, milk and read for her grocery shop

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 35 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 8 years; 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 8 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for his banana plantation. The profits from the harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his banana plantation

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has a motorcycle transport business in Eldoret town and has been in the business for three years now. He is 28 years old, married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with 4 children. He also has a retail shop which has been profitable and the income has enabled him to provide for the needs of his family.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of goods to sell in his retail business. These include rice, flour, detergents and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. In the future, he hopes to have a successful business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour and cooking oil for his grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a widowed woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanaisha has operated a fish selling business for over six years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Mwanaisha wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Muziizi Bakyala Tukole Group

texts.en:
Beth is a 46-year-old married woman with 6 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Of all her children, only 3 are in school. Her business is operating a drug shop of human drugs and she is also involved in a piggery business and poultry farming to generate more income. She started the business because it is in line with her profession. 

Beth has asked for a loan to buy human drugs and other medical facilities to use in her drug shop. She is a member of Muziizi Bakyala Tukole group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy human drugs and other medical facilities for her drug shop.

loans.name: Milagrito Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagrito, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato,debido a la situación económica de sus padres, no pudo seguir estudiando, está soltera.

Milagrito, desde hace tres años se dedica al negocio de venta de medicina natural, decidió dedicarse a esto, ya que no encontraba trabajo en ningún lugar.- Actualmente, tiene buena cantidad de clientes, el negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa, a unos cinco minutos aproximadamente,el horario de trabajo de ella es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:30 p.m. y lo hace de lunes a sábado.

Milagrito, solicita el préstamo para comprar más medicina natural para su negocio, ella quiere satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y ofrecerle variedad de productos, de esa manera lograra mejores ingresos y ayudar a sus clientes a que mejoren su salud.
 
El sueño de Milagrito es, tener un local más amplio y que su clientela aumente.
texts.en:
Milagrito is 27 years old and single. She finished her secondary education, but could not continue to study due to her parent's economic situation. For the past 3 years Milagrito has been working at her business of selling natural medicine. She decided on doing this as she could not find employment anywhere. Now she has a good number of clients. Her business is located close to her house, about 5 minutes away. Her hours of work are from 8 am until 5:30 pm from Monday to Saturday.

Milagrito is requesting a loan to buy more natural medicine for her business. She wants to fill the needs of her customers to improve their health. Milagrito's dream is to have a larger store and to increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicine for her business.

loans.name: Mtendere Group

texts.en:
Mervis is aged 52 and has 9 children. She used to be a farmer and obtaining loans helped her to start up a new business. She now owns a grocery store in her community that she depends on for her daily needs and the provision of her children’s welfare. She started this business in order to be economically empowered and to improve her family's living standards. 

She will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more commodities for her shop; this will help her to increase her profits. She plans on hiring someone to help her in running her business and hopes to build a better house. The loans have helped her to become independent and she is now able to pay school fees for some of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted items for her grocery store

loans.name: Edwim William

texts.es: Edwin de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y colocando cielo falso, pero con las ganancias que obtiene no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, cielo falso y pago de mano de obra para que el y su esposa puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Edwin, 39, lives in his own home with his wife. He owns a small shop located at his home. 

He wishes to improve his home by plastering the walls and installing a dropped ceiling; however, what he earns is not enough to do so. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and dropped ceiling materials; and to pay for labor. This way he and his wife will be able to live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and dropped ceiling materials; and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Claudia Maricela

texts.es: Claudia de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos 2 varones de 8 y 4 años y una niña de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. Claudia desea construir una pared en su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía una parte de ella está cubierta por retazos de tela y plásticos lo que no le brinda mayor seguridad además desea encementar el piso de su vivienda ya que en época seca las enfermedades respiratorias no se hacen esperar en su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Claudia is 31 years old. She lives in her own house,  along with her husband and her 3 children:  2 boys ages 8 and 4, and a girl age 5 years old. She is an entrepreneur who earns her living providing home domestic services. Claudia wants to build a wall in her house given that, as shown on the above picture, part of the wall is covered with fabric and plastic scraps which does not provide added safety. In addition, she wants to cement the floor of her house because, during the dry season, respiratory diseases are not long in coming to her family. Thus, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and reinforcing bars to build a wall and cement the floor in her house.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and reinforcing bars to build a wall and cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
While many young people in Africa dream of getting well-paying jobs, Ronald, from the Kisii area of Kenya, left his to become a full-time small holder farmer. He decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. 

Ronald is blessed with four lovely children who he refers to as his "heart beat.” His primary sources of income are maize and poultry farming, as well as some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income.
