Deciding to practice poultry farming for Ronald was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Ronald said. “It is in my blood.” For the past five years, Ronald has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and he wants to increase his poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Ronald is going to make more income that will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Ronald is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Loney

texts.en:
Loney is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children. She lives with her family in Palompon, Leyte. She is engaged in a poultry and hog raising business. Loney has been in the business for more than two years now. 

Loney is asking to take a loan to buy more chicks and piglets to raise. A loan will help Loney improve the productivity of her business. In the future, Loney hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and piglets to raise

loans.name: Chozvo Group 1

texts.en:
Chozvo 1 are a proud group of 10 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. 

The group sells its crop at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. 

The group in total farms 15 hectares of land. All farming is done manually. The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs - all of them purchase seed and some choose to also purchase fertilizer.

Access to a group loan of 28,460 Meticais (892 USD) equates to an average of 2,587 Meticais (81 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they need.

Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertilizer, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week - they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops.

Since ECA’s arrival into their community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase maize crops yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, a drip irrigation kit, chicks and stockfeed

loans.name: Karla Lissette

texts.es: Karla de 20 años de edad vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 5 años y un varón de 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que todos los días recorre las calles de los cantones cercanos en donde ya le esperan sus clientes gustosos de adquirir sus productos que son: papas, tomates, cebollas, güisquiles entre otros, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años. Karla  desea construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda ya que actualmente solo cuenta con un tapial de maya ciclón por lo que no siente que tenga la seguridad que desea brindar a su familia, para  ello  solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda y poder brindarle una mayor seguridad a su hogar.
texts.en:
Karla, 20 years old,  lives with her life partner and two children, a 5-year-old girl and a one-year-old boy.

She works hard every day walking the streets of the neighboring districts where her clients await happy to buy her products, which include potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and chayote. She's been doing this work for two years.

Karla wants to build a brick wall around her house since there is currently only a mud wall in wire mesh, and she feels this does not provide the safety she'd like her family to have. 

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron, for the construction of a wall around the perimeter of her house to make it more secure.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron, to build a perimeter wall for her home.

loans.name: Ana Josefina

texts.es:
Ana, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito y confía que tanto Padecomsm como los inversionistas Kiva responderán positivamente a su petición, lo invertirá en materiales de construcción para mejorar la galera en la que tiene la tortillería, cambiara la imagen del negocio y sus clientes esteran más cómodos cuando lleguen a comprar.
El crédito anterior le dio recursos económicos para adquirir una plancha para elaborar las tortillas, la productividad está aumentado, tiene más clientes satisfecho y apoya a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ana needs to request a new loan. She trusts that Padecomsm and the Kiva investors will respond positively. 

She'll invest it in construction material to improve the shed where she has her tortilla business. She'll change the business image so her customers can be more comfortable when they shop there. 

The previous loan helped her get a new griddle to make the tortillas. 

Productivity is growing, more of her customers are satisfied, and she supports her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to invest in construction material to improve the shed where she has her tortilla business.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 29-year-old married man from Jabalia.  He opened a small restaurant 4 years ago to sell traditional meals like falafel and hummus. The restaurant is located in a very crowded neighborhood in the city. Shadi would like to improve his business and  the family's living conditions.

Shadi took a USD loan from FATEN to buy new tools and  food for his restaurant. by taking this loan. This loan will increase his productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy new tools and  food for his  restaurant.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
Clemencia tiene 70 años, es viuda, vive en casa propia junto a su hija en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, de la costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frutas, así como también ropa y regalos. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio. De esta manera Clemencia obtendrá mayores niveles de venta y así podrá generar mayores ingresos para lograr una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Clemencia is 70. She lives in her own home with her daughter in the Zaña district, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. She lives in a community where the people work in commerce, livestock, and agriculture.
She sells basic staples like rice, sugar, oil, and fruits, as well as clothing and gift items. She has experience in this business as well as very good personal and work references in the area. She will use this loan to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, and pasta, in order to stock her business.
This way, Clemencia will make more sales and generate better income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, and pasta.

loans.name: Milfa

texts.en:
Milfa is a 54-year-old married woman with  five grown children from Palompon, Leyte. 

She has a scrap buying to sell recyclable materials like empty bottles, galvanized iron, metal, and coconut shells. Milfa has been in the business for more than 17 years. This is the source of her income. 

Milfa requests a loan to buy  empty bottles, metal, and coconut shells. This will allow her to improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy empty bottles, metal, and coconut shells.

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Callen, a very hardworking, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past five years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she has made, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. 

Callen lives near Nyamusi in the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming. Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat “ugali,“ or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. 

The Nyamusi area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize. Callen intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully breakdowns will be few and far between. 

To accomplish this, Callen is applying for a 60,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Callen sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a posho mill

loans.name: Aigerim

texts.en:
Aigerim is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is her story:

“A Kiva loan is a great opportunity for parents with a limited budget to  facilitate the payment for their child's education. Every parent makes  efforts to educate and raise a person who is not afraid of any obstacles, knows what he/she wants to achieve, have a kind heart, and desires to help others. My mother is that kind of person.
 
My mother is a public servant, who receives a salary from the state budget, which means she has a small salary. There are three people in our family: my mother, me, and my younger sister. My sister is school-aged. My parents divorced seven years ago, but  respect each other. We keep in touch with my father, but he doesn’t help us financially, he often helps us in other ways.

Despite the small salary, my mother always  emphasized a quality education. She often bought us various interesting books, which subsequently had a positive impact on my great love of reading in the areas of  foreign classics and human psychology.  I am interested in human beings and want to learn how  people think and live.

I finished the High School with advanced study of English, and with confidence can say that this school has provided a solid foundation of knowledge and skills, which helps me to solve life's problems. My dream is to get a degree at AUCA and be proud of my university and  knowledge. If I get a Kiva loan, I will do my best to study hard, and  justify the good expectations of my mother and Kiva lenders.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Julio de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 20 años al cultivo de plátanos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tienen clientes fijos, Julio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Julio is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two sons. He has been growing bananas for 20 years. He sells his product in the various markets and has regular clients. Julio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control and to improve the land that is shown in the photo. Then he can continue his work and have more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control and improve the land.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia al lado de sus 2 hijas de 25 y 17 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de refrescos naturales los cuales tienen una gran demanda en su cantón, además su hija mayor le apoya con los gastos económicos de su hogar. Ana desea mejorar la entrada de su vivienda ya que actualmente solo cuenta con un tapial hecho de láminas viejas en la misma, lo que no le brinda mayor seguridad a su familia, por lo que ella desea construir un muro perimetral que le permita resguardar de una mejor manera a su familia y pertenencias, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, bloques de cemento y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en la entrada de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana is 48 years old. She lives in her own house along with her 2 daughters, ages 25 and 17 years old. She works in the manufacturing and sale of natural beverages which are in great demand in her neighborhood. Her older daughter also helps with the economic expenses of their home. Ana wants to improve the entrance in her house given that they only have a wall made of old metal sheetings, which does not add security to the family. She wants to build a perimeter wall which will provide better security to her family and their belongings. Thus, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, and reinforcing bars to build a perimeter wall at the entrance of her house.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks and reinforcing bars to build a perimeter wall at the entrance of her house.

loans.name: Glenda Lizeth

texts.es: Glenda tiene 27 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos 2 niñas de 10 y 6 años y un niño de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que lleva el sustento a su hogar gracias a su negocio de venta de verduras, frutas y lácteos los cuales son muy solicitados por su clientela ya que ella brinda precios accesibles  y productos de calidad. Glenda desea encementar el corredor de su vivienda ya que es de tierra actualmente provocando enfermedades respiratorias a su familia, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda lo antes posible para aprovechar la época seca evitando cualquier inconveniente por la lluvia.
texts.en:
Glenda is 27 years old and lives with her life partner and their three children (two girls, 10 and 6 years old; and one boy, 4 years old). She is a tenacious woman who contributes to her household thanks to her business selling vegetables, fruit, and dairy products. Because she offers fair prices and good quality, her products are sought after by her customers. 

Glenda wants to add on to the veranda of her house. Right now it has a dirt floor which causes respiratory illnesses in her family. So she is asking FUSAI for a loan so she can buy cement, sand and gravel to make a cement floor as soon as possible and take advantage of the dry season, avoiding problems caused by the rain.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of the veranda in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more accessories for cell phones

loans.name: Hazina Group

texts.en:
Fatuma  is in her late 30s, married, and has four children, two attend school and two are young  She has  run business for five years and works from 8am to 10pm daily  to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Fatuma's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy drinks.  She drams of opening a grocery store.

Fatuma will share this loan with her group "HAZINA" which has a total of four members who  hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Sylinda

texts.en:
Sylinda is a 42-year-old married woman from Palompon, Leyte. She has sold  tocino (bacon) , longganiza, and chorizo (sausages) for more than a year. 

Sylinda requests a loan to buy more tocino, longganiza, and chorizo to  improve her stock and reach more  customers. In the future, Sylinda hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy tocino, longganiza and chorizo.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is an industrious, married woman with 7 children, they live in the town of Dulag, Leyte. Two children attend school. 

She raises and sells hogs and grows rice and vegetables to earn for a living. 

Juditha has requested 20,000 PHP to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides. These  materials will help to improve her yield, produce a high quality product and generate higher sales.

Juditha would like to expand  both business to improve her livelihood  and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase: cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheeting, wood, reinforcing bars, etc. to repair the roof of the house and to maintain the well.

loans.name: Wilmavilla

texts.en:
Wilmavilla is a 49-year-old married woman with four grown  children. She lives in Palompon, Leyte.

 Wilmavilla has had a food vending business for 8 years to sell pork barbecue to her customers.  Wilmavilla is asking to take a loan to buy  meat, cooking oil, condiments, rice, soft drinks, and other items. 

This loan will help her improve her business, income, and profit. In the future, Wilmavilla hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking oil, condiments, rice, soft drinks, and others items.

loans.name: Eclay's Group

texts.en:
Eclay is a 47-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader described as a very friendly person. She represents a group of 9 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Eclay has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Eclay described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

With this loan, Eclay’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 31 years old, residing in Sindangan, Zamboanga, Del Norte. She is married and blessed with one child, who is still an infant. 

Guillerma joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) on April 17, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of said coop. 

Recently, she accessed another loan for additional working capital of her existing business, to buy a variety of commodities in order to sell a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David, pictured above, has nine children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. David is representing his group of seven farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

David has been a farmer for 20 years, and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light. He is very happy to be getting the solar light, as it will enable him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, David is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 2.75 acres will be planted by David's Group, and between them they will receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, con la inversión del préstamo anterior ha mantenido materia prima para elaborar tortillas, sigue trabajando y generando ingresos para subsistir con su familia.
Ha decidido tomar un nuevo préstamo para comprar 10 qq, leña, cal y bolsas, surtirá el inventario del negocio para que su negocio continúe en el mercado, espera suplir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa with the previous loan maintained her stock of raw material to make tortillas so she could continue to work and generate income for the subsistence of her family. She has decided to take a new loan to buy 10 quintals of corn, wood, lime and bags to stock her business's inventory and continue in the market. She hopes to fill the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy 10 quintals of corn, wood, lime and bags to stock her business so that she keeps her business running.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy, a local resident from Kampong Speu province, is 39 years old and a mother of two children. She does rice cropping as the main source of income to support her family's condition. In addition, she can earn more income via teaching in school. 

This is Savy's third cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

Now, she wants to focus on her son's education, instead. Therefore, she applies for a new loan in order to pay for tuition fees for her son who pursues a bachelor’s degree, majoring in English literature. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a resident of the city of Taiz, Yemen who is 59 years old and a father of 11 children. He lives with his large family in a small house which is not enough to all the members of the family. All the members of the family feel inconvenienced from this condition. 

Abdo strives strongly to expand the house, but his income doesn't fully allow him to do that. He built an extra room inside the house, but it still is without a roof. Abdo turned to Al- Amal Microfinance Bank and asked for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement to make a roof for the room which he built.

Abdo hopes to have more space in his home to help his children live in a better condition.

loans.use: To purchase cement to make a roof for the room which he built.

loans.name: Ulkar

texts.en: Ulkar is 34 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by raising poultry and cattle and has been involved in this business for more than seven years. Her husband helps her in this business but their monthly income not enough to cover their family's needs. One of the most critical difficulties that concern her is not having a bathroom, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement and bricks so that she can build one. Ulkar's goals for the future are for her family to be healthy and happy and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her grocery store, by buying a variety of products to offer her customers. She is always looking for financial improvement for her household.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, ha logrado con ayuda del préstamo anterior tener una cosecha abundante y continuar vendiendo choco frutas y charamuscas, su familia se mantiene, ha cancelado sus deudas y mantiene clientes satisfechos.  
En esta ocasión solicita un nuevo crédito para pagar los costos de recolección de la cosecha e insumos para la venta de choco frutas y charamuscas, seguirá trabajando para mantener su progreso y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: With the help of her last loan, Rosa obtained an abundant harvest and continues to sell chocolate-covered fruits and sweets. Her family maintains herself, she has paid her debts, and has satisfied customers. This time, she is asking for a new loan to pay for the costs of harvest collection and materials needed for the sale of chocolate-covered fruits and sweets. She will continue working to maintain her progress and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: To pay for the costs of harvest collection and materials needed for the sale of chocolate covered fruits and sweets.

loans.name: Elena Yessica

texts.es:
Elena es natural de Huari, ciudad que forma parte de la Sierra Peruana. Ella tuvo que emigrar de su lugar de origen en busca de un mejor futuro en Lima, sus padres se dedican al trabajo de campo en Huari, ella tiene 8 hermanos y es la menor de todos. Actualmente vive con sus 2 hermanos mayores, quienes la estuvieron apoyando pero les fue difícil solventarlo por lo elevado de la pensión mensual. Estuvo a punto de dejar sus estudios por temas económicos.
Actualmente se encuentra cursando la carrera de Procesos de Producción Industrial;  debido al horario y a los cursos que está llevando se le dificulta trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, por lo que le es muy importante contar con el apoyo de KIVA para no dejar sus estudios.
Ella es una joven muy emprendedora, feliz con la carrera que está estudiando ya que la beneficiará económicamente y le permitirá apoyar a su familia en Huari, quienes se sentirán orgullosos de que ella pudo lograr sus objetivos a pesar de los obstáculos presentados durante todo el camino.
Ella cree que la educación es la herramienta básica para poder desarrollarse, por lo que considera la tarea de los asociados de KIVA como muy loable y digna de ser imitada, está muy agradecida por el apoyo que KIVA le está brindando.
texts.en:
Elena is originally from Huari, a town located in the Peruvian mountains. She had to leave her place of birth in order to seek a better future in Lima. Her parents are farmers in Huari, and she has eight siblings. She is the youngest in the family. Currently she lives with two older siblings who were helping her, but then they couldn’t afford to continue when the cost of their boarding house increased. Elena was at the point of giving up her studies for lack of money.

However, she is now she is studying Industrial Production Processes, but because her schedule and courses make it difficult for her to work and study at the same time, it is very important to her to have Kiva’s support so she doesn’t have to stop school.

Elena is an enterprising young woman, happy with the course she is taking since it will be financially rewarding and will allow her to help her family in Huari.  They are proud that she has been able to succeed despite all the obstacles she has faced.

Elena believes that education if the basic tool of personal development so she considers the work of Kiva and its associates to be very laudable and worth copying. She is very grateful for the support that Kiva is providing.

loans.use: pay for her courses in Industrial Production Processes so she doesn't have to stop going to school.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé le 27 juillet 2011 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du groupement du village elles ont également des liens de parentés, la solidarité de groupe est au quotidien de l’ensemble de leurs activités, de plus elles bénéficient en majorité de plus de 03 ans d’expérience dans le programme. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie. 

Madame  Khady (assise à l’avant dernière position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle marié, et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons et 02 filles. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois ainsi que dans son activité de vente de petit déjeune en bordure de la route nationale qui traverse leur village. Elle s’approvisionne en quantité importante au marché de sa commune pour la préparation des plats (haricot, petits pois, spaghetti, et divers condiments).
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter pour 80 000 : des paquets de spaghetti, du haricot, du petit pois et le reste pour divers ingrédients.

 Ses  bénéfices serviront particulièrement à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants et d’accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan association was created July 27, 2011, the day of its inauguration. The women who make up the group are all from the same village and share kinship ties. Group solidarity is shown in all their daily activities, in addition to which they have over three years' experience in the program. Their main activity is small retail commerce and rain-fed agriculture.

Mrs Khady (sitting in the penultimate position from left to right and raising her hand), is the group's featured borrower. She is the married mother of five children: three boys and two girls.

She has a good experience with the "banc villageois" system as well as with her small business selling lunch along the national road, which passes through her village. She buys in bulk at the municipal market for her food preparations (beans, peas, spaghetti, and various condiments).
 
She intends to use the new loan to buy for 80,000 (CFA francs' worth): packets of spaghetti, beans, peas and various other ingredients.

Her profits will serve especially in helping her husband take care of the children's school fees, and increase her savings.

loans.use: buy for 80,000 (CFA francs' worth): packets of spaghetti, beans, peas and various other ingredients

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Mbajue Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas Mbajue está en su ciclo número 18 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Es un grupo que viene trabajando de forma unida y trabajadora, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Angelica, quien ya hizo su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, es una persona muy trabajadora, que comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que hoy día hay mucha competencia. Está contenta por formar parte de este grupo, ya que le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias, como ser camisas, pantalones, jeans, shorts y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, ayudando a su familia por medio de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Activas Mbajue” (Active Women – Mbajue) is in its 18th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to move forward. This group has been able to work together in a unified and industrious fashion. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Sra. Angelica, who has taken the poverty elimination survey. She says that she sells various types of clothes. Angelica is a hardworking individual and indicates that her work requires a great deal of sacrifice. Every day she must deal with plenty of competition. She says that she is pleased to be part of this group and it has been a great help.

Angelica is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various types of clothes such as shirts, trousers, jeans, shorts, and other items. This will help her to continue her sales so that she can earn income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes such as shirts, trousers, jeans, shorts, and other items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a happy woman with a restaurant business. She cooks snacks early in the morning to  serve her regular customers  their morning snack. She sells snack foods and prepares a menus to sell for lunch.  Marites is experienced and able to make her food more delicious to encourage regular customers. She has many custumers to serve and sometimes runs out of foods. She is requests 30,000 PHP to buy pork, chicken, beef, and fish to cook. 

She will also use the loan to buy ingredients to cook dishes. Marites  looks to continued success in her business.

loans.use: to buy  pork, chicken, beef, and fish to cook.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de cocos, su negocio esta ubicado en la carretera cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cocos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman whose face has been pixelated because she lives in a high-risk area is 27 years old. She earns her living selling coconuts on the highway near her house. She lives in her own home with her partner. She is seeking a loan to buy coconuts at wholesale prices so she can continue making sales and increase her income.

loans.use: buy coconuts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is a 54-year-old married woman with eight grown  children from Palompon, Leyte. She has sold fruit and vegetables for 20 years and requests  a loan to buy fruit and vegetables. This loan will enable Nelita to increase her stock and attract more buyers in her store. 

Nelita hopes to improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Willhelm

texts.en:
Willhelm is 39 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is legally separated with one school-age daughter. 
Willhelm has been engaged in food processing, particularly shrimp paste making and food catering services, for almost two years. It is his main source of income to meet the needs of his family. He earns approximately PHP 15,000.00 each month from this work. He has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for kitchen repairs and spare parts for multi-cab maintenance. Willhelm has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Willhelm hopes to establish his own store for his shrimp paste products.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for kitchen repairs and spare parts for multi-cab maintenance

loans.name: Munyiva

texts.en:
Munyiva is 34 years old and the single mother of two children. She has a grocery business that she has been running for the past four years. She will be using this loan to buy fruit, vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes for selling. She anticipates to make more profits, which she will use to pay school fees for her children. 

This is Munyiva's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to buy a pick-up that will enable her to collect more groceries from the farm and supply more customers. She also hopes to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit and potatoes for selling.

loans.name: Bernarda De Jesus

texts.es: Bernarda de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su casa, quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso y cambiando las puertas, por eso solicita un credito para comprar cemento, arena, puertas y pago de mano de obra, ya que no tiene suficiente capital y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en:
Bernarda, 44, lives in her own house with her husband and daughter.  She runs a small store from her home.  

She would like to improve her home by concreting the floor and changing the doors.  That is why she is asking for a loan to be able to buy cement, sand, doors, and also to pay labor costs.  She needs the loan as she does not have enough money herself.  

With these improvements, her family will be able to live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement and pay for labor.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, is a 59-year-old widow with three children. She has owned and managed a a rice business for30 years and earns a net income 60,000 PHP. Her net income meets her daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient capital, she would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive and more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with three children. She has a grocery business and it has been profitable for the 10 years she has been in this business. She will be using this loan to buy bananas, oranges and pawpaws for selling. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of bananas for selling.

This is Jane's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to buy a lorry to start transporting groceries, thereby expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges and pawpaws for selling.

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gladys del Socorro tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de Buenos Aires, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. Sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal.

La actividad que realiza Gladys del Socorro es la crianza y venta de animales como pollos, pavos, ovejas, chivos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente crédito será para realizar reparaciones y ampliación del lugar donde cría a sus animales (corrales) así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Gladys del Socorro espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio lo que le reportará mayores ingresos y le permitirá incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys del Socorro is 37 years old, married and lives in her own home with her partner in the district of Buenos Aires, located in Morropón province, Piura region, on Peru's north coast. People who live there engage in agriculture and livestock-raising as their main livelihood. 

Gladys del Socorro's business is raising and selling animals such as chickens, turkeys, sheep, goats, and other animals. Her business is located at her home. She has experience in the business and steady customers in area who offer very good personal and work references for her. This loan will be to carry out repairs and expansion of the area where she raises her farmyard animals, as well as to buy balanced feed for these. 

In this way, Gladys del Socorro hopes to improve the productivity of her business, which will bring her greater income and allow her to improve her quality of life and that her family.

loans.use: To carry out repairs and expansion of the area where she raises her farmyard animals, as well as to buy balanced feed for these.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 28 years old. She is married to Justus and together they have been blessed with children whose ages range from 5 years up. Justus provides additional income for his family.

Nancy sells shoes, a business she has done for the last 2 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Nancy has requested for her 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya of 10,000 KES which she will use to add stock of new shoes, especially ladies shoes and sandals, for resale at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, Nancy will be able to repay her loan as well as plough back into her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to add stock of new shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted cereals

loans.name: Nyame Na Oye Farms Group

texts.en: Nana is a member of the Nyame Na Oye Farms Group. He is 64 years old and comes from Breman Esikuma in the Central Region of Ghana. He is married and has five children who are 30, 35, 38, 41 and 44 years old.  Nana is an orange farmer with 30 years experience and supplements his income by growing cocoa. He sells his oranges to local fruit processing companies but sells his cocoa beans to neighbors. His wife supports him in his farming business, which Nana entered because his family gave him a large plot of fertile land. He hopes to increase his farm size in the next five years by reinvesting part of his farming income, but needs financial assistance to undertake routine farm maintenance and maximize crop yield and income. He has requested this loan to prune his orange trees, and buy fly traps and fertilizer.  Nana thanks all his lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Quinter

texts.en:
Quinter is a 22-years-old married woman with 4 children who are 8, 6, 4, and 9 months.  Her husband, Peter, provides additional income for his family.

Quinter has sold rice for 2 years to earn a monthly income of 4,800 KES.

Quinter  requests 10,000 KES  to purchase different types of rice like  pishori, sindano, and pakistan rice to sell to her customers.

Quinter will be able to repay her loan and increase her stock of rice.

She hopes for a prosperous  business.

loans.use: to purchase different types of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a new business.

loans.name: Valentín

texts.es:
Valentín, de 64 años de edad,es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos ya se casaron.

Valentín, todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a la albañilería, su padre le enseño a trabajar en este oficio, el horario de trabajo de Valentín es de 7:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m.

Valentín, solicita el préstamo para comprar leña para venderla, de esta manera él recibe buenas ganancias y aporta dinero extra para las necesidades de la casa.

El sueño de Valentín es, hacerle algunas reparaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Valentín is 64 years old and married. His wife is a homemaker and his children are all married. Valentín has always worked in construction. He learned the trade from his father. Valentín's work schedule is from 7:00 am to 1:00 pm.

Valentín is requesting this loan to buy firewood to sell. This allows him to earn extra income to cover his household's needs, and he makes a good profit off these sales.

Valentín's dream is to make a few repairs in his home.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Yebes

texts.en:
Yebes a  41-year-old tea farmer who is a very responsible and hardworking man. He comes from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and good soil that favors crops and dairy farming. 

Yebes has farmed for five years. Over those years, he has been able to earn a decent and honest living. Yebes loves nature and has even planted trees in his compound so that his farm can be beautiful. He also loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows “Maridadi”, which means beautiful.  

Yebes is  enterprising and wants to increase the number of dairy cows on his farm because he has the space and  a market for milk. 

He requests 60,000 KES  to buy a dairy cow, earn more profit, improve his living conditions, and provide a secure future for his siblings. He plans to buy more cows and open a dairy shop, where he will employ other people to work for him and improve their own standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Angelea's Group

texts.en:
Angelea's Group was formed by 11 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Angelea, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 34 years old, married and has four children. Angelea has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Angelea isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, Angelea will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Angelea's Group will use the loan to purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Rom is a 43-year-old mother of seven children living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her family, she grows rice as a single source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. For Rom, this is her fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her farming to get more yield than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Damary's Group

texts.en:
Damary's Group was formed by 13 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Damary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 29 years old, married and has three children. Damary has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Damary isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, Damary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Damary's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Japheth's Group

texts.en:
Japheth is 48 years old and has five children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Japheth is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Japheth started working with One Acre Fund in 2010 to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve especially in the sense that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year, he decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills.

Japheth’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. With this loan, the group will receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Ahmed Group

texts.en:
Ahmed is a group of four women: Montaha, Afaf, Asmahan, and Nada. They applied for a concurrent loan of 90,000 YER from Kiva lenders.
Nada is the only member of the first group and is the leader of Ahmed. She is married and lives with her family in a very humble house. She manages a small business of raising goats and selling them. She started this business more than two years ago. What she earns from this humble business is not enough to cover the needs of the family so she wants to increase her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase goats to raise and sell. All members of the group thanks Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan and hope this loan well be funded well.

loans.use: To purchase goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Somai

texts.en: Somai is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled vehicle. He has earned a living as a driver for many years as a way to meet family expenses, but his vehicle now requires maintenance to stay in proper condition. For this reason, Somai is requesting a loan for 30,000 PKR for her husband so that he can provide better service by buying new tires along with a new body for his rickshaw.

loans.use: to maintain and upgrade her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Buhazhar

texts.ru: Бухажар 52 года, замужем, есть взрослый сын и 2 внуков. Бухажар в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2010 году с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бухажар, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 овцы. Также на участке 0,54 Га она выращивает картофель и кукурузу для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бухажар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений для выращивания экологически чистых вкусных овощей. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как хочет накопить средства на обучение и воспитание ее внуков.
texts.en: Buhazhar is 52 years old, married and has one adult son and 2 grandchildren. To provide the primary income for her family, Buhazhar is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business in 2010 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Buhazhar's hard work, today her farm contains 4 sheep. She also grows potatoes and corn for sale on 0.54 hectares of land. In order to further develop her business, Buhazhar requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to grow ecologically-clean and delicious vegetables. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business because she wants to save money for her grandchildren's education and upbringing.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to grow ecologically-clean and delicious vegetables

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el trabaja como empleado de una empresa privada, quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza, por eso solicita un credito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Santiago is 33 years old. He lives in his own house along with his wife and their son. He works as a clerk for a private company.  He wants to improve his home by building a room on the location shown on the picture, but his work earnings are not enough. Thus, he is asking for a loan to purchase cement, sand, bricks, reinforcing bars, sheetings, beams, and to pay for labor, so that he and his family can live safer.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, bricks, reinforcing bars, sheetings, beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Gulbarg

texts.ru: Гулбарг является 46-летним фермером из района А.Джоми. Она совместно с мужем занимается растениеводством более 15 лет. У них имеется сын, который сейчас находится вдали от них на заработках. Гулбарг и ее муж живут в доме одни. Они помимо сельскохозяйственной деятельности еще и разводят скотов. В данный момент Гулбарг с мужем обрабатывают почву и готовят его к очередным посевам. Они хотят посадить лук и картошку. Однако для этой цели они испытывают финансовую нужду. Гулбарг в связи с этим обратилась за кредитом, на сумму которого собирается приобрести семена картофеля и лука. Она и ее муж расчитывают на финансовую помощь.
texts.en: Gulbarg is a 46-year-old farmer from the A. Jomi district. She and her husband have been involved in agriculture for over 15 years. They have a son, who is now works far away from them. Gulbarg and her husband live in a house alone. Besides agriculture, they also fatten up livestock. At the present time, Gulbarg and her husband are treating the soil and preparing it for the next sowing. They want to plant onions and potatoes; however, they are experiencing financial need, preventing them from accomplishing this goal. Due to this, Gulbarg requested a loan, with the sum of which she plans to purchase potato and onion seeds. She and her husband are counting on the financial help.

loans.use: to purchase potato and onion seeds

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 35-year-old married woman. She is the loving mother of five children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing business selling fruit for the past four years on his cart. He is trying hard to provide his family with the basic necessities through his business. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Yasmeen has availed Murabaha of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new, bigger sized cart along with stock of fresh fruit to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase a new, bigger sized cart along with stock of fresh fruit.

loans.name: Gul  Nisa

texts.en:
Gul Nisa is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is not sufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her own business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. 

For the improvement of her business, she has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo and increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel: Es una señora jovial de 46 años de edad, originaria de Rosita, casada, tiene 6 hijos: Dos mayores de edad que estudian su carrera universitaria en Managua, una adolecente de 12 años que cursa su secundaria y una pequeña de 2 años. Su esposo es maestro y ella es enfermera con 23 años de experiencia. Con el propósito de apoyar al desarrollo profesional de sus hijos que estudian en Managua su carrera universitaria, la mayor de 20 años estudia psicología y el de 18 años cursa su segundo año de arquitectura, está solicitando crédito para poder adquirir un pequeño terreno donde pueda construir una casita para sus hijos, de esa manera los costos de estudios y estadía de sus hijos disminuiría y ella sentiría menos el peso. Sueña con poder llegar a construir una vivienda  en Managua para que sus hijos puedan tener mejores condiciones  para seguir estudiado con mayor seguridad
texts.en: María Isabelis a jovial 46 year old woman originally from Rosita. She is married and has 6 children. Two of the oldest children study at the university in Managua, a 12 year old is in secondary school and a 2 year old little girl at home. Her husband is a teacher and she is a nurse with 23 years of experience. She has the goal of supporting the professional development of her children that study at the university in Managua - the oldest, at 20 years old, studies psychology and the 18 year old is in his second year studying architecture. She seeks a loan to be able to rent a small parcel of land where she can build a small house for her children, and in this way the costs of the studies and lodging of her children will be reduced and she will feel less burdened. She dreams of being able to build a home in Managua so that her children can have better conditions to continue studying with greater security.

loans.use: to rent land.

loans.name: Antonia Deydamia

texts.es: ANTONIA DEYDAMIA: Es una señora amable, originaria del Municipio de Rosita, tiene 33 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: dos adolescentes que cursan su primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Desde hace 32 años habita en la vivienda de su mama, la cual es compartida por 7 personas. Con el propósito de independizarse y dar mejor condición a sus hijos logró obtener una pequeña vivienda de madera, pero necesita instalar energía eléctrica y construir una letrina, para lo cual está solicitando su primer crédito en Pana Pana. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas para su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia Deydamia is a friendly woman who originates from Rosita.  She is 33 and is married with three children.  Two of them are in primary school and the other is only two.  

For 32 years she has been living in a house with her mother, which is shared by seven people in all.  

With the aim of becoming independent and being able to provide the best living conditions for her children, she has managed to get a small wooden house.  However, she needs to install electricity and also build a latrine.  For this reason, she is asking for her first loan in Pana Pana.  

She dreams of having a house which offers satisfactory living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to install an electricity supply and build a latrine on wooden stilts.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Заррина молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 27 лет. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как ее родители не имели финансовой возможности для ее поступления в ВУЗ. Заррина 5 лет назад собственными усилиями научилась профессии швеи и стала зарабатывать на жизнь. Она шьет женские платья национальных фасонов и этим делом занимается у себя дома. 
Заррина живет в районе Вахш с матерью, двумя сестрами и младшим братом. Благодаря своей деятельности она помогает матери в обеспечении семьи. 
Целью настоящего кредита является покупка новой швейной машинки. Таким образом Заррина хочет расширить свою деятельность и увеличить доходность дела. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке для реализации цели.
texts.en: Zarrina is a single 27-year-old young woman. She does not have a college education because her parents did not have a financial ability to support her university studies. Zarrina learned the seamstress profession by herself 5 years ago and started to earn a living. She sews women's national-style dresses at her home. Zarrina lives in the Vakhsh district with her mother, two sisters and a younger brother. Thanks to this business, she helps her mother to provide for the family. The goal of this loan is a purchase of a new sewing machine. This is how Zarrina wants to expand her business and increase her profitability. She needs your support to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé le 27 juillet 2011 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du groupement du village elles ont également des liens de parentés, la solidarité de groupe est au quotidien de l’ensemble de leurs activités, de plus elles bénéficient en majorité de plus de 03 ans d’expérience dans le programme. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie. 

Madame Awa (assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est marié, âgée de 51 ans et mère de 06 enfants dont 04 filles et 02 garçons âgés de 02 à 12 ans. Elle est revendeuse de banane dans son village, elle achète sa marchandise en gros dans un village producteur par carton pour la revente par détail dans son village. Elle connait à merveille cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.

 Avec son nouveau prêt servira d’acheter au moins 500 kg de banane par carton de 20 à 25 kg  pour la revente au détail.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle obtient de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la gestion du foyer surtout pour la gestion des fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created July 27, 2011, the day of its inauguration. The women who make up the group are all from the same village and share kinship ties. Group solidarity is shown in all their daily activities, in addition to which they have over three years' experience in the program. Their main activity is small retail commerce and rain-fed agriculture

Mrs. Awa (sitting in the second position from right to left raising her hand), is group's featured borrower. She is 51 years old and the married mother of six children, including four girls and two boys whose ages range from two to twelve years.

She sells bananas in her village, and buys her merchandise wholesale by the crate from a producing village, to be retailed locally. She knows the business quite well, having practiced it for many years.

She will use the new loan to buy at least 500 kilos of bananas in 20 to 25-kilo crates, for retail sales.

With the profits from her business she intends to support her husband in managing household expenditures, particularly regarding school supplies.

loans.use: buy at least 500 kilos of bananas in 20 to 25-kilo crates, for retail sales

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: jose de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de cerdos, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde vive, Jose esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas cerdos y concentrado para continuar con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 38 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. He has worked for 15 years raising pigs. He sells his products in the surrounding areas where he lives. Jose is requesting a loan to be able to to buy more pigs and feed to continue raising them. That way he will be able to increase his income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed.

loans.name: Ester Noemi

texts.es: Ester de 18 años de edad es una joven luchadora que a pesar de los escasos recursos económicos no se ha dejado vencer y se gana la vida vendiendo zapatos en una zona de mucha afluencia de personas donde ya esperan sus productos, y es con las ganancias de este negocio que paga sus estudios en una escuela nocturna ya que desea superarse y tener una mujer calidad de vida, al lado de su familia. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre, su padre y su grupo familiar. Ester desea invertir en zapatos para poder ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes en esta temporada navideña que es cuando más se venden por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en zapatos para dama por mayoreo.
texts.en:
Ester, age 18, is a determined young woman. Despite having limited financial resources, she has not allowed her situation to defeat her. She earns her living by selling shoes in a busy area where people expect to see her products. With the profits from this business, Ester is able to pay for her studies at a night school because she wants to excel and have a better quality of life along with her family. She lives in her own home with her mother, her father, and the rest of her family.

Ester wants to invest in shoes so that she can offer a larger quantity of products to her customers during the Christmas season, which is when she sells more. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in women’s shoes in bulk.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 22-year-old single man from Beddya, a village near the city of Nablus. He works as a construction worker under temporary contract. This is the only source of income to the family. Yousef is also a university student  studying Accounting. He would like to earn a bachelors degree and find a better job in the future.

Yousef requests  a loan  to pay the university fee for this semester. Yousef will be able to pay part of his urgent expenses.

loans.use: to pay the university fee for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a bathroom with a toilet so that her family can enjoy privacy and good hygiene in their home.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz engages in buying and selling scrap materials like piece of galvanized iron, empty bottles, steel and other recycled materials. As an additional source of income, she has a hog-raising business. She is 47 years old and has three children, two still attending school.

She has requested a loan to acquire additional capital for her scrap-buying  business. This loan will help Luz sustain her livelihood. She will have capital to buy various materials for resale which eventually will improve her income and help manage her finances. She would be able to continue sending her children to school.

Luz hopes that both her businesses will be properly managed and expand in the long run to improve her family's status of living.

loans.use: to acquire additional capital for her scrap-buying business

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda engages in the buying and selling of vegetables. She buys at the same time and sells vegetables like cabbage, tomatoes, spices like garlic and onions, and many others to the people in her community.

She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She has five children and the youngest is nine year old. Her husband is a carpenter.  She has been engaged in that kind of business for more than 20 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of vegetables and spices.  Herminigilda will be selling a variety of vegetables and these could lead more buyers to purchase.  She will be able to slowly gain higher earnings. She will provide her family with a nutritious diet.

Herminigilda is doing her best to improve and expand her business to support the needs of her growing children, especially finishing their studies also.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables and spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Midus

texts.en:
Midus lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees. 

Midus operates a kiosk at the market where she sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She works six days a week. 

Midus has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO of 800,000 UGX to buy trays of eggs, crates of soda, sweets, biscuits, cooking oil, other kinds of juices, and a used oven. Her major challenges include high transportation costs and electricity, which increases her operational costs. Her goal and inspiration is to own a fully stocked kiosk and a fridge to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, trays of eggs, boxes of sweets, cooking oil, and a used oven.

loans.name: Eut

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Eut is 39 years old and a mother of three children. She grows rice on 2 hectares of land and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She earns income of about 37,500 KHR per day. For Eut, this is her third loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans and has gradually improved her living conditions. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her farming.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay the harvesting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Veronica's Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. She has 2 children and is married.

As a group leader, Veronica is representing her group of 9 farmers in Teso District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Veronica's desire to earn enough to send her children to school. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Veronica and her group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light

loans.name: Gulzhazy

texts.ru: Гулжазы, 34 года, вдова, мать 4 детей школьного возраста. Образование Гулжазы среднее, уже 9 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Гулжазы имеет 2 коровы и 50 овец. На участке мерою 2,0 Га выращивает фасоль для реализации. Она знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Гулжазы и ее детей. Так как сельское хозяйство для нее - единственный источник дохода, Гулжазы и дальше планирует его развивать. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для кота. Гулжазы намерена доходы от кредита направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что позволит ей улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulzhazy is 34 years old, a widow and mother of 4 school-age children. Gulzhazy has a secondary education and has been been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 9 years. Today, Gulzhazy has 2 cows and 50 sheep. She grows beans for sales on 2.0 hectares of land. She knows the method of running an agricultural business and can effectively invest finances into it. Her combined monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS), and this money is catastrophically insufficient for Gulzhazy and her children to have a decent life. Because agriculture represents Gulzhazy's sole source of income, Gulzhazy plans to continue developing it. She requested a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock feed. Gulzhazy intends to use the earnings from the loan to further develop her business, which will allow her to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed in order to grow her business and increase her income

loans.name: Saorb's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Banteay Meanchey province, Saorb is 59 years old and a mother of one child. To support her family, she earns income via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. She can earn about 14,300 KHR per day. This is her fifth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay the harvesting fee. She hopes that she can a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the harvesting fee.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kuon

texts.en: Kuon, 49, is a farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province and is the mother of five children. She grows rice on 3 hectares of land. She earns extra income by raising pigs. For Kuon, this is her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to buy a decent motorbike and to pay for labor to support her farming. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike and pay for labor to support her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is his story:

“The main reason for my applying for a Kiva loan is the shortage of money in my family. There are four of us: my parents, me and my lovely younger sister. My father is the only breadwinner in our family. He works at the judicial department. He serves as a good example for me and I want to be as smart as he is. Since the start of school times he has been supporting me, teaching, showing how to do something and doing sport together. This is why I think that it’s my turn to do something for my father, by which I mean being a good, educated and well-brought up son of his. 

My mother is a housewife. She does household work and helps my sister to do her homework. She is so attentive and she used to follow my achievements at school. Now I am also very active at AUCA. I took part in Initiation 2014, a New Year's charity concert for orphanages, Orientation Week 2014 and many other events. The most important event for me was a charity concert dedicated to one girl who had kidney cancer. We were able to raise money for her operation.

I love AUCA. I feel myself and at home here. I am ambitious and have great plans for the future. I believe that AUCA will direct me to the correct path, which will help me to study, to live and to work in a proper way. I hope that after graduation I will be one of the youth leaders, a good specialist in my field and the caring son of my family and my Motherland.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Kimsreng's Group

texts.en: Living in Kampong Cham province, Kimsreng is 34 years old and a mother of one child. For her living, she earns an income from selling gutta-percha (latex from trees) and raising pigs. She also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to buy more gutta-percha for resale. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more gutta-percha for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Negociantes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por cuatro mujeres (María Ester, Ana Julieta, Jhatly  y Reyna Nohemí), todas son de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de verduras, ropa usada y pulpería; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente ocho meses para gestionar préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Reyna Nohemi: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, tiene 33  años de edad, es casada, tiene 3  hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de verduras, queso, cuajadas, frijoles cosidos entre otros productos, en un pequeño lugar que alquila en el mercado municipal, pagando mensualmente C$ 2,000 (Dos mil Córdobas), de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos: papas, plátanos, tomate, chiltoma, zanahoria, frijoles, queso y cuajadas. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda y establecer una pulpería para mejorar su nivel de ingreso y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of four women (María Ester, Ana Julieta, Jhatly, and Reyna Nohemí). They are all of Miskita ethnicity from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who fight every day to grow their small business selling vegetables and used clothing, and running a small grocery store. The have been organized as a solidarity group for approximately eight months to manage loans with joint guarantees in Pana Pana.

Reyna Nohemi is a member of the solidarity group. She is a friendly woman. She is 33 years old, married, and has 3 adolescent children in school. For a year, Reyna has worked selling vegetables, cheese curds, cooked beans, among other products in a small place that she rents in the municipal market. She pays C$ 2,000 (two thousand Cordobas) each month. With this business, Reyna generates her own income and contributes to her home expenses and her children's study expenses. Reyna is applying for this loan to buy more products: potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, sweet peppers, carrots, beans, and cheese curds. Reyna dreams of improving her home and opening a small grocery store to improve her income level and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products: potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, sweet peppers, carrots, beans, and cheese curds.

loans.name: Gloria Del Rosario

texts.es: gloria vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su lugar de residencia, quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un dormitorio en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene suficiente capital, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra y asi vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Gloria lives in her own house with her spouse. She works selling fruits and vegetables in her home. Gloria wants to improve her home, building a room in the place shown in the photograph, but she doesn't have enough money. That is why Gloria is requesting a loan to buy cement, brick, sand, re-bar, and labor to be able to live more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, brick, sand, re-bar, and labor.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily used her previous loan  to buy scrap metals and timber for resale, and it was profitable. She has been able to repay the loan well, and she has requested for another loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of timber, metal bars and wood glue to sell.

This will enable her to make more income, and she will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.  This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she has paid her previous loan successfully. 

Her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy timber stock, metal bars and wood glue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as wood, polystyrene and paint, as well as making improvements to his place of work.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana es una joven de 22 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de artículos para el cuidado personal y ropa desde el año 2011, ella hace tres años decidió ser totalmente independiente en su trabajo y fue entonces cuando inició a comercializar productos y obtener ingresos para ayudar a su familia, comenzó con sus ahorros generados de sus empleos anteriores y poco a poco fue fortaleciendo su capital de trabajo.
