Ella se apoya en catálogos especializados en ventas de productos y su horario laboral es de 9 p.m. a 9 p.m. todos los días, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y familiares a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en la compra de ropa y en la adecuación de una habitación. Ella considera que esta inversión generará mayor credibilidad y cumplimiento a los clientes, así mismo una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es madre de un niño al que desea ofrecerle bienestar para ello su gran meta familiar es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Diana is a young 22-year-old woman, who has made a living selling clothes and personal products since 2011. 

Three years ago, she decided to start working independently. It was then that she starting to market and sell products, and get income to help her family. She began with her savings from previous jobs, and little by little, she strengthened her working capital. Diana relies on catalogs that specialize in product sales, and she works everyday from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. Her main customers are her neighbors and relatives, and she offers them easy payment terms.

At the moment, Diana is applying for a credikiva loan, her first financing she has done with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use this loan to invest in clothes, and modify a room. She thinks that this investment will improve her credibility and compliance to her customers needs, and likewise improve her quality of life. She has a baby and wants to provide for its' well-being. A big goal she has for her family is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and modify a room.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana, de 66 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y su pareja trabaja con ganado bovino.- Tiene seis hijos pero todos están casados y tienen sus propios hogares, con ella solo viven dos nietos. 

Ana, al igual que su esposa, trabaja con ganado bovino, lo ha hecho por tres años y lo aprendió de su esposo; decidió hacerlo para mantenerse ocupada y además obtener un ingreso económico adicional.- También recibe remesas de USA.

Ana, camina 2 cuadras para llegar al lugar donde trabaja. Le apoya su esposo, su hijo y un nieto; su horario no es fijo. 

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de doble próposito, esto le permitirá darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Sus sueños son poder seguir trabajando, para darles a sus nietos un mejor futuro y la oportunidad de que estudien.
texts.en:
Ana, 66, did not attend school.  She is married, and her husband works with cattle. She has six children, but they are all married with homes of their own; only two grandchildren live with her. 

Like her husband, Ana works with cattle.  She learned from her husband, and she has been doing this for three years.  She decided to do this because she wanted to stay busy, and also to earn extra income.  She also receives remittances from the USA.

Ana walks two blocks to the place where she works.  Her husband, her son, and a grandson help her.  She does not have a fixed schedule.

Ana needs the loan to purchase dual-purpose cattle (for milk and meat); this will allow her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Her dreams are to be able to continue working in order to give her grandchildren a better future and the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to purchase dual-purpose cattle.

loans.name: Deyris Daniela

texts.es: DEYRIS DANIELA: Es una joven amable, de 30 años de edad, originaria de Rosita, madre soltera de 2 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, se ha esforzado por continuar estudiando. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para poder cubrir los gastos de la monografía y el título de un postgrado que estudió durante 10 meses. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda, actualmente habita en una pequeña vivienda de madera que construyó en el terreno de sus padres
texts.en:
Deyris Daniela, 30, is a friendly young woman who comes from Rosita.  She is a single mother with two young children.  

In order to be able to raise her children, she has made an effort to continue studying.  She is asking for her first loan to be able to cover the costs of writing her monograph and obtaining the postgraduate qualification, which she has been studying for during the last ten months.  

She dreams of having her own home because at the moment she is living in a small wooden house which she built on some land that belongs to her parents.

loans.use: to cover costs of her monograph and postgraduate qualification.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a vigorous, 34-year-old, married lady. The man shown in the photo is her husband. 

Nagina has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

With this loan, she hopes to create a means of increasing revenues so she is able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 25-year-old single man, who lives with his family in the city of Hodiedah, Yemen. He studied through Elementary education, but couldn't complete his study. 

Khaled works in his brother's trading store for a small  monthly salary. That salary is not enough to cover Khaled's daily expenses. He decided to purchase a motorcycle to work as a driver, but he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, he applied for a Youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a motorcycle to work as a driver to transport people for a daily wage as a source of income for him.

Khaled plans to open an accessories store and to open a savings account at the bank.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to work as a driver to transport people for a daily wage.

loans.name: Amor De Dios - Valientes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMOR DE DIOS - VALIENTES” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lilian es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de impresora, tienda de barrio, venta de lentes, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lilian es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa de su madre a quien apoyaba en su negocio desde niña. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella está casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Amor de Dios - Valientes' will start their fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II office.  It is made up of eight members and is run by a group of directors of whom Lilian is the president.  

Among the varied businesses that the members have are the sale of clothes, printers, convenience products, glass fittings, and cosmetics.  The loans help the members small businesses.  

Lilian has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven years, since her mother, who is also a member, invited her to join.  Currently, she sells clothes.  She tells us that she started this business several years ago on her mother's initiative.  

The loan she is asking for will increase her capital so she can buy clothes in bulk from the wholesalers in La Paz.  Then she will sell it on her stall.  

This work allows her to generate an income to be able to support her family financially, as she is married and has six children.  

She tells us that the thing she likes about Pro Mujer is the training that this institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is single with two children who all go to school. She has additional family members. Getrude resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Getrude operates a bar and has been in this business for 14 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, and spirits to sell. She works in her bar seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. Getrude aspires to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, soda, and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Mashhurakhon

texts.en: Mashhurakhon is a hardworking woman from Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Mashhurakhon is a sewer. She sews a variety of national womens clothes. Mashhurakhon has been busy with this business for more than 10 years. She offers her service in her house. Mashhurakhon has regular customers, thanks to her high quality of service. She works hard but her income is small. She does not own a house; she lives in a rental house. Mashhurakhon must pay for the rental house but she does not have money now. She is asking for a loan to pay for her rental house. Mashhurakhon awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her rental house.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: Hamida was born in 1963 and is a widow. She is a careful mother of two children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 30 years. She has great experience in this field and runs her business successfully. Hamida is a repeated client of IMON. She has a good credit history and has used previous loans for increasing her business. She is very grateful to IMON. Hamida is asking for a loan to buy wood and coal to keep her house warm in the winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy wood and coal to keep her house warm in the winter season.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
35-year-old Yasmeen is a married woman with six children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. He has been running a food stall for a period of about three years.  He earns sufficient income to cover the family’s expenditures. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Yasmeen has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy crockery and utensils along with stocks of oil, spices and food items. It will help him to increase his sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy crockery and utensils along with stocks of oil, spices and food items to increase sales and profits as well.

loans.name: Juana Guadalupe

texts.es: Juana tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace mucho tiempo. Juana desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en  la compra de las ventanas para la vivienda dado que por el momento solo tienen el balcón y no es muy seguro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma proceder a la compra e instalación de las ventanas.
texts.en: Juana is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who has been selling beauty products via catalog for a long time. Juan wishes to give the best security to her family, so she has made the decision to seek a loan from FUSAI to invest in windows for her home given that at the moment they only have the ironwork and it isn't very secure. She hopes to be able to count on this financing and in this way proceed to buy and install the windows.

loans.use: to invest in windows for her home.

loans.name: Mirian Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Mirian Matilde, la socia sigue dedicándose a   su negocio de venta de velas, la socia continua vendiendo las velas de diferentes colores y tamaños a sus clientes que le solicitan cada dia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de velas grandes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Mirian Matilde, continues to work in her business selling candles of various colors and sizes to customers who request them each day. She is a responsible and hard-working person and wishes to continue working and this way continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase large candles. She feels grateful for the loan provided and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy large candles.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan, a mother of two schoolchildren, is 39 years old and a villager from Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she can earn enough income to support her family via rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 33,200 KHR per day.

This is the third cycle for Nan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for harvesting and transport fees to support her farming.

She hopes that she can increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and transport fees to support her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Laizoma Group

texts.en:
A woman of responsibilities within and outside her family, Hatkim, 57 years old, is the wife of a retired church pastor who was once the only source of income in the family. She is the featured borrower of the group and is pictured with her hand raised. Hatkim started a tea stall in her locality five years ago with the hope to gain some source of income for their family since her husband was about to retire from his pastor post. 

Hatkim prepared well to find an alternative source of income back then and her business was doing well. As they grow older, they have to pay certain medical costs regarding their health which leads to shortage of finances in their household. It disturbs her business with the unexpected outflow of her income, that is, out of their household expenditure list. While she was in search of financial help, she was told about WSDS by some friends who had accessed a loan earlier which can be repaid in easy installments. She was very happy to be in a position to get a loan which will help lighten her financial difficulties. 

Hatkim will buy stock of materials needed for her tea stall including wheat flour, edible oil, sugar, and milk powder with the Kiva loan. She will be able to run her business as usual and have a more stable business. She also hopes to save some of her earnings and invest them for health expenses. She says “thank you.” The rest of the group members are all energetic and active in their business undertakings. They all have a common goal to strive toward financial independence through the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat flour, edible oil, sugar, and milk powder to make puri (pancakes) and tea to serve the customers in her tea stall.

loans.name: Qahraman

texts.en:
Qahraman is a 41-year-old married man and he has 2 kids. He works as a taxi driver, work that he's been doing for the past ten years. However, his salary from this business not enough to cover his family's needs. 

His dream is to see the construction of his house completed. It's for these reasons that Qahraman is applying for a loan for the installation of potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house, for the well being of his family.

loans.use: to install potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house.

loans.name: Mazloom

texts.en: Mazloom, age 49, is a married woman.  The man shown in the photo is her husband. She deals in the business of selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 15,000 to purchase more cattle to increase her earnings to better support the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to increase her earnings to better support the needs of the family.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 54 years old. He is married to Agnes, and together they have been blessed with two children, who are both in college. They are 20 and 24 years old respectively.  Agnes is a teacher, and hence provides additional income for the family.  Justus offers electrical services, a business he has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Justus has requested  his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya in the amount of KES 20,000, which he will use to to purchase stock of electrical spares.  He successfully repaid his previous loans. With the anticipated profits, Justus will be able to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to continually grow and expand his profits.

loans.use: to purchase electrical spares.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
For the last four years Joseph has been selling and repairing tires and earns a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He is married to Benter and blessed with two school-going children.

He has applied for his fourth loan of 100,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of new and old tires for sale.

Joseph will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of new and old tires for sale.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is a 34-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Fozia’s husband. He has run a small hotel in his locality for about 15 years. He has become famous for providing good tasting food and earns enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Fozia has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 to buy crockery, table and chairs for providing better service to customers and earning better revenue.

loans.use: to buy crockery, table and chairs for providing better service to customers and earning better revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install sanitary facilities in her home so her family can live in better hygiene.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 36 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. She has a vegetable selling business and has been running it for six years.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of vegetables to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's needs.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 40-year-old married woman who, along with her husband (also shown in the photo), has been running a school for 4 years. Today, there are 100 students in the school, of which more than half are girls. 

Shabana wanted to contribute to the cause of education in her community for several years, and feels very happy that she has been successful. However, she is committed to continue to invest in her school so it can grow. 

She requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to buy chairs and desks for her students and to repair a classroom.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for her students and to repair a classroom.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is a tuba (coconut wine) dealer. She sells tuba to the people in the community where she lives. She is 61 year old and has three grown children. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. Aside from her tuba business, she also engages in hog raising. She sells hogs as supplemental income. She has encountered difficulties, in terms of sustaining her present sources of income.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 16,000 PHP to purchase pigs, pig feed and additional stocks of tuba (coconut wine). With these, Bernardita would be able to operate again for her livelihood. She will be raising healthy pigs and will acquire more stocks of tuba, for her to sell to her customers. In this way, she will be gaining more income and start to settle her obligations.

In the future, she hopes that she will always have good health for her to be able to continue managing her current businesses for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, pig feed and  additional stocks of tuba (coconut wine)

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat lives with her family in South Tajikistan. A mother of one, she is married to a master of house repairs. Saodat has worked more than 30 years as a teacher in a local school, but her salary is small, so she also operates an animal husbandry business, selling cows in a local market.

Saodat is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy feeds for her cows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy feeds for cows

loans.name: Aikerim

texts.en:
Aikerim is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is her story:

“When I was in the first grade, I was [struggling] with a lot of appearance hang-ups, my grandfather used to teach me letters, and numbers extra from my school. Going to school was a big struggle for me as I wore old clothes because my family couldn’t buy me new ones. I studied hard and became the best student in the class, which caused the change of my classmates’ attitudes towards me. At that time I understood that education was my power and my protection.

In the 7th grade I went to the Turkish High School for girls and moved to the town. It’s the time when I left my home and began living separate from my parents. It was so difficult to adapt at the new school, to meet new classmates, but I am too thankful to my high school for its good education and family spirit. It taught me to be strong in any circumstances, be a very goal determined person. My struggles paid off after graduation, because I got a Gold Certificate from the president of Kyrgyzstan for getting high scores in the national testing to enter universities.

Now I am a freshman at AUCA, it is the most prestigious university in Central Asia, not everybody can pass its entrance exams. As we have for whole my life, we are short of money and I am applying for a Kiva loan to pay my university tuition. I think that AUCA will help me in realizing my dreams: to be a good lawyer and then to be a Minister of Justice of Kyrgyzstan. I want to fight for people's rights and make good changes in this sphere. I hope to get a loan and be able to act.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Alba Cristina

texts.es: Alba tiene 23 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar. Alba  trabaja en una tienda cercana a su localidad desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Alba dese mejorar las condiciones del techo de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, madera y hierro. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Alba, 23, lives with her family.  She has been working in a store near her town for a long time.  This allows her to help her family with the household expenses.  

She would like to improve the roof of their home so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI so she can buy corrugated sheets, wood, and iron. 

She hopes to receive this loan so that she can improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets, wood and iron to repair her roof.

loans.name: Jamera Farms Group

texts.en:
Ben is a group representative of Jamera Farms Group. Ben is a 61-year-old farmer at Breman Esikuma in the Esikuma Odoben Brakwa District in the Central Region of Ghana. Ben is married and living with his six children. The ages of the children are 8, 10, 15, 20, 28 and 30. Three of the children are in school. Ben is an orange farmer with 30 years of farming experience. He has seven acres of orange plantation. Ben earns a monthly salary as a security officer as other source of income to support what he gets from farming. He has to farm because his parents did not have money to finance his education. Ben does not want the children to be in the same situation so he has to combine the farming and the security work to be able to finance his children education.

Ben is now faced with the challenge of finance to buy fertilizer, food, fly traps, and labour cost of pruning the orange trees to maximize output and harvest. Ben needs micro loan support to be able to maintain his orange farm to maximize output and income. Ben will use the income from the farm to improve the farm for better harvest in the future and the remaining to cater for the children's education. Ben thanks all his micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, food, fly traps, and to hire labour to prune the orange trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Maron

texts.en:
Maron does farming in the town of Tala, and has been in the business for four years. She is 25 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with one child. 

She plans to use this loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for use in her farm. This will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and also to repay the loan. This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loan successfully. 

Her future hopes are to grow her farming business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a conservative lady, so she asked her son Ahmad to appear in the photo instead. Randa is a 47-year-old mother for five children. One of them is Ahmad, a 21-year-old single man who attends university to get his bachelor's degree in Water Management and Environment. 

Ahmad is now in his third year and is doing well at school. Because of the rising cost of the university's tuition, Randa is requesting a loan to help Ahmad pay for his next semester's fees and buy the books he needs.

loans.use: to help her son Ahmad pay for his next semester's fees and buy the books he needs

loans.name: Sanga Tukore Namaani Group

texts.en:
Sanga Tukore Namani Group is located in the district of Kiruhura. The group is mainly comprised of women whose major activities are trading and agriculture. They fall into different categories, including divorcees, widows, single mothers and a few who are married.

Rashid is a 35-year-old resident of Sanga in the Kiruhura district. He did not go far in education so he started commercial farming in order to survive and also to care for his family. 

This business grew and helped him to sustain the family and support education for his children. He later obtained a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from Ugafode microfinance which has helped him to prosper. 

This motivated him to mobilize other members, especially ladies who had small businesses, to form a development group called Sanga Tukore Namani. 

This group is very determined to change each member’s life and has succeeded in many developmental projects. However, there are a lot of challenges, and that is why they are requesting loans to help them increase their working capital for their different businesses.

Rashid will use the loan to buy improved seeds and fertilizers for his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Obaatanpa Group

texts.en:
These women are part of the group called Obaatanpa (good mother) and have an average age of 40 years old and three children at home. They all live in traditional extended families in Chorkor, Ghana. These women are neighbors who work by buying and selling banku (cook corn and cassava dough), fish, rice, yam, plantain and salt. 

After successfully repaying their previous loans, these women of the Obaatanpa Group are on their third loan. Lovelace is the woman standing in the middle in the white top in the photo. She intends to use this loan to buy more yam and plantain to sell to customers. She buys her supplies locally at the main market, and makes her sales to diverse clients, both women and men, in cash and often on credit. 

She hopes to make a very good monthly profit, which she will use for school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy more yam and plantain to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar, aged 48, is a hardworking, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living, which is why she started a business selling animals 7 years ago. She purchases small animals such as baby goats and calves, and after raising them a year or two she sells them to the people of her locality.  

For the expansion of her business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha of 25,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats and calves to increase her sales and also earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to increase her sales and also earnings

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is not married but she has three children going to school. She lives in the Umapusa community, and her home does not have sewerage, but Juana is doing everything she can to get ahead. Juana's partner works as taxi driver. Juana needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she is planning to make cheese.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: David Favio

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 24 años de edad, soltero , sin hijos, y trabaja como cajero en una tienda de prendas de cuero.
Él es inteligente, responsable, sociable, emprendedor y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘villa fátima’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio informal y por las paradas de transporte público con salidas a poblaciones del norte de la ciudad, de clima frio y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
David es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Ayamará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. su vida la comparte con sus padres que tienen una casa construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad, en la carrera de contaduría pública. “trabajo y estudio, ya son 4 años que divido mi tiempo así…” comenta. Su sueño es ejercer su profesión en una empresa del ramo, él desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para finalizar su carrera profesional. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que trabaja y estudia. 
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para finalizar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
David is a 24 year old man; he is single, has no children and works as a cashier in a leather garments shop.  He is smart, responsible, sociable, entrepreneurial, and hard-working. He works in the zone of Villa Fátima, a place which is characterized for its informal businesses and for its public transport stops with departures towards zones in the north of the city, an area which is cold and windy; the winds arrive from the mountain range at a height of 3600 meters above sea level.  

David is dark-skinned, short, has short black hair, dark eyes, his mother tongue is Ayamara which is what they speak in family and he also speaks Spanish due to cultural and employment reasons.   He lives with his parents who have their own brick house which has a tin roof, drinkable water, electricity and a sewage system. 

He is studying in the university in the field of public accounting.  "I work and I study, it's been 4 years that I divide my time that way..." he comments.  His dream is to work within this field in a company within this industry.  He wants to buy a laptop to be able to finish his studies. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 4 years for someone who is working and studying.  It is for this reason that David is requesting this loan, to buy a laptop to be able to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to be able to finish his studies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. She sells fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for 13 years now. She makes a monthly income of about KES 12,700. 

She will be using this loan to buy bananas, oranges, pawpaw and cabbages to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more fruits to sell. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to buy a lorry for transporting bananas and vegetables to other customers in other places, and thereby be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello! Introducing Margaret, a 25-year-old mother who is full of energy and a very hard worker. She hails from the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, an area with good and favorable weather patterns that support farming. She is the mother of three children who are under her care from her marriage. Margaret completed her secondary school education thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents, but never advanced. This never killed the spirit she has for succeeding in life.

Margaret has been farming for the past six years and through mixed farming, she has been able to take care of her family. She loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows. Although Margaret passionately loves farming, she faces the challenge of water shortages. Most of the rain water goes to waste, which is why she is seeking a loan to buy a water tank. Margaret comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will assist her to harvest water during the rainy seasons and also store water for home consumption. Harvested water will assist Margaret to irrigate her farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops.

This loan will turn around the life of Margaret as she will no longer have to walk for long distances in search of this precious commodity (water), hence saving her time.
Come on, lend and support her today!

loans.use: to buy a water tank to irrigate her farm and for home consumption.

loans.name: Dromo Naa Group

texts.en: These people are part of the Dromo Naa (God's Grace) Group. They live in the same area and sell rice, oil, soft drinks, foodstuffs, frozen food, grocery and general goods. Mary Y. is a wife and mother who sells frozen food. She is requesting GHS 2,100 to buy more fish, meats, gizzards, sausages to sell to customers. She handles her family's daily expenses and supports her husband in managing their expenses. She has more than 13 years experience in this business and is applying for her tenth loan with ID-Ghana. Mary Y. works from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. The group has received proper orientation about loan and saving principals and promises to utilize this total loan of GHS 11,400 judiciously. In the future, and with the help of the institution, Mary Y. would like to expand her business and save money to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, meats, gizzards and sausages to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jameelan

texts.en:
Jameelan is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Jameelan’s husband. 

He is a salesman and sells his items door to door, which is the major source of their income. He sells different items like toffees, biscuits, chips, etc. from his bike. In this way he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses. 

In order to boost their earnings and to meet the educational expenses of their children, more income is required, so Jameelan has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items to inflate sales, such as soaps, washing powder, cold drinks, etc.  

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to inflate sales, such as soaps, washing powder, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 36 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with three children. She sells fruits and she has been in this business for five years. She also sells clothes and it has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to buy bananas, oranges, pawpaw and cabbages to sell. She will also buy clothes to sell as this will enable her to increase her income. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is Victoria's second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hope is to become one of the biggest suppliers of bananas in the area.

loans.use: To buy fruits and clothes for sell.

loans.name: Bike

texts.en:
Bike is a widowed mother of five children with one of them being born mentally challenged. She has been doing agriculture, mostly planting and selling all the wheat and almost 1/3 of the corn produce to bakeries and the rest of the corn to villagers who have cows, in order to raise her family. “It was very difficult to raise my children, all on my own. I literally struggled in every way,” said Bike to the Branch Assistant who interviewed her. 

Bike is about to prepare the agricultural land for planting and this is the reason why she is seeking your financial help in hopes that she will receive your understanding.
 
Bike has been photographed with one of her grandchildren, who she adores.

loans.use: to prepare the agricultural land for planting

loans.name: Fruit Of Life Farms Group

texts.en:
John is a group representative of Fruit of Life Farms Group. He comes from Breman Esikuma in the central region of Ghana. John is 66 years old, and a farmer, who is married with nine children. The age of his eldest child is 40 years and the youngest is 20 years.  One out of the nine children is in school. 

He is an orange farmer with a 12 acre orange plantation. John has 20 years of farming experience, and also grows vegetables and sells them to the local traders as other sources of income. His wife is a also a farmer, and helps John on the farm.  John  hopes to increase his output and fruit quality in the future to enhance the price of his outputs. He has to undertake routine farm maintenance to be able to achieve his goal and maximise his output and household income. John needs a micro loan to buy fertilizer, hire labour to prune the orange trees and buy  fly traps to have good harvest. 

 John knows that with your kind support, he can improve on production, which will bring total change in the level of his income and the livelihood of his family. John thanks all his micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fly traps and hire labour to prune the orange trees.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 24 years old, married, and mother of three little children. Her husband is a mason and they live at Kallutaca. Aida makes cheese and needs the loan to buy a milking cow. Aida and her husband want a better life for their children so she appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es: Rosa tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 13 años de edad. Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 7 años en su localidad. Rosa es una mujer responsable y sus vecinos dan muy buenas referencias de su integridad. Rosa desea reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir ne la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y hierro. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y así mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa, 36, lives in her own house with her husband and young son who is 13.  She has been selling clothes for seven years in her local area.  She is responsible and her neighbors speak very highly of her integrity.  

She would like to repair the roof of her humble home, so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy corrugated sheets, wood and iron.  She hopes to be granted this loan so she can improve her living conditions as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets, wood, and iron to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
For the last four years, George has been buying and supplying assorted fruits and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He is married to Clara and blessed with three school-going children. 

He has applied for his fourth loan of 60,000 KES from ‘Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of sugarcane, bananas, avocados, and sweet potatoes to sell.

George will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugarcane, bananas, avocados, and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon has been running his grocery business in the town of Tala for the past 10 years and it has been profitable. He used his previous loan to buy potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages to sell and he was able to repay the loan successfully. 

He is now 56 years old and has requested another loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of vegetables, tomatoes, peppers and onions. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his second loan term and in the future he hopes to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine used her previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of cabbages, green vegetables, onions and tomatoes for resale to her customers and it has been profitable.

She has requested another loan of KES 30,000 which she will be using to buy potatoes, onions and vegetables for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children by paying for their school fees.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Humura Abagambakamu Group

texts.en: Mary is a member of Humura Abagambakamu where members guarantee each other while getting a loan facility instead of pledging security. She is a retailer and at the same time a farmer living in Fort Portal Uganda. She started her business with hopes of building rentals in the future. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations like other retailers. Mary needs a loan to buy soap, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an icebox and use it to sell ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials to make traditional ropes from palm trees and sell.

loans.name: God Is Good Farms Group

texts.en: Kofi is 42 years old. He is a group representative of God is Good Farms group.  Kofi is a farmer and happily married with six children. He stays with all of his children and all of them are in school. Their ages are 3, 6, 8, 10, 12, and 14 years. His wife is a trader who sells foodstuffs and vegetables in their local market to support her husband. Kofi started farming about 14 years ago. He has a two-acre orange farm and plantain plantation.  In addition, Kofi also has a maize and plantain farm to support his family. He sells the produce of the plantain and maize to the market women as an additional source of income for the family and uses part for maintenance of the orange farm. Kofi saw farming as a lifetime investment. His future plan is to increase the two-acre orange farms he already has. Kofi is hopeful he can maximize his output in the years to come. Currently, he needs micro loan support to pay for hired labor to prune the orange trees and buy fertilizer and food fly traps. He is hopeful to increase his income to be able to look after the children in school and achieve his future aspirations.  Kofi is thankful to all his micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and food fly traps and pay for labor for pruning the orange trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor on her guava plantations.

loans.name: Baako Ye Farms Group

texts.en:
Eric is a member Baako Ye Farms group. Eric is a 63-year-old orange and cocoa farmer who comes from Breman Esikuma in the Central Region of Ghana. He is a married man with 12 children. The age of the first born is 37 and the last born is 10.  4 of his children are in school.

Eric has been farming for the past 24 years.  He also has an aim of expanding his 3-acre orange farm and, if possible, adding poultry in 5 years time. Eric was an Agriculture Extension officer and part time farmer, but now upon his retirement he became a full time farmer. His wife is a trader who sells fish to supplement the household income in support of her husband in catering for the family.

Due to his age, Eric has decided to take a loan to finance the cost of his farm maintenance to supplement his own efforts in maintaining his farms.  He hopes to maximize his income from a good harvest to pay school fees, health bills and other family responsibilities. Eric is thankful to all his micro lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to buy food fly traps, fertilizer and for pruning of the orange trees

loans.name: Adom Farms Group

texts.en:
Robert is a 54-year-old who comes from Breman Esikuma in the Esikuma Odoben Brakwa District in the Central Region of Ghana. He is the group representative of Adom Farms Group. 

Robert is married with 7 children, and all of the 7 children are schooling. The ages of some the children are 5, 8, 10, 13, 15 and 26 years old. Robert has a 5 acre orange farm. 

He also has a cocoa and palm plantation in addition to the orange farm. Robert's wife is also a farmer. She supports her husband with his cash crop farms.  

Farming has been Robert's desire and with the passion he has for it, he decided to go into farming after completing his first cycle education. He hopes to enter into poultry farming in the future to supplement the income from his cash crop farms. He hopes to fulfill this aspiration by re-investing part of the income from his cash crop farms. 

Currently, Robert needs financial support to supplement his and his wife's efforts in maintaining the farm. He needs money to buy fertilizer and pay for the pruning of the orange trees to maximize output, and thus his household income.  

He will be able to make enough profit to give the children a good education and meet his future business goals. Robert is very thankful to his micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for the pruning of the orange trees.

loans.name: Polewali Group

texts.en:
The Polewali Group is led by the 37 year-old farmer Arul, who is standing at the far right. The other farmers in the group are Muhammad, Agus, Mumu and Ari. They are standing in front of a BIRU bio-digester. Arul has a family with two children. All of them live in Benteng Gajah, a small village in Maros, Indonesia.

Arul is a member of Masagalae Farmer Group which is assisted by KSU Bulusaukang (a local cooperative – biogas construction partner of Yayasan Rumah Energi/YRE). He has been running cow-fattening farming for more than a year. He also operates a small-scale vegetable farming in his garden. His business is going well. He was concerned to see the cow dung polluting the water in the surrounding neighborhood. He knew that with proper processing, the cow dung could be a valuable product.

After socialized by YRE and KSU Bulusaukang about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, he was interested in using biogas. He become more convinced after hearing testimonies from his Masagale friends, who had already built BIRU bio-digesters and were satisfied with the result. Arul saw an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) to produce vermin compost fertilizer and sell it. It will increase his family revenue. It seems like the biogas program would be the best solution for his problem. But Arul does not have sufficient capital to purchase a bio-digester, a loan from Kiva will help him and other farmer group members to make it possible.

He have a high hopes that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He also hopes that if he can create bio-slurry related business, he can create a new job opportunity to his surrounding neighborhood.

loans.use: to build bio-digester and use the bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 30 years old and single. He is from Beddya, a village near Nablus City. He works as a construction worker with a temporary contract, which is the only source of income for his family. Osama is also a university student where he studies social sciences. He would like to earn his  BA degree and find a better job in the future.

Osama requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to pay the university fess for this semester.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 37 years. He is married and supports four people in his family. Together with his wife, they have been blessed with two children who are 12 and 8 years old, respectively.

Stephen is in the entertainment business through his pool game as well as his bookstore, a business he has done for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs 90,000.

Stephen has requested his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 40,500, which he will use to service his pool table, buy cue sticks as well as restock his bookshop. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

With the anticipated profits, Stephen will be able to open another book shop as well as repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams is to become the leading book-seller in his region as well as preferred pool-man in terms of services.

loans.use: to service the pool table and buy cue sticks as well as bookshop stock

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia Maruja pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III,la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo sus productos como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas y golosinas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maruja belongs to the "Illary III" communal bank. She is a responsible, hard-working member. 

She still has her grocery store business, selling products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others, to customers who request them.  She wants to keep working to continue supporting her family in this way.

Maruja is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks and snacks. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Kinyamangi  United Traders Group

texts.en: Richard is a member of the Kinyamangi United Traders where members guarantee one another for a loan. He is aged 48 and married with six children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. He sells produce and at the same time has a retail shop. He faces challenges of customers delaying to pay him yet he needs the money to reinvest into the business. He hopes to build a permanent house for his family. Richard needs a loan to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.name: Doerica

texts.en:
Doerica is 49 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children of 21 and 15 years respectively.

Doerica is a farmer as well as a clothes vendor, businesses she has done for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of kshs. 45,000.

Doerica has requested for her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 36,000 which she will use to add stock of chicken for resale at a profit. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

With the anticipated profits, Doerica will be able to expand her farming business.

Her hope and dream for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami is a 51-year-old married man with two children. He has 25 years of good experience in the agriculture  sector. Nizami’s wife helps him. They sells their crops in the local bazaar everyday. Nizami has good clients in the bazaar. His monthly income is 150 AZN in this business. But this profit is not enough to support his family’s needs. Nizami wants to increase his business. He needs to buy new trees and mineral fertilizers. Nizami applied for a 700 AZN loan from Kiva. He hopes lenders will help him.

loans.use: to buy new trees and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Payvasta

texts.en:
Payvasta is married and has three children.  She is an industrious woman.  Her husband is a taxi driver. Payvasta sells children's clothes, which she has been doing for more than seven years. She buys clothes in a bulk and sells in a local market where she has a store. Payvasta’s husband helps her with managing business. 

Payvasta requested a loan for $1,800, which she will use to buy clothes to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Ruteete Twimukye Group

texts.en: Teddy is a member of Ruteete Twimukye Group where members guarantees each other. She is aged 64 with eight children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She is a retailer and a farmer growing maize, the business she started with a hope of generating enough income. She faces challenges of customers who default. However, she has hopes of building rentals as a way of diversifying her business. Teddy needs a loan to add stock of cooking oil, posho, sugar, match boxes and salt for sale.

loans.use: to add stock of cooking oil, posho, sugar, match boxes and salt for sale.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia Inés pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de comida, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz entre otros.
texts.en: Inés is a member of the communal bank ILLARY III. She continues selling food and feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make all of her payments. She has had her business for a good while and it is going well thanks to the dedication she puts in towards it every day. She wants to be able to keep working so she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy oil, rice and such.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice and such.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia se dedica a su  negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina belongs to the communal bank Illary III. She has a grocery store. She has worked years in this business which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in each day to her business. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, and more. She wants to continue working in this way in order to continue supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy rice, soft drinks, and more. She is grateful for the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, and more for her grocery store

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 27-year-old young woman, who is a mother of two daughters. Her husband is the only breadwinner in the family; he works as a watchman and earns 150 GEL monthly. Khatuna and her husband also cultivate a plot of agricultural land and take care of chickens.

The family doesn't have enough income to cover even basic needs and live in poverty. She also is pregnant and they require additional income for their welfare. Khatuna requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting dairy farming but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan.

Khatuna requested a loan from Credo to buy a milking cow and generate her own income. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. She will produce milk products for selling and for family use also.

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow and generate her own income.

loans.name: Conrad

texts.en:
Conrad is married and has four children who attend school. For the last 10 years, he has been supplying bread to the shops near his area of residence. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Conrad requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 22,500 KES, which he will use to buy crates of bread to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. He hopes to expand his business and start selling bread in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of bread

loans.name: Reina De Jesus

texts.es: Reina tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 12 años y 3 años de edad. Reina se gana la vida mediante la venta de tortillas, dicho negocio es el que el permite dar  a su familia lo necesario. Con el deseo de brinda mayor seguridad a su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de  lámina galvanizada, madera y hierro para proceder a la mejora del techo lo antes posible.
texts.en: Reina is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her two children of 12 and 13 years of age. Reina earns a living by selling tortillas. This business is what allows her to give her family the necessities. With the hope of providing her family with greater security she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheet metal, wood and iron to proceed with the roof improvement as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized sheet metal, wood and iron to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid.

loans.name: Oysuluv

texts.en:
Oysuluv is 50 years old, widowed, and has one child. She is a hardworking woman. She has a medical education and is a midwife in a maternity hospital, which she has been doing for 20 years. Oysuluv likes her job because she helps to bring babies to life. She is one of the best midwifes and has a great amount of experience. 

Oysuluv has a small salary and it is not enough for her to live. Her son does not have a job in Tajikistan and plans to go to Russia to find job. Oysuluv requested a loan for 5,000 Somoni, which he will use to buy an airplane ticket for her son to go to Russia.

loans.use: to purchase an airplane ticket for her son

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 47-year-old married woman from the Abasha district. She lives with her son, who is temporarily unemployed. To make some income for her family, Liana works hard and takes care of a milk cow and pigs. She sells milk products locally, but the income is insignificant for covering daily expenses. 

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  So she decided to start a business of trading in clothing with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Liana’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo-Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

Liana will sell clothes in her community with price mark-ups and will generate income for her family's welfare. She will be really grateful for the help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To start a business of trading in clothing and increase her income

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III,la socia continua con su negocio de bar y picantería, la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo sopas, pollo  al horno, saltados entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.                              
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar aceite, arroz, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Illary III. She continues her work at her bar and restaurant business. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the loan payments. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues selling soups, baked chicken, stir-fry, and more for all the customers that make requests, and this is the way she supports her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy oil, rice, beans, and other items.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, and other items

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old. He is single, but supports three dependents.

Joseph sells phone accessories, a business he has done for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Joseph has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 30,000, which he will use to add stocks of phone accessories.

With the anticipated profits, Joseph will be able to repay his loan as well as restock his business. His hope and dream for the future is to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to add stocks of phone accessories.

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en:
Gazala has successfully built her general store with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has attained a good number of customers and earns a good income to contribute to the family. 

Gazala requested her seventh loan for 24,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to more customers. She hopes to generate a healthier source of income.

Gazala's husband is also shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan has successfully built her milk sales business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has obtained a good number of customers and made a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to supply more customers. This will enable her to increase her sales and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to supply more customers.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group

texts.en:
Kamu Kamu w/g  group is located in a village in Rakai District. It is comprised of five members, namely Polito, Jesca, Fred, Peter, and Godfrey. They do different activities like farming and trading,  among others.

Polito is a member of Kamu Kamu, trading in fish. He is married, aged 43 with seven children. Five study at different schools. 

His business is more profitable and he uses the loan to boost the business. His  clients are traders from urban areas. He hopes to buy a car for the business and educate his children. 

Polito is facing a problem of limited capital and fish going bad. He will overcome this problem in a very short while after acquiring the loan with which he wants to buy a freezer to keep his fish fresh. 

His client describe him  as trustworthy and hardworking, and he appreciates the services offered.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for preserving fish

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Carlos sigue dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte a sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio es una persona responsable y  empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas.
El socio se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Carlos is a member of the "Illary III" village bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. Carlos continues providing transportation services to his customers. He is responsible and diligent, being this way how he helps his family get ahead. The member is asking for this loan to purchase tires. He promises to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: To purchase tires.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo trabajador y unido se formo con la unión de mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza quieren ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elva, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que está en un nivel medio de pobreza. Ella a través del trabajo que hace que es la venta de ropa viene ayudando a su familia. Quiere ir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
This hardworking and unified group was formed as a result of working and determined women who decided to join together. Through the poverty elimination program, they want to overcome their poverty situation.

One of the members is Sra. Elva. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 2 poverty level, which means that she is at a moderate level of poverty. Through her work of selling clothes, she is able to help her family. Elva wants to grow and improve each day.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes. This will allow her to continue her work just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received since she will be able to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to make jackets, vests and blankets.

loans.name: Drwisha*. Group

texts.en:
This group is called Drwisha*. It consists of  four women from Hodeidah city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Drwisha is the leader of the group. She is 27 years old and married with three children, living with her family in an old house. The house needs renovation on the inside because it is very old. 

Drwisha works as a housewife and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. His income is not enough to make the necessary renovations on the house.

For this reason, Drwisha applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase construction materials like cement and sand to renovate the house.

She hopes to build the second floor and finish it with all home appliances and furniture.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials like cement and sand to renovate the house.

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub is a 54-year-old farmer. He is married and has two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Teyyub has been working as a farmer for 6 years and has good experience in this area. He raises seasonal fruits and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is about 200 AZN.

Growing and selling fruits has expanded in Azerbaijan. People sell seasonal fruits at the local bazaar. Buyers use fruits to make delicious kinds of jam, pies, cakes and juice. They also use dry fruits because they are very good for health. 

Teyyub’s situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem, productivity has fallen and he can’t cover his family’s needs. 

He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water for his garden weekly. This will increase productivity again and the family’s income will increase.

loans.use: to supply water for his garden weekly.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene una hermosa familia de 3 hijos, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá, este padre de familia tiene  34 años de edad.
Rodolfo es una persona que es muy  dedicado a su trabajo, esto lo hace  para que su familia tenga lo necesario, pues para la generación de sus ingresos él  trabaja como mecánico, este oficio lo aprendió desde hace 12 años,  esta iniciativa  fue porque en la comunidad donde él vive no  existen muchos talleres, esto fue lo que lo motivo a Rodolfo. 
Rodolfo siempre piensa en su familia, pues  una de las necesidades que se le presenta a él ahora es la remodelación de una cuarto, para poder darle uso, pero para realizar este trabajo, él solicita un préstamo por que él no tiene dinero para comprar los insumos. Pues para pagar el préstamo, Rodolfo tendrá el apoyo de su esposa ya que ella para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la  elaboración de bisutería (productos hechos en mostacilla.)
Pues Rodolfo y su esposa se estarían apoyando en pagar este préstamo, esto lo hacen porque aman a su familia
texts.en:
Rodolfo has a beautiful family of 3 children living in the community of Sololá. This father is 34 years old.

Rodolfo is a person who is very dedicated to his work so that his family has everything that it needs. In order to earn money he works as a mechanic. He learned the work 12 years ago. In the community where Rodolfo lives there are not many workshops which is what motivated this initiative.

Rodolfo always thinks of his family. One of the needs that presents itself now is the remodeling of a room in order to use it. He is applying for a loan to do the work because he does not have the money to buy the supplies. In order to repay the loan Rudolfo will have the help of his wife as she earns money making costume jewelry (made of beads). 

Rodolfo and his wife would support making payments on this loan. They do this because they love their family.

loans.use: to remodel their home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first per-paid micro-grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid.

loans.name: Maria Mirian

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 12 años, 5 años y de dos meses de edad. María es una mujer trabajadora y responsable quien trabaja en servicios doméstico desde hace mucho tiempo. Su esposo es empelado en una empresa cercana a su localidad y le apoya en la economía. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: lámina, arena, ladrillo, cemento y hierro. espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband and their three children (ages 12, 5, and 2 months). She is a hardworking and responsible woman who has been providing housekeeping services for a long time. Her husband is employed at a company near their town and he contributes to the finances.

Wanting to improve her conditions, María decided to request this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the construction of a room. She needs to buy materials such as metal sheets, sand, bricks, cement, and iron. María hopes to have this support so that she can provide better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, sand, bricks, cement, and iron in order to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther tiene 35 años de edad, es casada. Su familia es unida, vive con su esposo e hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Maria Esther se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi desde hace 04 años, cuenta con clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento y reparación de sus 2 vehículos (mototaxis) que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado, de esta manera Maria Esther espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y hacer crecer más su negocio, por ende logrará obtener mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Esther is 35 years old, and married. Her family is united, she lives with her husband and children in her own house located in the district of Zana, in the Chiclayo province  in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The population in this district works primarily in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. Maria Esther has offered public transportation in her motorcyle taxi for the past four years. She has regular clients in the area, who provide very good personal and professional references of her. She is asking for a loan to perform adequate maintenance and repairs to her 2 vehicles (motorcycle taxis,) which are currently in poor condition. This way, Maria Esther hopes to bring a better service to her clients and grow her business, thus obtaining better earnings and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To perform adequate maintenance and repairs of her two vehicles (motorcycle taxis) which are currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos Enrique es una personas muy responsable, el vive en Solola, a sus 26 años de edad se junto con su esposa y ahora tiene un hijo de tan solo un año de edad, Carlos es un hombre muy  optimista  que sueña realizar muchas  cosas en el futuro. 

Este abnegado señor se dedica a la elaboración de planos para construcción de casas, él desde pequeño siempre anhelo este trabajo, pues con la ayuda de sus padres pudo ser realidad sus sueños, Pues él cada día siempre piensa en su familia,  y lo que Carlos quiere es darle a su familia una casa, ya que su pareja y su hija necesitan de  un hogar, Pero Carlos no cuenta con suficiente capital para comprar materiales para construcción,  pues él está buscando la manera de conseguir un préstamo para que el pueda empezar la construcción de una pequeña casa.
 
Las expectativas de Carlos es conseguir el préstamo y hacer realidad sus sueños al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique is a very responsible person.  He lives in Sololá Guatemala.  He married his wife when he was 26, and now he has a one-year-old child.  Carlos is an optimistic man who dreams of doing many things in the future.

This self-sacrificing gentleman designs house plans.  He aspired to this work from a young age, and with his parents’ help he was able to make his dreams a reality.

Carlos is always thinking of his family, and he wants to give them a house, as his wife and daughter need a home.  But Carlos doesn’t have enough capital for purchasing the construction materials, so he is looking for a way to get a loan so that he can begin building a small house.  Carlos hopes to get the loan and make his dreams a reality, along with his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Trabajando Unidos Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Trabajando Unidos” está conformada por 06 socias comprometidas y responsables.  Este es el caso de Nery de 48 años de edad es separada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a dicha labor lo cual le permite educar a sus menores hijos. Su mayor anhelo es contar con su propio taller ya que hasta el momento lo viene alquilando. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de hilos, telas y tijeras. El grupo “Trabajando Unidos” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Nery se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo negro.
texts.en:
This is the Trabajando Unidos communal bank. It is made up of 6 committed and responsible members. This is the case of Nery who is 48 years old and separated with 3 dependent children.

She works making clothing. She has been doing this for more than 10 years which enables her to educate her minor children.

Her biggest dream is to have her own workshop as up to now she has been renting. She is asking for a loan to buy thread, fabric, and scissors.
